Reviews.Title: “4 Nights at the Amira”
Reviews.Author: TravelMan90277
Reviews.Content: A really comfortable bed at a very nice hotel, even if the white/burgundy/gray color scheme in the room seems dated. Our room, on the corner of the hotel, had lots of windows and was very pleasant, though with the burgundy/red velvet drapes closed, there was something of a bordello feel to the room. The bathroom was great except that the shower drain was VERY slow. We noticed the drain in the bathroom sink off the dining area was also slow. Staff attempted without success to attend to our shower drain, blaming it on the building's old plumbing. The staff is very helpful and friendly, and the breakfast is very good, though the dining area is almost below ground, with not much natural light. In addition to the complimentary breakfast, the hotel offers complimentary tea (with sandwiches and pastries) in the late afternoon. When we first arrived, the concierge on duty took us immediately to the dining area, offered us whatever we wanted to drink, and spent the next half hour carefully orienting us on the map and explaining how to get to all the sites. Thereafter, the staff was exceptionally generous in their time and attention addressing any inquiry or concern. The hotel is in a great location in Sultanahmet, just a short walk uphill to the Blue Mosque. From there it is only a little farther to Aya Sofya, Topkapi, the Grand Bazaar and even Istanbul University and the Sulymanyah mosque. We only took the tram, which stops at the Sultanahmet station near the Blue Mosque, to cross the Golden Horn and see that part of the City. All you want to see in Sultanahmet is within walking distance of the hotel, even when raining, as was the case our first day or two there. There is a great, inexpensive restaurant just a block or two away from the hotel. I was surprised the hotel staff advised us not to drink the tap water in Istanbul. The hotel provided us with a complimentary litre bottle of water everyday.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay !!”
Reviews.Author: Remco_73
Reviews.Content: Second time we stayed in this lovely hotel. Staff is extremely nice and very helpful. Rooms are great. Will stay here next time again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, efficient and complete: a wonderful little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: StoneFeather_H
Reviews.Content: It would be hard to praise the Amira Hotel too highly, it was THAT good! From the warm reception upon arrival (with a cup of tea, cake and good advice), to the umbrellas provided on rainy days - from the most complete breakfast buffet we've ever seen (ranging all the way from ultra-healthy to mega-calory-bomb) to the kindness and consideration of ALL staff members - from the ideal situation in the heart of the old city (close to Blue Mosque, Sokulu Mosque and Hagia Sofia) to the splendid view of the Bosphorous from the rooftop terrace: the Amira is excellently situated, well-equipped, friendly, clean, flexible and everything works well ... including the Mac put at guests disposal in the restaurant. We were enchanted. Thanks to one and all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: rogers222
Reviews.Content: Plus: Location is a few blocks from the Blue Mosque and other tourist sites, great location for visitors. The hotel is only a couple years old, so all the facilities are fresh new. Staff is courteous and well-trained. Rooms are not huge, but are not closets, they are certainly satisfactory and very well cleaned. Compliments to the cleaning staff who put the room in excellent condition. Breakfast is included and is quite nice in a pleasant dining room. One of the best things about the location is that it is just 100 meters from the highway that connects to the airport, so taxi drivers can find it easily and the ride to and from the airport is 15 minutes shorter than other nearby hotels. Minus: Lighting in the bathroom is abysmal. A couple of low wattage bulbs cast creepy shadows and make it impossible to shave or put on makeup. Hint to hotel: if the light is too dim to read, it's too dim. Also, street sounds creep up to the streetside rooms, it's not terribly noisy but might distract light sleepers. Overall it's a great hotel, more than competitive with other properties in the same neighborhood and price range.

Reviews.Title: “The best staff in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Camperbelle
Reviews.Content: This pretty boutique hotel is a gem! The restaurant is small but the breakfast was amazing with lots of fruits, cold meats, yogurts cheeses, bread pastries and a hot section. The free afternoon tea was a lovely surprise! The rood terrace is a perfect place to relax with great views. Rooms were a good size and nice bathrooms and fast free internet. The most fantastic thing about this hotel is the staff. Everyone was professional, friendly and helpful, nothing was too much trouble. Great location walking distance to sea front, blue mosque and lots of restaurants. I highly recommend this hotel. Thank you for a great stay I would definitively stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel surpassed our high expectations”
Reviews.Author: JerryPoole
Reviews.Content: This hotel surpassed our expectations.All the staff we met were of the highest standard. Very friendly and helpful from the moment we entered the hotel with complimentary afternoon tea and an orientation chat by 'Arthur' until they waved us off. (Other hotels could learn a great deal from their professionalism) The room was large and clean and the breakfast offered a wide choice. Ideally situated for the major sights, a 3 hour trip on the Bosphorus arranged by the hotel is well worth condidering if you have spent many hours pounding the streets. Would I recommend this hotel to friends and family-you bet

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Fantastic Decor, walking distance to Blue Mosque + Trams!”
Reviews.Author: RupalLondon
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we were met by friendly receptionist! We checked in and another receptionist took us to the breakfast room. We were given complimentary tea/coffee and as we checked in a 4pm they were serving complimentary cakes and biscuits for all guests - we were able to indulge! We were then given an informative half hour of where to go, what to see, how to travel, things to avoid, restaurant recommendations. - A lovely personal touch by the hotel! Room was on the ground floor - at night due to annoying Russian DRUNK people there was a lot of noise!! However the decor was modern, very comfy bed and bathroom was clean. Breakfast was fresh, enjoyable and laid out nicely. The location of the hotel is great walking distance to sultanahmet tram, the blue mosque. Going on the tram you can visit other places. Avoid the market behind the blue mosque as it is very over priced! Do go to the market Grand Bazar, Spice Market, do walk to see the Galata Tower - beautiful view right at the top! MUST GO TO ALBURA KATHISMA restaurant - SUPERB FOOD!

Reviews.Title: “A very friendly and well run hotel”
Reviews.Author: Melissadisney
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel Amira for four nights. I was very impressed by the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. On arrival we were greeted with delicious tea and cakes, and were given a run down on where all the main sights were situated, good places to eat, good shopping etc.. Our room was large, clean and well equipped; after an excellent night's sleep we awoke to a delicious breakfast in the dining room. The hotel is perfectly situated within 5 minutes walk of the blue mosque, and 5 minutes to the major tramline. It has a roof terrace with terrific views of the Sea of Mamara. We had booked a guide, through the hotel in advance, for our first day (this turned out to be a good move, as with a guide you can jump the queues for many of the sights). I would recommend the Hotel Amira as an excellent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “There is no place like .... Amira Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: gvang
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a few days there and I can't say enough good things about the Hotel stuff! Thank you a million for showing us the real hospitality of Turkish people. We felt really spoilt and had an answer to any question we had, before we even thought about it. A special thanks to Arthur who made us feel better than at home. The Hotel is perfectly situated, near most of the must see attractions. Aghia Sofia, Blue Mosque, the Basilica, Top Kapi. You name it, it's all less than 15 minutes away (on foot or combined with the tram). Breakfast buffet is marvelous and has a nice variety and Wireless Internet is covering every corner of the Hotel. The rooms are spacious and clean, but maybe could have had some better sound insulation. All in all totally recommended! Again, thanks to the people that make this Hotel worthwhile. George and Ermina

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: glen52
Reviews.Content: Hotel Amira is an excellent hoteland the location is perfect.The staff are welcoming and unfailingly helpful and friendly. The receptionist took time to explain to us about Istanbul and to make recommendations about places to eat and how to get around. This seems to be done with all guests and was really appreciated. Breakfast is very good and there is complimentary tea and cakes in the afternoon. We had a room at road level and yet were not aware of any noise. We would recommend it to anyone and would not hesitate to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for first time visitors”
Reviews.Author: weho69er
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend met up with some friends and stayed at Amira. I was a bit disappointed by the exterior on arrival but soon got over it once we were greeted by hotel staff. Tina at the front desk took us into the bar/dining room and gave us a run down of all the hotel ammeneties and info on everything from restaurants, city tours and must see tourist attractions....and the free cocktail helped too! The staff was super friendly, helpful and always curtious. Our room was great! Ask for room 701. I think it may be a suite but it was spacious and had it's own outdoor balcony area. Tina mentioned it was the only room i the hotel with it's own open space. The rest of the hotel was kept clean and never saw any other guests when I stayed except during breakfast. All the main tourists spots are withing a 20 minute (or less) walk from the hotel. Breakfast in the morning was simple and enough to get your day going and there's plenty of nearby restaurants with excellent menus. I recommend this hotel if it's your first Istanbul trip and want to hit up all the main sites in the Old City.

Reviews.Title: “very pleasant and convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carol031
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very convenient for all the main attractions being in the old city behind the Blue Mosque. Although there is a taxi rank outside there is very little noise and we were on the ground floor overlooking the road. The staff are very helpful and friendly as well as giving useful information on restaurants etc. The breakfasts are very good and the complimentary tea and cake at 5pm was perfect to keep you going before dinner. I could find no fault with the hotel and would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “5 star rating for a 4 class hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Mperls
Reviews.Content: This is a great 4 star hotel, they say it's 5 star but I would say it is a 4. Either way, I would rank it 5/5 for location, service, value, cleanliness and rooms. We fell in loved with the location, close to all the main attractions but has a great neighborhood feel without being too commercialized. Don't forget to visit the light shop across the street, after looking at many stores, we found him to have the best quality and fair prices. The service of the hotel sets it apart. When you arrive, you sit over tea to go over your stay. You feel at home each time you come and go. We booked airport transportation, the 1/2 day Imperial Tour and the Bosphorous Cruise through the hotel and were pleased with they fast response and quality of service. The rooms are nice, the beds are in between a Queen and a king. The air conditioning, flat screen tv, free wireless Internet, included breakfast all add to the great value. The fitness center works with 1 tv, 2 treadmills and weights but is small. The hot tub is for private use that you can pay for that spa area by the hour. All in all, we had a great time. Thank you to the staff at Amira for helping make our stay as enjoyable as it was. Thanks again!

Reviews.Title: “Remarkable”
Reviews.Author: Iowaconsultant
Reviews.Content: How does a 32 room hotel rise to such excellence as I found in 5 nights at the Amira? The owners have recently renovated all rooms to a high quality level and hired the manager, Arthur, who has hired quality staff from the front desk to restaurant servers. Usually three at the front desk (compared to zero at times at other small hotels) including the manager who has no private room to isolate him from the guests. When I arrived a front desk a young woman, Tina (graduate of the top Turkish university, Istanbul University), registered me, then took me to the then empty restaurant to orient me in Istanbul, recommend and explain sites, and help me organize my time including one 4 hour guided tour which was excellent and gave me information I valued along with avoiding most of the long lines for entrance. My room was clean with complete daily service, attractive, comfortable bed, and small but completely adequate bathroom. Although was quite satisfied, Arthur offered to change me to a then available room on a higher floor with a nice view of the attractive square in front of the hotel. At check out, I did complain at the cost of the "full day" guide (4 hours) and the assistant manager reduced the charge of the tour agency without knowing whether the agency would agree. The hotel's attitude of service and honoring their guests excelled all others I have experienced in my travels in 54 countries. Istanbul is a complete winner as a city to visit - rich history represented by the majestic mosques and other sites, safe, friendly, old city (Sultanahumet where Amira is located) is fun to explore with its laberinth of streets, shops, cafes, street venders and convenient street car (tram). Frequent flights to Ephesus via Izmir (1 hour gate to gate) make this an easy day trip with a early evening return the same day to your hotel. Don't miss this Greek - Roman site.

Reviews.Title: “Best Service ever!”
Reviews.Author: PuneetJainShah
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located very conveniently near old city sights, rooms were clean and well decorated, but the best part was customer service. They let us check in early. Tina at the reception desk helped us plan our two days in Istanbul along with food and transport recommendations without pushing for any of their tours. We booked Amira based on a friend's recommendation and really glad we did that. Would stay there again if I ever go to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: Edinburghgrecofile
Reviews.Content: This was amazingly good value and a wonderful place to stay. Centred fairly well in Sultanahmet near to the Blue Mosque this little boutique type hotel was just the business for us. Our room was one of their basic ones but really nice with a large bed (actually two singles put together but that was fine), with flat screen TV, a very nice bathroom with large shower and lots of extras such as dressing gown, slippers and shoe shiner. The breakfast was amazing with many choices - lots of healthy fruit, cereals and vegetables as well as lovely bread and pastries. We loved the complimentary afternoon tea Turkish style with lots of little savouries and sweets to try. The staff were ever so helpful taking time to explain the best places to visit, how to get there easily and some recommended restaurants. A map was provided which help with orientation. There was free use of a computer and staff were happy to print out boarding passes for us. The biggest suprise on our last afternoon was to find some strawberries and chocolate (with candle burner to melt the chocolate) left out in our room. What a treat. Do choose this hotel - it was just fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Shh... only tell your close friends - this is a great find!”
Reviews.Author: The_Boulevardier
Reviews.Content: Nothing is more comforting when travelling in a foreign and exotic city than to have great welcoming service at your hotel. The friendly staff at this hotel were exceptional. The location of the hotel was great, only a few minutes away from the great sites of historic Istanbul. Tina at the front desk was amazing. She sat down with us when we first stepped into the hotel and gave us an overview of the city and highlighted some areas and attractions that we should not miss. The bell boy was friendly, so was the bartended, everyone was extremely nice. Our hotel room was well appointed and the free wifi was great. We had a hotel room that opened up to the main road which was a little noisy at night due to the taxi stand across the hotel but it was nothing than a mere little annoyance. Not enough to keep me from giving this hotel a great overall thumbs up. I would recommend this hotel to my close friends who are looking for a centrally-located hotel in the historic core of old Istanbul who are as value- and service-conscious as I am.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, staff and breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Kathryn M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Amira in early April 2012 and we LOVED the experience from beginning to end. The staff really are incredible and made our stay relaxing and enjoyable. The breakfast was outstanding - you couldn't ask for a better and wider selection of food - as was the complimentary afternoon tea. Our room was a good size as was the bed and reflected the pictures used on the website. We would highly recommend! Kat and Rob (London)

Reviews.Title: “nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: mihaelapuf
Reviews.Content: the rooms are very nice and cozy,the location is great,great breakfast,very nice staff,free wifi,I really enjoyed my stay here!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Incedo
Reviews.Content: This is a very good mid-range hotel in a good location. Of particular note is the excellent service, the location in the old city away from the tourist traps, the good quality breakfast and room. The only point to be aware of is that while the terrace has a good view of the sea, it does not have such a great view of the old city due to its relatively low location. I would recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but nowhere near great”
Reviews.Author: kamikaze_tourist
Reviews.Content: I confess that I really do not understand the uniformly great reviews people give this hotel. It is an OK bargain hotel in Istanbul, but it is nowhere near a top 10 hotel in Istanbul, which really does have quite a few near-spectacular mid-range hotels. Our interactions with the staff were nowhere near the exceptional anything-for-service experience so many people report. The room we had was very basic, with nowhere near the personality and elegance of the rooms in their pictures. The breakfast was OK, but literally nothing special. Because they describe their double beds as "King-Size", we booked a standard room with one "King-Size" bed. We got a room on the first floor, a few steps up from the lobby. Maybe on a good day the bed was queen size, but I do not think it was even that. My wife and I decided we could not both sleep on It (I have sleep disorders - it is not just that we are spoiled). We requested a room change or an extra bed, which we would happily pay for. Although we were checking in in the morning, they insisted neither was possible. I requested just a mattress, which I would use on the floor, but they insisted this was not possible either. They suggested that one of us could sleep on the sofa, which they could open up so that you sleep on it. It was not a sleeper; it was not flat; it was at most 5 feet in length: it provided horrible support. I can honestly say it was one of the worst night's sleep ever. We offered that we could stand it for one night if they could get us another room, bed or mattress for the second night. They said they would work on that, but when we came back for the second night, they told us nothing was possible. We left the next morning and changed hotels. They also told us that the Blue Mosque was closed to non-Muslims due to Ramadan. Luckily, a local told us that it was still open that day, but might be closed the next day. If we had taken the Amira concierge (manager??, desk staff??) at his word, we would have missed the Blue Mosque. Also, don't be fooled that they are located in the center. It is a LONG walk from the tram. Heavy luggage will make you regret your choice. It is light and clean. The bed was OK (visco does not mean tempurpedic). Internet was OK. It is quiet. It is near the waterfront, which is not to be missed if you do stay here. Personally, I will not stay here again. It is nothing special, and I will choose one of the Turkish mid-range hotels nearer the center. They have a lot more personality.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid boutique hotel with fabulous service”
Reviews.Author: Siena
Reviews.Content: One of the best 4 star hotels I've ever stayed in. Great breakfast, lovely rooms and personal service that goes beyond what you would expect. The staff really make it. Nothing was too much trouble and we would highly recommend this to everyone. We travelled with 3 children and they loved it too. Free wifi, great free afternoon tea and excellent location to explore Sultanhamet. The rooms are very attractive and comfortable and extremely clean. Can't fault it.

Reviews.Title: “A Fine Small Run Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gazzajam
Reviews.Content: MY REVIEW WILL INCLUDE THE PROS AND SUGGESTIONS FOR IMPROVEMENT AT AMIRA. THEY ARE BASED ON MY EXPEREINCE AS A HOTELIER AND FREQUENT TRAVELS TO OVER 15 DESTINATIONS AND STAY IN ALL TYPES OF HOTEL WORLDWIDE EACH YEAR. CHECK-IN-CHECK OUT: The personal and attentive welcome by Front Desk Manager, Arthur Coskun is a positive example of how hotels should operate and make guests feel at home. Good customer relation action. THE STAFF: Amira has been perhaps fortunate to employ a group of people who understands and promotes the customer friendly and professional approach that all guests should expereince. Well done. Well done. The PROPERTY: Well maintained. Rooms asigned to us (Family Room on 3rd Floor-305 & 306 with 2 single beds in one room and one king size in the other is perfect for a family of 3 or other groups) The rooms were very clean, spacious, parque flooring, adequate natural light and equipped with the essentials, including tea and coffee making facilities and complimentary bottles of drinking water each day. Bathroom spacious, clean and re-stocked and cleaned each day. Good storage for clothing and luggage of guests. Good water flow in both shower, wc and sink. SUGGESTIONS FOR IMPROVEMENT IN ROOMS: (1)Exam the shower door as it needs fixing to ensure it opens easily and without need for force (2) Provide reading light over the writing desk and a more suitable chair. It was not the ideal idea to place the telvision in the middle of the desk wall mirror!!! (can this be changed?) (3) Remove one of each light over the beds (having 2 to serve the same purpose) is not necessary. (4) Do maintennance check of bathrooms to verify the cause of water leak that comes through when it rains as experienced in Room 306 (5) Regulate the hot water temperature or provide warning/advice in bathroom for guests to be aware of the intensity of the hotwater when fully turned on. HOTEL FACILITIES: Dining room is on the lower basement area with a bar attached and the kitchen nearby. There is also a communal sitting area, much like a conservatory in the basement area. A television is provided in the dining area and a computer terminal for use by guests. An ATM machine is provided in the conservatory area. Daily breakfast offerings include a range of food and drink that are well presented. Did not see a toaster and forgot to ask if this is available. Access to the dining area and conservatory is via stairs, Like many hotels in Istanbul, not user friendly for people with restricted mobility/disability. The reception area is very small and has 2 garden type benches. There is a lift that enable guests to access the fitness rooms on the lower floor, all bedrooms and the roof-top sitting area that is used as relaxing and dining area when the weather permits. From here, guests have good views towards the sea and the Blue Mosque. HOTEL LOCATION: Like most places in Istanbul, the Amira is built on a hill and pebble stone streets are the norm in most places. You need comfortable walking shoes. It is ideal for guests who enjoy short walks to many of the major attractions such as the Blue Mosque, Basilica Cistern, Topak Palace, Hagia Sophia Museum, etc and the main tramway that runs through the heart of the Asian side of Istanbul and Sultanhamet to the European side. Give yourself time and watch your steps along the pebble stone streets fro uneven surfaces. There are many good restaurants, local grocery and souvineir shops near to Amira Hotel. You can also turn left outside the hotel towards the sea and visit the range the Fish Market and range of fish restaurants by the sea. Pleasant promenade walk for miles in either direction. FURTHER SUGGESTIONS FOR IMPROVEMENT: (1) Remove the computer terminal from the dining room and place it in the conservatory area where the ATM machine is located. (2) Provide at least 2 suitable chairs by the bar area for guests who just want to sit and have a drink, rather than having to sit at a dining table. (3) Consider providing some type of covering on the roof where guests can relax, even when it is raining. Other hotels nearby have done that and it seems to work. It is also somewhere guests who want to, can relax apart from their rooms or the dining area when the weather is not favourable.

Reviews.Title: “Attention to every detail is what makes this hotel a great choice”
Reviews.Author: thewino
Reviews.Content: From the time you checkin until departure the Amira always goes the extra step to insure your satisfaction. Rooms are good sized with a small bathroom, but both are efficiently laid out and well appointed. But it's the hospitality of the staff that makes this hotel so special. They cater to all your wants with a caring smile. A must place to stay in Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel w/ Fabulous Staff”
Reviews.Author: Greg S
Reviews.Content: We visited Istanbul earlier this year and had an truly outstanding experience at Hotel Amira. We experienced a VIP reception and received friendly dedicated care throughout our stay. The hotel location is excellent and the staff provided clear directions to all the major sites and great dining recommendations. Our rooms were beautiful, comfortable and fully functional. The Hotel Amira breakfast buffet contains a wide assortment of tasty fare, which alowed every day of our visit to begin with a smile and nourishment. Most importantly, the staff was consistantly friendly and helpful. They went above and beyond in their efforts to arrange of our visit to the Silivrikapi Mevlana Cultural Center, which was highlight of our stay. We will definitely stay at Hotel Amira the next time we visit beautiful Istanbul and encourage others to experience the service, comfort and convience of the excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: D K
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed in Hotel Amira Istanbul for 5 nights in March 2012. It was a great hotel very centrally located in the old city and walkable to many famous sights in Istanbul. It was a short walk to the tram station as well which made all of Istanbul easily accessible. The staff was very helpful and knowledgable. The room was very clean and comfortable. There was fresh water in the room each day for us, nice comfortable robes and a nice bathroom with a great shower. The room also had a safe for keeping valuables. The beds were very comfortable and the room was quiet. The breakfast every morning was great with lots of options to choose from. It filled me up so much that I didn't even need lunch several days! I would recommend taking a cab to the airport instead of arranging transportation with the hotel. A cab was only 35-40 turkish lira. Or you can take the tram from the airport which is very easy and only 2 turkish lira. I highly recommend this hotel in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely atmosphere, friendly staff, a wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: Noo-noo L
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the hotel Amira in March and were extremely pleased with our choice.The staff are very friendly and helpful and the hotel has a warm, relaxing atmosphere. Our 1 year old daughter also loved the stay, she was always greeted by name by all the staff who were keen to entertain her! Suffice to say hotel Amira is definitely a family friendly choice of hotel; we were provided with a very spacious baby cot, the high chair was readily set up in the breakfast bar area each morning before we'd even come down and the kitchen was extremely generous in sending warmed milk to us in the evening when needed for our daughter. The room itself was lovely, very clean, modern and still spacious despite there being a large cot present. In terms of locality, the hotel is fantastically convenient; it took us 5 minutes to walk to the Blue Mosque, 10 to the Hagia Sofia, the tram/metro station is less than a 10 minute walk and much cheaper than taxis, would definitely recommend using. Theres a small grocery store adjacent to the hotel, literally 20 seconds away, and tonnes to explore all within walking distance. I very much recommend this Hotel and and will certainly stay here again should we visit Istanbul in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel Staff”
Reviews.Author: Vicky M
Reviews.Content: I was a guest at Hotel Amira this past week. ALL the hotel staff was just wonderful! Bahri and Arthur welcomed us with open arms and gave us a run down of the area around the hotel. I had forgotten my journal, and when I asked the staff about were to go to buy one, Tina produced a journal and left me speechless! Sim and Alehandro were ready to help and answer any questions, always with a smile. The rooms were immaculate. The rooftop of the hotel offers a wonderful view of the sea and the best sunset! The breakfast was the best, and afternoon tea even better! The staff at both breakfast and tea made me feel right at home. The Hotel is within walking distance from the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, train station, and many more attractions. My visit to Istanbul was a wonderful experience, and my stay at the Hotel Amira was made extra special thanks to the caring and wonderful STAFFâ€¦.THEY are the BEST

Reviews.Title: “BEST STAFF AND HOTEL IN ISTANBUL!!!”
Reviews.Author: cmania
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent from Virginia and organized a small group of 8 ladies to visit Istanbul in March 2012. Before arriving to Istanbul, I was I was very impressed with the staff. Every time I had a question, or needed a recommendation, they emailed me immediately so even before getting there, I was feeling very confident about this hotel. When we all arrived at the hotel, we just fell in love with the hotel and its wonderful staff. The staff was always pleasant, always smiling, always helpful. They organized the transfers from the airport to the hotel. They also organized a private city sightseeing tour with a fabulous guide. They gave us great dining recommendations and were always eager to help in any way they could. The hotel has a great location. It is close to the Sea, close to shopping, walking distance to the sites and public transport. The rooftop terrace is a great place to see the sun set and the sea. Great view from the top!! The breakfast is wonderful with cold and hot entrees, a great choice of breads, cheese, meats, juices, vegetables, yogurt and toppings, cereals, coffee, tea, and more. The afternoon tea was a pleasant surprise featuring cakes, sandwiches, tea, coffee and juice. The rooms are immaculate as are the bathrooms. All of us just loved this property. But the thing that separates this place with other 5 star properties is definitely the caring staff. They are simply wonderful!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Amira”
Reviews.Author: sp1969
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at Amira for 4 nights in March 2012. Prior to our arrival they sent us a very handy pdf with directions and suggestions of sights to see in Istanbul.On arrival we were met by the delightful Sim, who showed us everything on a map and suggested restaurants and walks, many of which we tried much to our satisfaction. The hotel is in the middle of Sultanahmet which is where most of the sights are, is clean and tidy and well run, and the staff pretty much all speak English and are always very helpful. Our room was great and delivered on everything advertised, so apart from seeing the many great sights of Istanbul we also managed to get some much needed rest and great sleep at the hotel. On check out thy also very kindly helped us print out our boarding passes. This place comes highly recommended by us.

Reviews.Title: “A Turkish Delight”
Reviews.Author: shoozdiva
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location and wonderful staff! From the moment we arrived the service and staff went out of there way to make the trip memorable. We were greeted by name and Arthur sat down with us to go over what we were planning on doing during our week's stay. The free WIFI was well used and much appreciated. The rooms were very nice and comfortable. The afternoon tea was a big hit with the teenage daughter. This property is a gem!

Reviews.Title: “A hotel to remember”
Reviews.Author: patricia026
Reviews.Content: Our four day stay was made more memorable by the warm welcome we received at Hotel Amira. Our arrival coincided with the daily complimentary afternoon tea during which we were given helpful advice on the city sites, restaurants and transport. The hotel is well situated for visiting on foot Haghia Sophia, the Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace.It has been charmingly decorated and our de-luxe room was spacious and warm. There was a walk in shower and coffee and tea making facilities. The breakfast has good quality and varied items including excellent bread and croissants.The afternoon tea served from 4.30 until 6.00 is a great welcome at the end of a long day of tourism. The pastries are very good and there's even Turkish Delight to taste. We took the hotel's advice on a couple of restaurants and we were not disappointed. When we asked for directions to one at reception, they immediately offered to make a reservation 'so that we would be well-seated' and we were! I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel and if i return to Istanbul this will be the hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Second business visit”
Reviews.Author: Mbil10
Reviews.Content: I have found this hotel through Tripadvisor's website and I just wanted to thank all staff for there good service. Price-quality relation is outstanding. Breakfast is simple but sufficient. The wifi connection is good for working and rooms are clean and renovated. This has been the second time for me in this hotel, and I will come back again for business or for leisure. Its location is ok; next to the Blue Mosque.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: Sara W
Reviews.Content: I cannot think of one single thing with which to find fault (rare I know) The staff were helpful and frindly without being in your face and the room exceeded my expectations.the beds are so comfortable with quality bedding and memory foam mattressI cant remember having a better nights sleep in a hotel anywhere, although I did have to turn the heating down!. Breakfast is first class with a lot of choice, although dont expect English - this is Turkey after all, and all the better for it in my opinion. The hotel is very well appointed ) and is in a fantastic location. I have nothing but praise and intend to stay here again when I come back, which I hope will be soon..

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Halim S
Reviews.Content: We were the happiest couple ever - enjoyed the stay, the location, the friendly staff, the great hospitality...was just perfect!! will definitely do it again.

Reviews.Title: “We reommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kristy G
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel depending on the the tripadvisor reviews, and we were not dissapointed. they really blow the guest away. Courteous staff with a broad smile. Everything was fine. We enjoyed our time fully!! thankssss

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay”
Reviews.Author: TallyHoNow
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days there recently. It is outstanding property. The location is perfect. It is just a few blocks from everything in the historic area. The breakfast is very good and the customer service is the best. We have stayed here before-- I recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “amazing trip to istanbul”
Reviews.Author: ziadSLEIMAN
Reviews.Content: feels like home, everything was amazing , the location , the room , everything !!! i wont go to intanbul without staying at this hotel , incredible freindly stuff :)) , still can remember mr. micheal and miss tina , they are really amazing people , already feel like freinds :), amira hotel , the best hotel in intanbul ! ziad sleiman

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel experiences I've ever had”
Reviews.Author: AS251
Reviews.Content: My stay at Hotel Amira was superb. I stayed here with one friend for 2 nights in February 2012. The moment we walked in, they sat us down, offered us some hot chocolate and coffee, and went over all of the top attractions to see in Istanbul, the operating hours of the palaces/mosques, the best places to eat, and how to get everywhere. It was extremely thorough and helpful, and we didn't even ask for it! That kind of hospitality continued throughout our stay - whenever we had a question, the staff was more than happy to answer it. The breakfast was awesome! And I also highly recommend the "tea time" that they provide from 4:30-6:30pm each day. There were a variety of cakes and some sandwiches. You could pretty much eat for free during your entire stay in Istanbul, loading up on the food that Hotel Amira provides. The rooms were fine, nothing fancy, but fanciness wasn't something I was looking for. No complaints from me. Free wifi in the rooms worked great too. They had a different network on each floor, so I'm sure it works great wherever you are in the building. There's a beautiful terrace on the roof, which I highly recommend checking out. You can see the Blue Mosque from it. Location was fabulous as well. It's about a 5 minute walk to the Blue Mosque (the walk is uphill, which should be noted if you are in some way disabled). I really have no complaints at all and would recommend Hotel Amira to anyone I knew who was travelling to Istanbul! **Edit** If you're being picky, my one complaint is that you can hear the loudspeaker from the Blue Mosque in your rooms. So when they're chanting at 7am, it may wake you up.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: Petitspieds
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Amira during a weekend in Istanbul and would highly recommend it. Staff are just lovely, friendly and always ready to help. They made our stay extremely pleasant. We got a free room upgrade. The room was extremely comfortable and well appointed. Free tea and cakes at the end of afternoon is a great touch. The only minus is that walls felt a bit thin and we had 'the pleasure' of being waken up in the middle of the night by the people next door turning on the tv with the sound on extremely loud. But putting that aside we had a really good stay overall and would really recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantabulous!”
Reviews.Author: foodietrotter
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with two other friends for 3 nights in February 2012. We had the deluxe room and it was spacious, comfortable and really well decorated. It had charm and character and was very clean. Our bed was extremely comfortable and we slept very well. The bathroom was well stocked, clean and the water pressure was great. We had a Jacuzzi bathtub which we didn't use, but the option existed. The WiFi worked really well, better than any 5-star hotel I have stayed at. The strength was quite good and access is free. The breakfast buffet was top quality. With some items changing from day to day and some items remaining the same - which is a nice touch. Coffee, tea and orange juice are included in the buffet, if you ask for for Turkish Coffee or Capuccinos or Espressos, then it is charged at extra. The hotel even organised for my postcards to be stamped and mailed. This brings me into the wonderful service they offer. So personable and always ready to help. Friendly and warm and always did it with a smile. So the rest of the reviews that say, someone sits you down with a map when you arrive and gives you an orientation and allows you time to ask questions is a nice touch. If you want any reservation, planning, they are all willing to do it for you. They have a cab station right outside the hotel, so that is very useful. I plan to return in September with my partner this time and will definitely stay there if we go. I did like the neighbourhood since it is close to all the touristy sites (mosques, cistern, palace and little local restaurants with seafood) and love how you can walk to the train station, Grand Bazaar, Arasta Bazaar and enjoy the local areas and connect with local culture. The old cobblestone streets are quaint. Now, a lot of people say the night life and cafes are all in the new part, Taksim, but for us it was no big deal to take the tram there or a cab. It cost 5-6 dollars by cab if you get to Taksim Square and then you can walk from there to all the happening places. All in all, I would recommend the hotel because of the personal touch, the quality of the hotel, food and service. In fact, our flight out of IST was cancelled and we ended up staying at the Radisson Blu (apparently 5 star), and it was so disappointing after being at Amira for the preceeding 3 nights. I sure will return in September!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: Jmims
Reviews.Content: We were here for just one night and were upgraded to a suite, which we were really grateful for. It was huge and beautiful (decorated in red, white and gray). The decor was modern and regal-looking at the same time. It had a balcony with a view of the Bosphorus and rooftops. The people working there were so friendly and helpful and I think one couldn't go wrong with staying at this place. The only reason it's not my favorite place to stay in Istanbul is that I'd prefer to be in Beyoglu. but if you want to stay in Sultanahmet this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: jsampaio
Reviews.Content: It was great to stay in Amira. Great staff, nice rooms, a interesting breakfast! The service is really nice and the rooms are quite large and very "clean". It was a wonderfull stay, in a 4star location, near the Blue Mosque.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel...great staff and service”
Reviews.Author: Joe10014
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a short 2 day trip to Instabul on the end of another trip. The hotel could not have been any better for what I needed. After making the reservation, I was sent a Istanbul sight guide from the hotel that was very comprehensive. How often to get great service before you even arrive? When I checked it, I was immediately taken to the rooftop bar for a drink and a hotel staff member took me through a map of the area an pointed out the local sites. Within 15 minutes of arriving, I had the lay of the land and a plan for the following day. The room was nice and spacious, and very clean. The hotel is conveniently located near the Blue Mosque and other major tourist sites. The breakfast was great, and again, the staff were helpful with everything I needed.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great roof top bar, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: IrishPab
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week in September 2011 with my girlfriend. We found this place in TA and made a gamble. It was actually a great place to stay. It's small but nice. The roof top bar is by far the best feature with great sea views and of the Blue Mosque. Its only a short walk to all the tourist sites. The rooms are a bit dated but given its location you shouldnt be staying in that much. The bathroom was very dated. The introduction talk was useful but the restaurents they recommended were not great. Best stick to the ones best reviewed on TA. Although we did book a turkish bath through the hotel which turned out great. But all in all a very well run business who look after their customers. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joan S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Amira both before and after a cruise last October. The staff couldn't have been more helpful, starting with a complementary drink on the roof terrace with the Manager whilst he pointed out all the nearby sights on a map for us. The room was very spacious and the ensuite bathroom had its own jacuzzi bath. The breakfast buffet was beautifully presented and had everything you could want. Access to the hotel by taxi is very easy as it is on the edge of the old town just a short distance from the ring road but it is also within very easy walking distance of the main sights and many interesting restaurants. If we have occasion to return to Istanbul we will certainly stay at the Hotel Amira again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Intimate Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sahil S
Reviews.Content: Our experience at Amira was fantastic - the staff were extremely helpful, courteous and well informed. They were indispensable with regard to planning our daily activities and suggested many unforgettable restaurants and experiences. Amira is situated very conveniently in the Sultanahmet, so you're walking distance from the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Grand Bazaar and Spice Market. The hotel itself is luxurious and well equipped. Rooms are very comfortable, and well appointed. Amira has an unforgettable aroma - they waft a beautiful fragrance through the hotel. It's the first thing you'll notice on arrival, and you'll miss it once you leave. On a past trip to Istanbul, I stayed at the Four Seasons which was also a stunning property, but for charm and privacy, I would stay at Amira again. The beauty of it being a boutique hotel, is you get the feeling that the property is yours while you're there. We were part of a big group of friends, and every breakfast, and teatime was unforgettable. I was pleased with the selection for breakfast, and needed nothing more. The teatimes in the afternoon were special - the baking interesting, and they always had some wonderful Turkish delight available. The taxi drivers in Istanbul are a rotten bunch, so it's useful to have the Amira staff negotiate your journey with them before you depart. Also have the Amira staff negotiate your rate with the taxi drivers. Everytime we used a taxi away from the hotel, we had a bad experience - sometimes having to direct the drivers ourselves to make sure we ended up back at the hotel! They seem to have a tactic that they all use: They are immediately confused by any address, or card that you give them. They then consult with other taxi drivers who seem equally clueless. Then after a number of phonecalls, they take you on long roundabout routes to increase the metered fare. If you're sensitive to smoking as I am, be weary of the taxi drivers you pick, some of whom seem to light up at free will. That said, if you're planning to spend your time in the Old City, the Hotel will provide you with a good map of the area, and most of the sites are within walking distance, and it is the best way to view the city. Personally, I prefer Istanbul in winter. There is a certain charm to the city with a light dusting of snow. The other benefit is that it isn't a peak tourist season, so you wont ever have to wait a long time to access the places of interest.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: Kims0304
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night with some colleagues before moving to the Swissotel The Bosphorus for a conference. I wish we could have stayed at Amira the whole week. This boutique hotel beat the Swissotel in every way: better service, nicer rooms and great value. From the minute our airport pick up pulled up in front of the hotel we were greeted with friendly, five-star service. We were offered welcome tea and snacks while our luggage was brought to our rooms for us. We all stayed in standard rooms, which are spacious, modern, trendy and spotless. Amenities included handmade local products, a loofah sponge, complimentary water and WiFi. I had room 404, which was at the end of the hallway. My colleagues had rooms on lower floors or closer to the stairs. They all slept like roses, but I took a while to get to sleep due to noise from the neighbors. I could hear a man snore, and a couple came back in the middle of the night and were very loud. The receptionist told me that the lower floors have better insulation, but that they are working on insulating the higher floors as well. I did have a nice balcony, which would have been great in summer. Included in the price is an extensive breakfast buffet as well as a complimentary afternoon buffet with several kinds of pastries, Turkish Delight, coffee and tea. Both are served in their stylish, cozy restaurant. Amira is located in the historical center of Istanbul and is an easy 5 minute walk from the Blue Mosque. As we were there for business, we rented the meeting room on Monday morning. It's the 'winter garden'. It's a pretty room and the staff will set it up any way you like. We paid 60 euro for the 3-hour rental plus refreshments. Compared to the 400+ euro Swissotel charged, this was a steal.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrd50
Reviews.Content: we would choose this hotel again: good location, friendly and helpful staff, breakfast feast and staff even had kindle and iPad chargers on hand.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the heart of Sultanahmet, Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: GoGoMonk
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the heart of Sultanahmet which made our 2 days stay in Istanbul very convenient. The staff at Amira Hotel are friendly, helpful and professional which all led to a wonderful and memorable stay and would highly recommend to anyone visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Turkish Delight”
Reviews.Author: nb333
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our 4 night stay in Istanbul. Hotel Amira was ideally located for all the historic sights in Sultanhamet- we could not have chosen better! The staff were very friendly and helpful. Our airport pick-up was efficient and easy to arrange. We were welcomed at the hotel with drinks, snacks and an overview of sights worth visiting and local information. Our deluxe room was situated at the top of the hotel and was large, comfortable and very quiet. It was also very warm considering the very cold temperatures outside! The buffet breakfast was adequate but could possibly have been improved by having more of a hot selection. Complimentary tea was served daily between 4-6pm which was lovely after returning from a day sightseeing. A selection of Turkish Delight treats was also available. Although we had pre-arranged our airport transfer for 35 Euros, we booked our return transfer with a taxi company opposite the hotel for only 5 Euros each. This may be worth considering. We were so pleased that we chose this hotel for our very special city break.

Reviews.Title: “Agatha Christie's Setting”
Reviews.Author: Deb E
Reviews.Content: Hotel Amira might have been used by Dame Agatha as a setting for one of her classic novels! We were met at the entrance (every time) by a doorman, we were accompanied to our room, and then given a taste of Turkish Delight and an overview of the facility and of what to do in Istanbul. The (included) breakfasts were the most extensive we've had in Europe, and the breakfast room doubled as a lounge where we met and chatted with other travellers at the end of each day and exchanged our adventurous discoveries. Arthur, the hotel manager (and concierge par excellence!) anticipated our needs and gave us the most wonderful tips and directions for every question--about shopping, transit, Turkish baths, and how to not be scammed in the Spice Market and Grand Bazaar. We highly recommend this hotel, with its terrific location and wonderful management.

Reviews.Title: “Another Jewel in the heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Docmac5
Reviews.Content: We spent 13 days here and loved every minute. From the warm welcome (it was snowing!!) after which one of the many young and enthusiastic hoteliers did a one-on-one course on getting around this area (within easy walking distance of all the famous sites) to the lovely room, delicious breakfasts and (free)afternoon teas with cakes, this was an experience we want to repeat again and again. Despite the snow we wanted to do Ephesus and Pamukkale so they found 2 days when there would likely be sunshine, got us off with a superb Tour agency (Walkabout) and when we returned found ourselves in an upgrade to a Deluxe room. It doesn't get better than this.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice in old district”
Reviews.Author: lewisbliss
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Almira suite during massive snowstorm. Room spacious with balcony with table and chairs, nice bathroom, clean. Wireless in room actually worked at a reasonable speed. Breakfast really good..read this in other reviews and was skeptical, but lots of fresh choices in a pleasant room with very nice attendants. They were very nice and welcoming and not rigid. On one occasion they offered coffee and even full buffet when we showed up way early with jetlag. Service excellent. Frontdesk sent up sandwiches way after midnight when we checked in. They were always kind and helpful. Great location. View of water from our suite..thru the snow. Taxi stand out front. Good little eateries on the block. Tiny Turkish snow grocery with some deli and wines across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service”
Reviews.Author: innerexcellence
Reviews.Content: I arrived at 7am or so and they gave me complimentary breakfast buffet (which was very good) and had a room for me (super early checkin!). The location is amazing, so close to everything, and make sure you go to the top and look at the view from the balcony. You can see the water and blue mosque from there. The only drawback is the walls are a bit thin and the bathroom was pretty tiny, but I would come back for sure. They really took good care of me.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: pallinime
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel!! Great location, lovely modern rooms, friendly staff and perfect service. Very good breakfast and 5 o'clock tea. Strongly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: linjudy
Reviews.Content: We stayed during Feb, and true to all the reviews, this hotel is excellent. I had requested a room on a higher floor and were given 701, which is a huge room (junior suite?) with an enormous balcony. Definitely request this room if possible. would be wonderful in the summer. Staff was helpful and had great restaurant recommendation. The location is very convenient to all the sights in the old town. Although if/when we return to Istanbul, we would likely stay in the Beyoglu area now that we've seen the historical sights. It seemed a lot more "happening" and real. Our room was very comfortable with lots of windows. The bed was a bit hard but still very nice. Do note that the call to prayer happens everyday around 6, is quite loud, and lasts about 15-20 min. Hotel breakfast was very nice buffet, and wonderful as it goes from 7:30-11, a lot of flexibility for jetlagged travelers. Overall, an excellent choice!

Reviews.Title: “Safe, Clean, Professional”
Reviews.Author: rachel130144
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Hotel Amira several months ago. We were exhausted when we arrived and the concierge immediately led us into a quiet restaurant where we were offered refreshments. He reviewed our itinerary with us and provided us with a map. He made arrangements to local sites as we requested and gave us helpful tips on restaurants. We could open the window to our room to hear the call to prayer and had a lovely view of the quiet, yet bustling street below. Our room was bright, big and had a tasteful turkish flair. We took beautiful photos from the rooftop cafe and could see the brilliant moon and stars at night. It was very romantic. The locals are welcoming, gorgeous. We would definitely visit Istanbul again and wouldn't stay anywhere other than Hotel Amira.

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul gem”
Reviews.Author: sunflowersbythesea
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night to be in the historical centre before moving on the Swissotel The Bosphorus for a conference. I only wish I had been able to stay the week as the Swissotel's service and five star reputation paled in quality and value for money to this little Istanbul hotel gem. Following an easy airport pick-up (35.00 EUR for up to 6 people in the same car), we were greeted with a warm welcome, tea and Turkish Delight and had great rooms that were modern, new, sparkling clean with every amenity including handmade local products, a loofah sponge, complimentary water and WiFi. A delicious breakfast buffet featured everything you needed, along with a complimentary 'after tea buffet' with at least 7 kinds of pastries, coffee and tea. This was a welcome treat after visiting the city all afternoon in the winter cold and snow. The location was an easy 5 minute walk from the Blue Mosque and historical centre. Thank you Hotel Amira staff. I will definitely be going back as there is so much more of Istanbul to see!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay!”
Reviews.Author: lebana_nahc
Reviews.Content: It's already clear that Hotel Amira has enough reviews to credit the quality of this hotel and thanks to the TA reviewers I decided to stay here mid December 2011 for 2 nights. I cannot fault this place - on immediate arrival (being absolutely exhausted off a 14hour flight and 2 days of touring cappadocia!) we were given complimentary drinks, a quick guide to Istanbul and the activities and sights available (great location too), and a free room upgrade! The rooms/service/buffet breakfasts were without fault. Will definitely be staying at Hotel Amira again - you definitely won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: Soporifix
Reviews.Content: Perfect location: walking distance to all major attractions, good restaurants nearby, nice little bazaar a few blocks away. Very clean and comfortable, luxurious showers, very friendly and helpful staff, and amazing breakfasts. No reason to stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dora V
Reviews.Content: We were very greatly impressed with the hotel. The staff was so very helpful and nice. It's the first time a hotel offers to provide information on the city as soon as you arrive without having to ask for it. Showed us they really wanted us to find our way around and enjoy Istanbul as much as possible. Breakfast and tea time were fantastic and delicious. The room was nice, clean and provided us with what we needed. The location is a plus. You can walk to all the must visit sites, to restaurants, etc. In summary, we will be staying at the Amira when we come back to Istanbul with the kids. You should too!!

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location”
Reviews.Author: AlmeriensePorElMundo
Reviews.Content: Great welcome to the hotel with a drink, a relaxed introduction and a full explanation about places to visit, restaurants, going out, etc. Meanwhile they took our luggage to our room! All their recommendations were fair and up-to-date. All staff really kind and attentive during the whole stay, I would say they are the hotel's main asset. The hotel is nicely decorated and has all amenities, including real high speed Internet and a basic but very well kept gym. The terrace is gorgeous, although we were not lucky with the weather and could not enjoy it. Breakfast is OK and they also offer an afternoon tea with nice cakes and pastries, very appreciated after a day walking around. We had dinner one night and I believe it came from an outside restaurant (it was almost cold when served), but was fit for purpose if you just wanted to avoid going out. On the down side, it is very noisy. It has paper walls: we could hear our neighbor snoring!. It was not a great problem for us but people sensitive to noise should consider it. All in all, great service, great location and a good hotel. We would go again

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dennis6723
Reviews.Content: This is a perfectly located nice boutique hotel, within walking distance to Agia Sophia and other significant attractions of Istanbul. Upon arrival we were greeted by a member of the front desk staff, who sat with us at the rooftop terrace, offered welcome complimentary beverages and provided valuablle advice with regard to sightseeing and gastronomy. Rooms were comfortable and clean but not soundproof. Breakfast buffet was average. There were daily complimentary water, afternoon tea with cookies and free wireless internet. Staff were very friendly, helpful and attentive. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I can't imagine a better place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: nanswim
Reviews.Content: Our family met at the Hotel Amira from several different cities around the world. This was the perfect place to rest up from the flight and start our trip. We were there in December, 2011, so the area was not crowded and it was easy to get around. We were within walking distance of almost everything we wanted to see, including a bazaar and all the usual sights. There was a lovely breakfast and also a relaxing and delicious afternoon tea. The hotel staff was VERY helpful and took care of all the telephoning required to find out what had happened to my luggage (which did not arrive from Heathrow Airport) and arrange to have it delivered. The rooms were not huge but were comfortable and very beautifully decorated, clean, and had all the modern conveniences that international travelers expect. The guide that the hotel staff recommended was perfect. And an added bonus was the spa/jacuzzi, which you could reserve for a period of time and use as a private relaxation room with the family after a hard day on the cobblestones

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: 3hearts
Reviews.Content: We stayed at hotel Amira for 3 nights and loved everything about it. Very high quality customer service combined with great amenities and a very convenient location make this hotel the perfect choice when in Istanbul. We arranged for an airport pick up - which is paid for separately - and it went smoothly. Upon arrival we were greeted by Tina who kindly took us to the bar/restaurant and offered us drinks while she explained what our options for tours were and used a map to show us where the main attractions were located. That was vey helpful. Location was very convenient, short walk (8-10 minutes) to Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia and other attractions. If you want you can also take the tram to other parts of the city - you can buy tokens at the reception, which does come in handy. Our room was great, very quiet - the only one on the last floor #801. Beautifully decorated, very spacious and clean, bathroom also very nice and clean with a great hydromassage bath. Breakfast was delicious, good assortment of cheese and cold cuts and freshly baked breads. On our last day we had to leave very early to the airport (5 am) and were offered to have our breakfast in our room before leaving. Very nice and welcomed hospitality touch - small things that make a very big difference. They also offer a daily afternoon tea that is very nice to have as well, a warm welcome when coming back from a long walk on a rainy day. Again, small details that make a difference. Very good complimentary wifi as well. After staying at so many hotels who offer wifi but the connection fails to work in the rooms, it was nice to have a speedy and functioning service anywhere in the property. There is a nice fitness/wellness area that is very nice. The jacuzzi and sauna area can be booked in advance for private use for a fee. It was a nice way to relax at the end of the day. We would definitely recommend this hotel to family and friends and would come back if in Istanbul again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to bring in the New Year!”
Reviews.Author: klrbee
Reviews.Content: Friends of mine and I stayed here on our way back home from Africa, and what wonderful place to transition back into reality!! We stayed for 3 nights and 4 days, that included New Year's Eve. We arrived very early in the morning, so because our rooms weren't ready yet the staff made sure we had a lovely breakfast and then promptly gave us all the information we could possibly want regarding places to go and things to see, along with restaurants and New Year's Eve options. They even made reservations for us and helped us exchange money. The rooms are on the smaller side, but very nice and clean. Didn't really care about the size so much as when you are in Istanbul you won't be in your room much : ) The location of the hotel is perfect, walking distance to just about everything. And even though we had a booked tour during the day, we still walked to other sites and dinner at night, and on our free day walked all the way to the Spice Market. We wound up not eating dinner at the hotel, (because there were just too many choices for restaurants close by and the suggestions the hotel gave us were superb!!) but the food we did have at the hotel was great! One of the highlights was New Year's Eve when the staff decorated the dining area and laid out an incredible cocktail party for all the guests!! This is a lovely boutique hotel and I think you will enjoy it a lot. If you are from the States, don't expect the Ritz... and thank God it wasn't ; ) The staff is awesome, the location perfect and a great value for the money. Don't hesitate to go!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, welcoming and relaxed”
Reviews.Author: thetravellingdrums
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Amira for five nights. Arthur welcomed us very warmly and with an excellent Turkish coffee. We appreciated his excellent introduction to Istanbul and ideas for discovering this exciting city. His suggestions of two private guided walking tours were fantastic. The cruise was also pleasant and the guide helpful. Arthur was truly a hospitable, kind and friendly member of the team. We loved the breakfasts at Amira which found us lingering every morning and the afternoon teas were delightful after a day of touring. Our room 405 had a terrace and a lovely view and , while not slick and modern with decor which seemed perhaps a little worn, it was spacious and comfortable. The location is very good for getting around the old part of the city. The staff were always willing to assist and their fond farewell at our departure just confirmed the feeling of Amira being a comfortable base away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lainey86
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent 3 night in the Hotel Amira in Jan 2012 and had a wonderful time. We booked the deluxe room and found it to be the perfect size. The room had all of the usual perks, ipod dock, adapters etc. The only negative about the room is very minor, we had requested a bath but received a shower. The shower was lovely so it was fine. Breakfast was nice, coffe, juice, lots of fruit and pastries. The hotel also hosts afternoon tea every day which we availed of once. The real bonus about teh hotel is the staff, they were extremely helpfula nd friendly. Once we arrived, Arthur teh concierge sat us down and gave us a map which helped us to get our bearing. Arthur helped us to get our bearings and also asssited us in making a plan for our time in Istanbul to faciliate us in making teh most of our visit. Arthur helpfully recommened bars, restuarnts, tours and the haman. It really made such a difference to our trip to have somebody helpfully show you where best to go. Obviously we had a guide book but it's best to get a locals opinion. The location was anotehr winner as it's less than a 10 minute walk from teh Blue Mosque and teh Square arou7nd there which is where all teh little cafes etc. are located. It was great to be within walking distance but also to be ona quiet street.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel not top rated!”
Reviews.Author: Nikcheh
Reviews.Content: Because of all the raving reviews, I stayed there for 3 nights in Dec.2011. My room was much smaller than what appeared in the pictures. Toilet had an unbearable smell which if the fan was not on you could hardly stay in the room. Rooms are not sound proof. You can hear every thing. Staff are helpful but so were they in other hotels. Location is good. Breakfast buffet is average. Over all, after I stayed in other hotels (same price) in Istanbul I rate this one just an average hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay with a few minor bumps”
Reviews.Author: eat_drink_and_sleep
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that the staff at this hotel couldn't have been kinder or more helpful. They made my stay go from great to exceptional. The breakfast was also extraordinary and very well maintained. The only reason I gave this four stars is that the rooms were a bit noisy and if you were a light sleeper this would not do. The noise didn't really affect me, but you could hear the tv's, etc from other rooms thoughout the night Other than that I would recommend to anyone. Also: I did their airport service pickup and HIGHLY recommend. Super smooth and easy, especially with Attaturk airport being so crazy.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely great stay, friendly staff, great location and lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: pjc710
Reviews.Content: Our stay could not have been any better from the time we were picked up from the airport till the time we were dropped off, both in the hotels very comfortable airport transfer mercedes. We were told on our arrival to the hotel it was our lucky day and we were being upgraded to a suite. The suite was huge and very plush indeed. Location was very central 10 mins walk from blue mosque and transportation - tram and buses etc. The staff we very helpful and friendly througout our stay. I will definitely be staying here again when I return to Istanbul. Very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Should be #1 - beautiful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sully_Caffs
Reviews.Content: From the moment you enter reception (actually, the moment they greet your taxi) the staff are curtious, friendly & make you feel at home. The welcome induction was great, there was no hard sell into doing trips & the staff made some genuine reccomendations for both restuarants & for things to do. Continential breakfast was fine - all was fresh, clean & served buffet style in a relaxed environment. In terms of location, it is in the heart of the old part of Intanbul & not too far from the tram to get you into the new part. I would certainly go back to Istanbul & would be checking to see if Amira had any rooms free!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I have visited, ever!”
Reviews.Author: popetteCork
Reviews.Content: Just back from a romantic break with my husband. The hotel Amira ticked every romance box. We were welcomed by Spencer who talked us through anywhere we may want to visit in Istanbul. Meanwhile, the romance fairy spread rose petals on our large comfy bed and placed chocolate fondue , strawberries and wine in our bedroom, as well as our cases. A very well stocked minibar, fab bathroom with jacuzzi bath, tropical shower, underfloor heating[It was cold in Istanbul] fluffy bathrobes, slippers etc made me feel very pampered! The breakfast was excellent, and the croissants the best I have ever eaten. Located close to all the sights of Istanbul, just around the corner from most.Friendly and efficient staff made this a holiday to remember! Should be number 1.

Reviews.Title: “â€œThis is a wonderful place to stay in Istanbulâ€�”
Reviews.Author: Bruce B
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for 2 days. The staff are excellent - very friendly and helpful. The hotel is a great, clean, comfortable, nice boutique hotel, in an outstanding location - just a few minutes' walk from major old city sites, and on a relatively quiet street. Incredible breakfast and very nice afternoon tea. I can really recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Every Moment”
Reviews.Author: lokeshJosipa
Reviews.Content: Myself and my girlfriend stayed for 7 nights during new years eve 2011/12 and we had a fantastic time. We enjoyed every moment and the staff were really friendly and made us felt home.Location was excellent and made our stay more convenient. We shared great moments of love joy happiness in this trip and will always stay in our hearts. We like to thank all the staff for making our trip memorable and love to recommend without any second thoughts. Lokesh&Josipa

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice place, perfect service.”
Reviews.Author: ThaisOReilly
Reviews.Content: Really close to all sight seeings on sulthanamet. The topfloor patio is perfect for a drink at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel; excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Tariq2000
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Amira for 4 nights in December 2011. The staff was friendly, helpful and courteous. We were given individual attention at check in. We got a free room upgrade, The breakfast had a nice selection and plentiful. In the afternoon you could relax with tea and coffee free of charge. The hotel is within walking distance to major attractions in the old city of Istanbul. Definitely recommended for families and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in a long time”
Reviews.Author: Zinka99
Reviews.Content: We traveled as a family of four, with 2 adults and two 20-something children. We were looking for spacious family room accommodations so we could all be more independent. We stayed here twice, on our way in and out of Turkey, after touring the Aegean coast near Izmir. These were the best family rooms we have ever encountered. The 2 rooms were large and beautiful. They were connected but also had separate entrances. Service was impeccable but not intrusive. Breakfast was varied and plentiful. We also looked forward to afternoon tea, to relax before going out for dinner. The loukums were the best! The hotel is in the southeastern part of Sultanahmet, close to the attractions but slightly off the beaten track, meaning that it is quieter and calmer. We are normal sleepers so the occasional street noise and the gentle minaret calls did not disturb us. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “choose the right hotel in Istanbul, old city”
Reviews.Author: rachelSFL
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this hotel to the tourists to Istanbul. The staff are so very warm-hearted and help me to fix the heater in such cold weather. The only poor thing was the bad weather,even the hotel is located very close to Blue Mosque, but the heavy rain stuck me in the hotel for long.

Reviews.Title: “This is a wonderful place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: dhoopstick
Reviews.Content: We loved our recent trip to Amira in Istanbul. The staff are excellent - very friendly and helpful. The hotel is a great, clean, comfortable, nice boutique hotel, in an outstanding location - just a few minutes' walk from major old city sites, and on a relatively quiet street. Incredible breakfast and very nice afternoon tea. We organized a couple of tours throught the hotel for our group of 9, and they were excellent - great guides and great tours. All 9 of us loved this hotel. They also have a greatjacuzzi. Good restaurant recommendations. Overall only great things to say and if we are lucky enough to visit Istanbul again, we'd definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, family-friendly hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: LSMChina
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Amira for 5 nights over the New Years holiday. We chose the hotel based on the trip advisor ratings and the excellent reviews the hotel has received are very accurate. We are a family of 5 from the US with kids 14, 12, and 9. The hotel staff was responsive both prior to our booking and during our stay. When we emailed we received prompt responses and decided to book two connecting rooms which were very comfortable for our family, with each child getting their own bed. The hotel staff was attentive to details and took care of our transportation to and from the airport. Upon arrival we were greeted with drinks and an offer to help us plan our stay in Istanbul. When we departed at 4 am, they brought us an early breakfast at 3:30 a.m. The staff was very helpful with booking arrangements and dinner reservations. Overall the hotel was good value with plentiful continental breakfast included and free wi-fi. The rooms were very comfortable and extremely clean. There is even a small gym in the basement with two treadmills and a bike in good working condition. There was also tea with snacks every afternoon. The location was very convenient; we were able to walk (with the 3 kids) to all the major sites and to shopping. We bought some tram tokens but never ended up using them because it was easier to walk. We took taxis only a few times in the 4 days. We loved our time in Istanbul and Hotel Amira provided a great base.

Reviews.Title: “another great stay at Hotel Amira”
Reviews.Author: barusso
Reviews.Content: we just returned from our 4th stay at the Hotel Amira (this time, a combined 7 days, 2 rooms) and the stay and service were as wonderful as before. The rooms, 501 - a large room where 4 of our adult children stayed and 601 and 403 where we stayed with another child were modern, clean and spacious for European standards and the WIFI internet strong with routers on most floors. The treated windows, when shut, kept out the morning call-toprayer, the breakfast, ample afternoon tea and evening bar service were lovely. Room 403 and the rooms next to it have a private terrace with a table, chairs and a view of the sea. Kartal, Arthur, the morning breakfast ladies and Aziz, especially, and the rest of the staff can't do enough for you, never wanting you to lift a finger and always happily answering questions, making requested arrangements, calling cars, etc. it's a small boutique hotel with the service of a 5*, even better than some that we have experienced. Being this stay was in December, we missed using the comfortable and well-appointed terrace and having evening drinks poking over the sea, but we did go up there a few times for a view even though cold. our kids appreciated using the work-out room. We enjoyed our stay again and would happily go back. Thanks Amira.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem in the middle of Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: Franeczka
Reviews.Content: the hotel is within walking distance to most of the historic places of interest! Really. No need to take and pay for a tram trip.
