Safe area, not so crowded (Dec-Jan) compared to Taxim district. The hotel itself - great, clean, cosy. The room I got (505) was sparkling clean, comfortable. A fridge, a kettle, a tv... clean towels every day. The only disadvantage was the noise from the pipes (bathroom) and from the outside. But I did not mind it, whereas some may find it unbearable. I did not mind, so I did not complain. The staff - very friendly and offering help at all times Welcome drink and introduction to the hotel and Istanbul by a manager (thank you Arthur!) Breakfast - almost whatever you want (fresh orange juice; scrambled eggs; sausages; variety of cereals and cheeses, vegetables to mention just a few). Not enough- you can order (but pay) food specially made for you. Happy hour at 17 - tea time for all the guests - coffee/tea/cakes...everything on the house Cocktail party on Dec31st for the guests and the staff - wow- a nice gesture! Surprise.First time I had been treated like that Nice view from the terrace though to cold to stay there at this time of year. I can really recommend the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel service and location!!!”
Reviews.Author: ItaSco
Reviews.Content: In October my boyfriend and I spend 5 nights in this excellent hotel. The location was perfect and the staff so very helpful. The first night we were very tired and decided to have dinner at the hotel and we haven't regret it at all. We especially liked the warm welcome at arrival, we were offered a drink and were introduced to Istanbul and provided with maps and advice on attraction and restaurant that we have found spot on. We also had the pleasure to experience the Spa all to ourselves, since it was his birthday I wanted to surprise my boyfriend with a romantic stay at the Spa and the Hotel surprised us both with a delicious cake that I was not expecting at all!!! Fantastic! I would certainly recommend this hotel and I would love to go back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AJK1969
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Amira for 6 nights over Christmas 2011 and couldn't have asked for a better hotel. My room was lovely, extremely spacious and kept spotlessly clean. Breakfast was great and provided enough variety to suit all, and the hotel provied a tea time treat at 5pm every day where guests were served tea, nibbles and turkish delight - absolutely charming. But the real joy of the hotel were the staff. They were faultlessly welcoming and helpful and seemed happpy to go out of their way to make their guests stay as pleasant as possible. Our welcome drink and induction to the city was the most personnable welcome to a hotel I've experienced to date. On a more practical note the hotel is really well situated. It's within easy walking distance of Hagia Sofia and the Blue Mosque, and only a few minutes from the Little Hagia Sophia and it's charming courtyard of craft shops. Public transport is nearby and the reception staff sell tram tokens at cost, completely removing any initial teething issues with using a new system. I can't recommend this hotel more strongly and will defintely stay with them again should I return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sheenuh
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and thoroughly agree with the other reviewers. The location of the hotel was very convenient, the staff was extremely helpful and the rooms were lovely. We had only 2 full days to explore Istanbul but were still able to easily visit numerous sights from the hotel. The Blue Mosque and The Hagia Sophia are within walking distance, as is the tram. You can purchase tram tokens from the hotelâ€™s front desk. Our package included van service to and from the airport, which was very helpful. The package also included a half-day tour, and while it was enjoyable I would not necessarily recommend it, but not through any fault of the hotel. We chose to do the afternoon tour which went to Topkapi Palace. A van picked us up at a hotel, and after making a few stops at other hotels we had to switch vans. We probably spent about 30 minutes getting to the Palace when we could have walked in half the time; in fact we skipped the transportation after the tour and just walked back to the hotel. If you choose to visit the Palace Iâ€™d recommend doing it on your own and they have audio guides for rent. The tap water is not recommended for drinking and the hotel nicely provides a big bottle of water in your room free of charge each day. Both breakfast and afternoon tea are included daily. Between these two things and getting a light snack during the day, we found this was all we needed. We are thinking of returning to Istanbul during the same time next year, and if we do we will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: ViaggiarexConoscere
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend Hotel Amira in Istanbul. The hotel is lovely (very good taste, even in Xmas decorations!), very well located, near the old quarter, few minutes walk from Aya Sofia, Blue Mosque, Bazars. The staff was extremely kind and helpful, the room was very nice, comfortable, clean, stylish and at the same time simple. There are beautiful views. Breakfast and the complimentary 5pm tea buffet amazing!

Reviews.Title: “I'll come back....”
Reviews.Author: Dwinov
Reviews.Content: Being there for 3 days make me realize that I trip was too short. Istanbul is a great city, I enjoy every moment there. But Amira make it perfect. The location is closed to every where, I only walked and use the tram, even to go from and to the airport. The service was perfect!! The concierge/the front officer really helped us a lot on showing all the recommendation attraction in Istanbul. But the one that really leave a memorable moment for me is the breakfast buffet.. It's not many option, but it sure give a deep fabulous expression in me.. The best bread I ever had!!! The tomatoes beautifull.. The cheese, speachless.. I enjoy having my breakfast there.. I'll coming back to Istanbul, and for sure I'll stay in Amira.. again..

Reviews.Title: “500+ Excellent Reviews Can't Be Wrong”
Reviews.Author: SteveKC
Reviews.Content: My friends and I booked a 4 night stay based on the positive reviews and were not disappointed. As others have mentioned, the location is perfect for visiting the highlights of Istanbul and the staff was outstanding. Extremely helpful without being overbearing. The hotel arranged our transportation to/from the airport and even though we arrived after 1am there was staff on hand to check us in and assist with baggage. Just a great experience all around.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Beckynyc
Reviews.Content: The staff at Hotel Amira were incredibly nice, welcoming and helpful. They provided us with directions, restaurant recommendations (really good ones) and reservations, umbrellas when it rained, advice on things to do, all in a very gracious manner. To me, that makes all the difference. The hotel is spotlessly clean and nicely decorated (unless you don't like red). The breakfast was very good and had sufficient variety and good quality, but nothing to write home about. We enjoyed the afternoon tea as well. It's not a grand hotel with a big lobby to hang out in, but a smallish hotel that is small enough to provide the right amount of attention to its guests, but not so small that you feel like you're in somebody's home. The location is very good, just a few blocks uphill to many of the sights. The bed was comfortable. Our room was smallish, but it was fine for our needs with a big bed that was fairly comfortable, a nice tv, good lighting, big windows. The bathroom was quite small, but adequate, and had a tub and nice toiletries. It needed a touch of regrouting.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel in superb city”
Reviews.Author: Max L
Reviews.Content: booked this hotel after reading reviews on T/A, fantastic hotel and brilliant service, arrived late at 1 am and still 2 people to open doors and check us in , they even provided some sandwiches for us, fantastic location and within walking distance of all major sights,staff could not do enough for us, i would stay here again if in Istanbul,

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Accomodation, excellent and extreme helpfull staff”
Reviews.Author: Member16_10
Reviews.Content: This Boutique Hotel is in the Centre of the Old City, close to everything, excellent location, the staff were very very helpful, the reception was unique, very special they offer you a drink and they explain how and where everything is, they give you any warnings about anything that they think you might need to know, they even have token for the tram , which is about 5 min walk, the people are all very friendly and helpful, they have a lovely tea, you can have any time of the day, the top roop terrace was great, it had a fantastic 360o view of the whole area and to the Sea, the food magnificent. We would go back anytime, turk people are lovely people.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Vivian-Ke
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in Istanbul and we found Hotel Amira a great place to stay to explore the city. The staff were warm and friendly. They made our stay comfortable and safe.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent option in Istambul”
Reviews.Author: Mmanso1
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, highest standards. They receive you and provide an overview of the city main points, transport, etc. There is a complementary tea, pastry, biscuits, etc, every day at 17:00 hours. Free WiFi is available 24/7 all across the hotel and rooms. Rooms are clean and plenty of space, well decorated, and even have a music equipment for Iphone. The wellness-private sauna & jacuzzi is great. You just need to book it in advance and you get it for private use. There was a problem with the jacuzzi one day and they booked us in on the following day for free, plus they invited us to some food and wine to compensate the inconvenience. Real good service. Location is great, just by the main sites to visit, all within walking distance. I will definitely repeat when we return to istambul.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: whereabouts1
Reviews.Content: So many things have been said about this hotel, that I can only add some personal impressions, mostly on the positive side: 1) Friendliest staff ever encountered in a hotel (many thanks to Arthur). Nice with directions, recommendations, preparing the bill, everyting. 2) Breakfast: reasonable, don't have too high expectations. Pretty similar in each day. 3) 5'o clock tea+cookies: great experience. 4) Rooms: very nice, we had a standard room and had a pleasant surprise of discovering a jacuzzi-like bathtub (perhaps to compensate that we were on the first floor and could hear each street noise). 5) Location: excellent. Near the most important sights, friendly and safe neighbourhood. 6) Bus shuttle to airport: perhaps overpriced (all of them are), but punctual and most helpful if you have a lot of luggage (otherwise you need to change two transportation means and taxis are probably more expensive). 7) To sum up - best thing in Istanbul has been this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all round”
Reviews.Author: dayfornight
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in July. Excellent standards of comfort, cleanliness and service. Breakfast was wonderful with a huge selection. Turkish Airlines lost our luggage, and the reception staff worked tirelessly for 2 days to recover it, which was not an easy task. Good location, within walking distance of many of the most important sights. I travel to Istanbul frequently, and this is quite a find!

Reviews.Title: “Just Great”
Reviews.Author: rochestervacationer
Reviews.Content: Ditto to all of the reviews below. I hope my review puts them back in first place for Istanbul. The hotel is perfect. Wonderful location, friendly and helpful staff, pretty swank rooms and atmosphere. I also thought it was a very reasonable price for what you got. As everyone else said, it is just exactly what you would want in a hotel. The one negative is that the tours that you book through the hotel (or get free with a lot of packages) are terrible and overpriced. We went on the Old City tour because it was free with our package (which is basically two sites- Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque- within throwing distance of the hotel and the bazaar). If you stay at the hotel , you will walk by these sites countless times to restaurants, etc. That is probably the most amazing part of being in Istanbul. They are strikingly beautiful. However, this frigging tour takes us to the entire other side of Istanbul to change cars and then brings you back. So it is an hour of driving to literally get back to the exact same place where you were. We couldn't even believe it. The absolute worst part of it though is the final part of the tour is this ridiculous sales pitch for rugs. I felt like it was one of those time-share scams where they give you something free but you have to sit through a sales pitch- for like a half hour. Plus the tour guides don't really don't tell you anything. So, we were really annoyed to have wasted like three hours driving out of the way and back again and then having to sit through a sales pitch. Just go see the sites yourself (the Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque, and the Bazaar) The other tour we took was a tour of the Bosphorus. It cost the two of us 70 euro. Again, across town and back again. It's not as bad because the exchange between vehicles it is actually much closer to the boat tour. But the kicker was that the boat tour could be had for 12.50 lira. So, for the two of us, it would have cost 25 lira, which would have been like 14 bucks instead of the 110 dollars that the tour cost. The tour had no value added beyond taking us to the place where the boats leave from. You can get a taxi for like 15 lira (or 9 bucks). So, save yourself the money and the time, take a cab, and pay 20some dollars instead of the vastly more money for the useless transfer and tour guide. Oh, minor complaint- I did not like that at the hotel some of their prices for minibar etc. were in lira and some in euros.

Reviews.Title: “What else can you expect from a hotel ????”
Reviews.Author: Varito
Reviews.Content: This is quite simple: what else can you expect, if you have a fantastic stay, in a great place, perfectly located, with the most friendly staff you can find, in a wonderful hotel. It woudl be really a hard work to find some negative comment to make. I booked this hotel based on the Trip Advisor reviews, for a 3 nights stay last week-end, and also convinced some friends who were travelling with us. At the beginning, since we are all very frequent business travellers, used to "chain hotels" (Intercontinental, Radisson, Hyatt), where in most cases you have a certain guarantee on some minimum standards, in this case, we were all very sceptic,.......... but now we are all convinced that weÂ´ll come back. Our expectations where all highly exceeded, also in the context of the price. Great value for the money. As mentioned in some reviews, it is true that on the rooms located on the ground floor, the street noise could be excessive, thatÂ´s why, 10 minutes after arrival, on thursday night, I decided to ask for a room change, what the hotel did for me. In my case, I mentioned that I made the reservation more than 2 months ago, and that they had a lot of time to assign me a better room, what they did immediately, therefore once this first minor issue was saved, the stay was simply fantastic. Good breakfast, and very well decorated rooms, with a lot of style and charme. All the staff is very friendly, open to assist and help, suggest, and provide indications on key places to visit. My most sincere congratulations to the complete team, and hope I visit the hotel again shortly, therefore, as main conclusion, if anybody is planning to visit Istanbul, donÂ´t waste time searching for alternatives. This is surely one of the best ones.

Reviews.Title: “Great location--Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: recreationaltraveler
Reviews.Content: If you want the best location and a very knowledgable, courteous staff with nice rooms and baths, this must be your choice!

Reviews.Title: “Believe the excellent reviews!”
Reviews.Author: CanadianJaneToronto
Reviews.Content: Reality can fall short of ones expectations when so many people rave about something. Not with Hotel Amira and their staff. We stayed seven nights starting October 20, 2011. From the moment we arrived, it was obvious that this is a staff that goes the extra mile to take care of you. We arrived later than planned the first evening, tired. We were greeted warmly by Ferhat who invited us to sit with him as he went over all the pertinent details of the hotel and city while we enjoyed very good complimentary Turkish wine. Kartal (The Eagle!), Arthur, Ferit and the other staff all had a great sense of humor, always greated us warmly and paid close attention to what we were looking for, giving us guidance accordingly. They have excellent suggestions, are great at listening. As one review said, it is not the Four Seasons nor is the price, but the staff are of the same quality. The hotel is in a good location, very clean, well appointed, roomy and provides a stellar roof top terrace to enjoy a drink as you look out to the sea. Aiziz the bartender is an absolute pleasure. The complimentary breakfast was very good, generous and set us up for the day. Be sure to visit the store across the street, Little St. Sophia Style Home, where Mehmet will do his best to find that special item to buy.

Reviews.Title: “EXPERIENCED TRAVELERS SAY "PERFECT!"”
Reviews.Author: ed h
Reviews.Content: Clean, fresh smelling, modern U.S. style bath, luxurious mattress and linens; terrific breakfast, tea, late-night food, all free; polite, friendly knowledgeable staff; short walk to everything. We left a very substantial amount of cash in the trash and incredibly, they found it and wired it back to us.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - loved it! Thank you Arthur!!”
Reviews.Author: lesfraser
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend at the Amira - brilliant! From the moment we were greeted by Arthur and he took us through the facilities of the hotel and their recommendations for sight-seeing, restaurants and bars (they only select the ones they like, not the ones that pay them commission!) to departure - the stay was perfect. Great location within walking distance of all of the old city sights, nice bar, comfortable rooms - we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: fionakk
Reviews.Content: We booked Amira based on tripadvisor reviews and we were not disappointed in the slightest! We stayed in the family room which was perfect for our family of five and even nicer than represented in the photos on tripadvisor. We loved the boutique feel and personalized welcome from Arthur. Breakfast was excellent and included many healthy choices. The position is outstanding and complimentary afternoon tea a delight!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: SJetley
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hotel Amira for five nights and found it to be incredibly comfortable and clean. The staff were wonderfully friendly, specifically the reception staff who would do anything for you to make your stay a happy one. I must also mention Aziz who worked in the bar & restaurant; possibly the happiest and most friendly person I've come across in a long while. Even when we got back on our last evening just after the bar had closed they were happy to still serve us a bottle of wine. Nothing appeared to be any bother. The rooms were very comfortable (the bed being more comfy than mine at home!), the bathrooms very clean and with great showers. I would suggest maybe asking for a room which wasn't on street level as it could get a bit noisy but other than that, cannot think of a single reason why I wouldn't go back to this hotel. It is ideally located for sightseeing being right behind the Blue Mosque and only a short walk from the tram stop. I love Turkey and go back every year - this hotel just epitomises the amazing level of service we've become accustomed to in that country. Put simply, it was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Olijr
Reviews.Content: This is truly the best run hotel I have ever been to. They do everything that could make your stay and exploration easy and fruitful automatically. For example when you arrive they sit you down, while our bags are being put your room, offer you a free drink and give you a map which they then guide you through. Their recommendations were very good and made exploring very easy, though we still got lost a few times! You can buy tram tokens, at the normal rate, from reception, which they just add to your bill, which saves you time figuring out the machines. When we had problems with a tour company being late they phoned them on our behalf and sorted it out for us even though the booking had nothing to do with the hotel. They have free tea, coffee and cake at 5pm and the breakfasts were delicilous. The room provides everything you could ask for and is of a very voluptuous turkish style. Nice touches like robes, a good selection of tea and coffee and a decent size bottle of complimentary water are great and make life easy. The hotel is just so unbelievably well run, they really do make a huge effort to make you stay as pleasurable as possible. They even had some of their lamp shades expressed to us on our last night from their supplier because we liked them so much and wanted some to take home with us. Really really fantastic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location and fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: hendrix17
Reviews.Content: Had a fantastic 2 nights at this hotel. We had a superior room and it was a good standard - very clean, comfy and quite tastefully decorated (not too over-the-top blingy like other Turkish establishments!) My only small complaint was there wasn't enough shower gel - a tiny little bottle for 2 people that disappeared after one shower. The mini bar was well stocked and not too over priced (which makes a pleasant change) and the wi-fi worked perfectly. The staff at the hotel couldn't be more helpful - they welcomed us with afternoon tea and pastries (which is complementary every afternoon) and gave us a short and informative overview of the local sights, transport system etc. They also helped by confirming restaurant bookings, calling taxis etc. The location is good, 5 min walk from main square. On the whole a great little hotel - we'd go back and would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Highlight of the Trip”
Reviews.Author: BridgetOz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Amira in July 2011 and am so glad I booked this hotel for my stay in Istanbul. I have spent many holidays in Turkey and have lived in the country for a period of time in various tourist areas. This is one of this nicest places I have stayed while on holiday in Turkey. It is a beautiful hotel with very kind and caring staff who helped me organise anything I needed. I arrived late at night and had organised a private pick up, which was very much worth it as I was not feeling well on arrival. The next morning I woke up late and missed breakfast but when the staff realised I had missed breakfast they had someone in the kitchen make me up a lovely platter. The breakfast spread is amazing and they have a great selection of cheeses, meats, cereals, olives, pastries, and juices/teas/coffees. The rooms are very, VERY comfortable and really charming. The location is fantastic and is only a very short (maybe 3-5min walk) from the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofya, the underground basilica, Islamic arts museum and various other sites. It is maybe a 10minute walk from the Grand Bazaar and once there you are very close to the Spice Bazaar. The only problem I had was when I was leaving and I decided to get a taxi, instead of a private transfer, from the hotel to the airport. Unfortunately the taxi driver tried to rip me off quite a great deal of money for the ride. This is not the fault of the hotel in anyway but did take away from my enjoyable experience so I do recommend private transfers. Otherwise, find out how much the trip should be (I think it is roughly 25-35YTL) but double check with the staff and make sure the taxi driver keeps the toll on at all times. The hotel suits all travellers including business, couples, family, friends and solo. I travelled as a single female and felt very safe and looked after, not that I have felt unsafe in any of my time spent in Turkey. However, I probably have never been so comfortable. Overall, I cannot speak highly enough of my experience here and will most definitely return back to Hotel Amira on my next trip to Istanbul. Thank you to all the staff who made my stay so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and big rooms, good location, Courteous staff. A bit expensive though.”
Reviews.Author: HunyG
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed 2 nights stay. Rooms were spacious and clean. We were on 4th floor. Our friends on the 2nd floor complained of noise from the street. Staff was really nice and helpful. Location is good and 5 mins walk from the Sultanahmet square.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: JamieAshwell
Reviews.Content: Just what you expect; clean, friendly, excellent location, nice extra touches, well decorated. It was a real pleasure to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: ChristineBel
Reviews.Content: This hotel has just the right balance, excellent service, lovely rooms, friendly staff. The library of books about Istanbul was appreciated, plus the lovely teat time treats and great breakfasts. I would highly recommend this hotel to all types of traveller

Reviews.Title: “Fantastics Stay”
Reviews.Author: reub23
Reviews.Content: I had several nights at the Amira earlier this year. Very comfortable and clean hotel, room was very nice, with jacuzzi in bathroom. Handy location, nice stroll to restaurants, Arasta Bazaar, Blue mosque etc. Staff are fantastic. Helpful, friendly, and genuine. Breakfast good. The hotel just has a nice "small hotel" boutique feel, where you are made feel welcome and at home. Rooftop area also very nice. Would stay again when in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for money in Istanbul!!”
Reviews.Author: Kevin07_11
Reviews.Content: Before we arrived in early NovemberI was a little apprehensive as I had booked in 2 other couples travelling with us. I need not have worried. Car was waiting for us at the port as arranged and we received welcome drinks and an overview of Istanbul's major attractions as soon as we arrived. Suites were spotless, spacious and comfortable but the best feature of this hotel is the outstanding service to guests provided by Farhat, Arthur and the whole team......you may stay in more palatial and far more expensive hotels but you will never receive better service than that provided here...cant wait to go back !!!

Reviews.Title: “A Truely Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: merryl42
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Amira on our recent trip to Istanbul. We had high expectations from what we had seen on their website but all expectations were far exceeded. From the moment we arrived, we were greeted with such warmth and sincerity and taken up to the stunning roof terrace for drinks and orientation from Arthur. The view is breathtaking. Our room was gorgeous, spacious, immaculately clean, beautifully decorated and with mini bar, full size bar, TV, Jacuzzi bath, shower, sofa, table and chairs. Large King size bed and very comfortable. Afternoon tea was a lovely and unexpected addition. Lovely tea, coffee, drinks and selection of breads, sandwiches and cakes. The breakfast buffet is plentiful with everything you could wish for and a very wide selection of foods all beautifully fresh and well presented. Again such attentive and friendly service from all the staff. Within easy walking distance to all the main attractions including Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Cisterns, Hippodrome and even Topkapi Palace. We can't speak highly enough of this hotel and especially of the wonderful staff who work there. We have never experienced such warmth, sincerity and genuine friendliness in all the places we have stayed. For all your Turkish souvenir shopping we highly recommend Little St Sofia shop, which is directly across the road from Amira. Very friendly and helpful owner with extremely reasonable prices. Huge range of carpets, ceramics, lamps, tapestries, paintings and so much more. His prices are far better than at the Bazaar. Also Nova Roma located around the corner from the hotel, for other souvenirs. All in all we adored our time in Istanbul and cannot wait to return. Given this experience we will always return to Hotel Amira. It was just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Topnotch boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: tetarpa
Reviews.Content: My family (the hubby and I with 3 children aged 14, 9, and 2) stayed in this hotel for 2 nights in the last week of October before catching a 10-day eastern Mediterranean cruise. It was an absolutely perfect start to our two-week vacation! Before we even flew to Istanbul, the hotel emailed us some info and e-brochures of the top attractions and restaurants in Istanbul. On arrival, we were welcomed warmly by the staff, and had complimentary drinks while Hotel Amira's Arthur gave us a brief but thorough orientation of the city (old and new areas), a map, and his mobile number just in case we need to call for help. Then he personally escorted us to the family room, which was lovely, incredibly spacious (2 queen beds, a divan, a baby cot, dressing table, 2 accent chairs with small table... we brought in 4 medium luggage, and there was still room to move around in), clean, and conveniently close to the hotel dining area and reception. The hotel has free wifi in the rooms (my teen daughter was so happy), an iMac in a common area for guests to use, and an on-site ATM. The best historical sights, plus very good shopping options (there's an arcade bazaar en route to the Hippodrome and a multi-floor rug-jewelry-ceramic shop called Nakkas which is a recommended shopping stop by Royal Caribbean cruise line), are within 5-10 minutes walk from the hotel. For those who care to know, there's also a McDonald's and Starbucks between the Hagia Sofia and the Grand Bazaar. Our second day in Istanbul was my son's 2nd birthday, and the hotel staff surprised us with a yummy cake with 2 candles for him when we returned to the hotel for the complimentary 5 o'clock tea spread. Our dinner reservation that night with Sarnic Restaurant, previously a cistern behind Hagia Sofia, was arranged by Arthur... and then he offered to drive us there on his way home after his shift! How sweet is that? A half-day Bosphorus cruise can likewise be arranged by the hotel (though we didn't have time to try it), and the price is good compared to others we checked online. Before I booked this hotel, my husband was insistent that we stay at one of the big hotel chains on the Taksim side of Istanbul. Within minutes of checking in at Amira though, the whole family unanimously agreed: no chain hotel gives personal service like this. This excellent boutique hotel gave us one of the best stays we've had in our many years of family vacays!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, kind staff & wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: TravelBug048
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Amira for the first 3 nights of our honeymoon in August and were very pleased with the hotel, the service, location and food. First impressions were great, Kamer & the other staff made us feel at home immediately and took us up to the rooftop on arrival for a welcome drink and talked us through the local area, attractions and marked out a map for us. Nothing was too much trouble for the Hotel Amira staff, the rooftop is a real retreat and a great place for a drink after a long day of sightseeing. The rooms are lovely, quiet and the complimentary tea and cake service @ 5pm was a nice treat as was the delicious breakfast and dining room library stocked with a range of helpful guide books. Highly recommend this hotel, their airport transfer service and their restaurant recommendations. By far the best hotel experience we've had in many years of travelling.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful choice in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: VacationCouple20
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in late September on our first trip to Istanbul. The staff were wonderful, so helpful and friendly. The roof deck is amazing, a perfect spot for drinks or tea. The location was very central and we were able to walk to all the major tourist attractions. Our standard room was lovely and had plenty of space. Breakfast was good and helpful to have included. We can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Bigrosiesmum
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights to celebrate my husband's birthday and couldn't have found a nicer hotel. Room was lovely and spacious, bed comfortable, great shower. The breakfasts had everything you could want and highlight of the day was the complimentary afternoon tea, with mini rolls, lovely cakes and turkish delight washed down with apple tea (as well as other teas or cold drinks) As it was November we didn't make too much use of the roof terrace but it was lovely to watch the sun go down and we did spend a little time relaxing up there. The staff are all lovely and so helpful - absolutely nothing too much trouble. And it is well situated for all the major sites in Sultanahmet. Would love to come back here again

Reviews.Title: “Number one hotel for Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: jazz15
Reviews.Content: We just came home from a visit to Istanbul where we stayed in this perfect hotel for 3 nights. You can see from the photos how lovely it is but photos can give you no information about the employees and the service that you receive from this wonderful group of people who together run the Hotel Amira. If you are wondering whether to book this hotel, I can tell you, look no further. Everything is fantastically good. The rooms are large, the beds are comfortable and the bathrooms are very nice. But it is the beautiful Turkish staff that really make the place. They are so unbelievably friendly and helpful and the best that we have ever encountered. They even let my husband use one of their cell phones to call the USA and with NO CHARGE. Where else would you find that?! We also enjoyed the breakfast that is included and we had lunch and dinner on a couple of occasions. And don't forget to enjoy the complimentary afternoon tea. The Hotel is extremely well located and maps and helpful idirections are readily available from the staff. Please stay in this hotel. You won't regret it and we think it is very good value also. Say hi to Ferhat, Arthur and, Aziz and all the others that you will come to know while you are staying with them. I should also add that our reservations were handled promptly and professionally and the hotel van collected us from our cruise ship right on time as planned. All emails are answered by Ferhat immediately.

Reviews.Title: “Three nights in Instanbul”
Reviews.Author: Andy S
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the Hotel Amira in early October 2011. The hotel staff were very helpful and when we arrived we were given a talk about the hotel and the sights, which were all located on a map for us, very useful. The room was spacious and the bed very comfortable, we had a room with a shower. It was all very clean and tidy. The breakfast was very good with a decent selection. The location is excellent for walking access to the major sites and for shops and food. Trams are straight forward to use and the hotel sells tokens.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good with Room for Improvements”
Reviews.Author: oonaodwyer
Reviews.Content: Spent a week here in October. Won't repeat what others have said only too well. Staff across the board was very friendly and helpful although somehow we never received the much talked about orientation. Bathroom and room nice enough although room not really that comfortable for lounging in. Suggestions for improvement: breakfast was identical every day of the week. After a few days of the identical menu, that does get rather old really fast. Scrambled eggs were either made of powder or were in general just very wet and runny. Hotdogs in BBQ sauce -- kind of odd choice for breakfast. Baked goods would have been nicer if warm or if there were an option for warming them up -- maybe a microwave or toaster on the table? It is definitely worth paying extra for the made to order omelets and the fresh squeezed oj. Also, being in a room on 4th floor directly under lovely rooftop terrace, we were awakened many nights and/or early mornings by staff moving terrace furniture around, probably while cleaning. All in all however, we had a delightful time and would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Two night stay in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: JASHFAQ
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for two nights , that was the last stop of my vacation , booked it directly from their website 129.00 euros per night. I liked the location of the hotel, but found it bit pricey as compared to other boutique hotels nearby , washroom tub needs renovation and water had some drainage problem in the tub. staff was helpful. i will look for other options when im in istanbul next time.

Reviews.Title: “Turkish Delight! - Hotel Amira”
Reviews.Author: Barb S
Reviews.Content: My husband and our two travelling friends recently stayed at the Amira Hotel for 6 days during the first week of November. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Hotel! The superb staff, the location, free and fast Wi-Fi, the breakfast buffet and afternoon tea were all wonderful! From our arrival to our departure every travel detail or request was looked after for us: friendly and helpful staff, maps and sightseeing tips, restaurant recommendations were very good, airport shuttle arrangements, and on-line check-in for flights, all made our stay in Istanbul so memorable! The rooms were clean and comfortable, towels changed daily, and all necessary amenities available. The breakfast buffet was exceptional with its daily spread of breads, coffees, juices, fruit, yogurt, jellies, eggs, cereals and more! Loved the Hotel's afternoon Apple Tea, sandwiches and sweets after a full day of walking about in Istanbul! The Hotel's location is in the Sultanamhet area, near the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Cisterns and more! Istanbul is virtually at your doorstep for exploration. The four of us walked everywhere! To the wonderful staff: Ferhat, Spencer, Arthur, Tina, Breakfast and Afternoon Tea Staff, other front desk staff, BRAVO to all of you!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: brauksim
Reviews.Content: Recently my husband and I with another couple stayed in this hotel for a total of 4 nights. It is centrally located in the Old City close to the Blue Mosque, the Cisterns and other sights - we even walked to the Grand Bazzar (there is also a smaller bazzar just up the road ) and has a metered taxi rank just outside the door. The rooms were spotlessly clean, quiet ,with double window glazing and roomy. Our bed was large and comfortable and the ensuite was well appointed (loved the toiletries). The tarif included a beautiful and tasty breakfast buffet (the best we encountered inTurkey) and a delightful afternoon tea at 5.00pm every day. A free and fast computer was available in the dining room, otherwise free Wi-Fi throughout the hotel for those with their own laptops. As if this wasn't enough, the staff were just superb. We had problems with a local tour company regarding our booking and the General Manager with his staff were brilliant in helping us resolve the issue. Nothing was too much trouble for the excellent staff. The Amira stands out as a guest focussed hotel (there's even an ATM in the indoor winter garden) where the adage of being "a home away from home " is absolutely true. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, superb staff.”
Reviews.Author: timjulielondon
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for three days in October. From arranging to collect us from the airport to contacting the airline to retrieve some lost luggage nothing was too much trouble for the superb staff. The breakfast buffet was very good, regularly refreshed and all in a very nice setting. The hotel is ideally located for exploring the Old Town. We will stay here when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: ringlada
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in Amira Hotel and it was extremely enjoyable. I cannot add much more to what has already been said in previous reviews. Excellent location, very nice and clean rooms, delicious breakfast, excellent 5 o'clock tea, lovely rooftop terrace, free and fast Wi-Fi connection in all areas of the hotel and, above all, excellent service. Very warm welcome, everyone was very kind and friendly to us all the time, our many questions were always answered courteously and efficiently. Extremely recommended! Tip: take a look at their packages, they are very interesting in terms of price and what's included in them. If we ever go back to Istanbul, we will definitely go back to Amira Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very special boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: melaniejosh
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not only charming and well located but best of all the staff took such care of us from the moment we arrived. They seemed genuinely interested in our stay, suggested places of interest and were just wonderful. How important!! They picked us up at the airport, arranged for a Turkish bath (pick-up). We highly recommend this home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: Ursula M
Reviews.Content: Extremely close proximity to the Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Hippodrome, Topkapi Palace and the Grand Bazaar makes this the perfect choice for tourists in Istanbul. Their courteous and professional staff is just icing on the cake. I recommend this hotel wholeheartedly. My only regret was that my stay was too short. Can't wait to return to Hotel Amira!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: mourspe
Reviews.Content: What can be said that had not already been written? The hotel was absolutely phantastic, the service impeccable. I had stayed in Istanbul several times before, but this was by far the most pleasant stay. Just to give you a feel of the level of service: Our sons wanted to buy a simit (sesame bread) when leaving the hotel, but then the porter stepped in and offered them two simits. We were also not charged for extras we had asked for. I would especially recommend the place for families with school children. The family room consists of two seperate room (one of the more luxurious) that are separated by a door. To our relief the door cannot be locked unilaterally even by adventurous kids. A small drawback is that -although the hotel is in a relatively quiet neighbourhood - it is too loud to sleep with open windows in most rooms. But then it is Istanbul and the windows do a fabulous job in keeping the noise away. I forgot the roof terrace: What a luxury to have a glass of wine up there when the kids sleep downstairs in a safe surrounding.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here.”
Reviews.Author: billfr
Reviews.Content: Excellent hospitality and location with easy access to major historical sites.

Reviews.Title: “Among the best”
Reviews.Author: mjmalbion
Reviews.Content: Hotel Amira stands out for its service--from a reasonably charged airport pick-up to caring and professional attentiveness in its bar/restaurant. In between, every employee was friendly, helpful, and professional. Amira has a tradition of welcoming guests with drinks of your choice while an employee goes over maps of the city and its attractions and how to get there from the hotel, all suited to your interests. They prefer to do this on their outdoor terrace on the top of the hotel, but weather will govern the location. It's a nice touch that can be reassuring. Seldom will you have to open the hotel's front door yourself, regardless of time of day or night. Hotel Amira has comfortable and very clean rooms and bathrooms. Standard rooms can be a little tight, so it's worth asking them to upgrade to Deluxe. Bedding and chairs are comfortable and room dÃ©cor nicely chosen. The hotel is conveniently located to all of the major Old Town attractions, all short walks but uphill, which for some might add to the time, but one can get to the Blue Mosque, for instance in about 7 mins. at a reasonable pace. The neighborhood is a mixture of hotels and local domestic living, so it's worthwhile to wander the surrounding streets to appreciate more local culture. For instance, one block away is a very nice green market, with attractive vegetables, etc. bought mostly by local residents. Restaurants close-by seem to run from good to excellent, although in many dÃ©cor is Spartan or certainly unpretentious. For instance, three blocks uphill toward the Blue Mosque is a non-descript little mosque in a road fork. On the left, just before the fork and up a few stairs is an excellent restaurant whose name escapes. Local dishes of various meats and seafood are delicious and the rear seating dÃ©cor suggests antiquity and is in the same area as their large baking oven, which produces among other dishes super nan breads. At the top end of the vegetable market is another restaurant, which looks like many cafeterias in the USA, but which produces a large and delicious variety of local dishes. Prices at both restaurants are very reasonable; of course, since neither serves alcohol, the overall cost for tourists is even more within budget, so to speak. One block down from the hotel is a not-to-be-missed smaller mosque, colloquially called the Little Aya Sophia, if memory serves because it was designed by the same favored architect. It is a beautiful harmony of textures and colors, and uncrowded. Hotel Amira is centrally situated especially for Old Town, but it has easy access to the low-priced tram that takes you to Istiklal night-life and to Taksim Square shopping.

Reviews.Title: “The truth is written here”
Reviews.Author: Tstravels1
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel before and after our cruise of Turkey and Greece. We booked because it rated so high on Trip advisor. It was everything and more. This was the first hotel that actually took the time to have an orientation with us and explain the area and hotel...thank you Arthur. It was always nice to come back and see the smiling faces from the bellman to the bar tender the service was fantastic! We just got back and I already miss this home away from home. Rocky thanks for looking after us from breakfast to drinks and a lunch to go for our early flight.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you stay here”
Reviews.Author: u725767
Reviews.Content: You can't fault this hotel for its location, rooms and breakfast (and afternoon tea!) but what makes it special is the staff. Very friendly, efficient and professional. Their suggestions for restaurants and travel around Istanbul were always excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: nafaway
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 6 day stay at Hotel Amira and had a great time...location, service, and room were excellent. We enjoyed a welcome orientation with Arthur with suggestions of what to see tailored to our interests. Also restaurant Khorasani he recommended was great. We found the location to be excellent and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Uncommonfruit
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful 3 night stay at the Hotel Amira. Everyone there, from the doorman, reception, bartender and housekeeping was warm, professional and always willing to offer advice on how to get the most out of our stay. The hotel upgraded all three rooms we reserved from standard to deluxe, a very nice unexpected gesture. The decor is an eclectic mix of modern and more traditional pieces that worked well and made for a very comfortable space. The rooms were quite large by hotel standards and the bath had nice amenities including a towel warmer and spa tub. Breakfast had a large selection of sweet and savory, hot and cold dishes and the afternoon tea was a nice way to meet your fellow hotel guests. The location is great with most of the major sites in the Sultanahmet area within an easy walk and public transportation was very close by. The neighborhood was busy during the day but calm and quiet at night. Don't miss the beautiful roof terrace with views of the Bosphorus and the minarets of the Blue Mosque.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Nabil W
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located in the center of the old city. It is near almost everything. the staff are very helpful , specially Mr. Engin, Eagle and Arthur, they always recommend you where to go and where to eat. their recommendation was always very satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “Amira Hotel: A Turkish Delight”
Reviews.Author: Nenas121
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel due to it's high rating on Trip Advisor. Overall, we weren't disappointed, however there are a few flaws. It's an old building (or a couple of buildings connected together) and you can hear water from toilets being flushed by other guests. Room decor is dated and seating sparse. I didn't find the rooms particularly comfortable to relax in, only to sleep. A/C worked well and the beds, sheets and towels were fresh. The breakfast buffet is limited and could be improved. Why I'd stay here again is the location. It is within close walking distance of all that any visitor to Istanbul would want to see. At the top of the street is the Blue Mosque and a charming arcade of shops and restaurants. Also, the hotel staff was genuinely warm and helpful, from the bellman to the house maid. Upon check-in, Arthur from the front desk gave us a personal orientation of the City and ideas for good meals. All restaurant recommends were nearby and very good. I was unhappy with our room allocation on check-in and was offered another option to make it right. There's also a nice rooftop terrace where you can get good views and pictures of the Bosphorus. If you are a first time visitor to Istanbul, or want to visit the tourist sites, you won't go wrong choosing this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel and unbelievable staff!”
Reviews.Author: midlandsgnome
Reviews.Content: I booked Hotel Amira for a special family trip after seeing its high rating on Trip Advisor and was not disappointed. This is probably the best hotel I have ever stayed in. The staff cannot do enough to help and this was demonstrated before we had even stepped through the front door. I had pre-paid for an airport transfer but when we arrived at Amira the bus driver started shouting at me and demanding money. The doormen were immediately on hand to resolve the situation and told us to go inside whilst they dealt with it. Our room wasn't huge but had some lovely touches including a spa bath, slippers and dressing gown. It was virtually on ground floor level but looked out onto a side street and there was no noise whatsoever. The beds were very comfortable. The hotel is in Sultanahmet, only five minutes from the Blue Mosque - a brilliant location and much more peaceful than I had imagined. It is only a ten minute walk to the nearest tram stop should you wish to take the tram anywhere though most attractions, including the Grand Bazaar are in walking distance. The breakfast was wonderful and included a great selection of breads, pastries and jams. The complimentary afternoon tea is excellent (and the carrot cake is way better than at Pera Palace!). The welcome drink and talk with the manager is a great introduction to Istanbul. You can even buy tram tokens at reception to save you buying them from the machines. Every member of staff we came across spoke excellent English, had a smile on their face and was genuinelly interested in the customer. I have nothing but positive comments for this hotel and its wonderful staff and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: mister174
Reviews.Content: For our first experience in Instanbul, Hotel Amira made everything very easy, comfortable and enjoyable. Excellent service, from top to bottom. Rooms were welcoming and spacious. Breakfast was excellent (and free.) The recommendations for restaurants, private tour guides and must-doâ€™s in the city never led us astray. It will always be my first option when returning.

Reviews.Title: “Worth its high rating.”
Reviews.Author: Ryegate
Reviews.Content: This is not the Four Seasons. This is, however, a small, clean, reasonably priced hotel with staff that rival those of any five star hotel - including the Four Seasons. When we arrived, the check-in staff noted that we had no luggage. When I told them it had not made a connection, they asked for the luggage claim we had filled out for the airline. I was not sure why until I heard one of them on the phone checking with the airline and confirming the name and address of the hotel. The room was large (the bathroom small) with a king size bed complete with a comfortable, firm mattress. The roof top bar offers a great view of the Istanbul skyline (including the Blue Mosque) and is served by perhaps the best bar tender I have encountered in 40+ years of international travel. Nope - this isn't the Four Seasons...and I'm glad.

Reviews.Title: “I wish all hotels were as good as this one”
Reviews.Author: PrestburySK
Reviews.Content: We spent four days in the Hotel Amira and the service was exceptionally good with very helpfull and considerate staff. We received very good advice on places to visit and restuarants. The hotel is well positioned for the major sites such as the Blue Mosque and from the roof terrace had a good view of the Bosphorus. We also enjoyed the complimentory tea and cake each day at 5.00 p.m. The room was very comfortable and met all our requirements. We cannot praise this hotel highly enough and would recomend it to anybody planning to visit Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “A great stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: david s
Reviews.Content: We were two couples traveling together, staying over in Istanbul after a tour. We were greeted by one of the owners who spoke perfect English. At his invitation, we began our stay over glasses of wine while he told us of things to see and do that we had missed during our stay in Istanbul (at another hotel) at the beginning of our tour. At our request, he also recommended two restaurants which were excellent. Our rooms were lovely and quiet. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel very good located!”
Reviews.Author: evetrap
Reviews.Content: The Amira hotel is very good located near the mayor sights of Istanbul. What really makes the difference is the staff. We would like to mention Arthur who was always there when we needed him, always ready to help, and give us good advise for where to have dinner. The breakfast was very good. We had a beautiful room,(it is worth booking a deluxe room) What was very handy is that you can buy tram tokens from reception (cost price) and they will charge them to your bill. Internet is free of charge and the connection very good. The only down there is no space in the bathroom for your makeup bag Amira Hotel is a small hotel but with great services!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Aranka B
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at Hotel Amira in October, 2011. The staff were extremely friendly, informative and helpful. Our room was large, modern and clean, although you should be aware that the walls were paper thin. Not a serious complaint...just surprised to be able to hear EVERYTHING from the neighbors next to us. Our flight home left very early, long before breakfast was being served, but the staff delivered a beautiful tray of assorted breakfast treats, along with coffee and tea to our room so we could eat before heading out. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended, fantastic staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: dom&jess
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Amira Hotel for 5 nights in October 2011. We arrived the first day at 9.00am and realised that it was very early to check in however the front desk staff offered us breakfast while we waited for the room to be made ready. While we were having breakfast one of the front desk staff members came and sat with us to explain the major sites and gave us a map and pointed out all the areas of interest. One morning we had to leave for an excursion to Gallipoli at 6.30am and the kitchen staff were very obliging and prepared us a breakfast plate for 6.00am. The breakfast is plentiful however we do agree with other members that fruit juice would have been preferable to the cordial that was served. We ate dinner twice in the hotel restaurant and although there is only a small choice of meals what we had was very nice and reasonably priced. We would like to comment on Aziz the barman, he is so friendly and helpful, a real asset to the hotel. Our room was on the lobby floor - Room 201. Unfortunately this backs on to the front reception and was very noisy. We changed rooms after 3 nights and the staff were once again very helpful and obliging us. We would recommend opting for a room on the higher floors due to traffic noise. We would definitely stay here again, it was so convenient to walk to Sultanahmet area and the tram was very close, a 10 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Without a doubt THE BEST HOTEL IN ISTANBUL!!”
Reviews.Author: Silverstone57
Reviews.Content: We had booked our 2 de luxe rooms on the Internet and when our friends were unable to come due to illness, their rebate was quickly refunded and without question. The staff were brilliant - nothing was too much trouble and they were always so cheerful and helpful. Our accommodation was spacious, very clean and comfortable and when we asked to be moved to a room so to have a walk in shower, the changeover was speedily accomplished. The bath robes, slippers and toiletries were much appreciated as they cut down on the luggage needed. The hotel is conveniently situated close to many of the main attractions. if you have trouble walking, be aware that Istanbul is built on a series of hills and has many cobbled streets so comfortable shoes may be helpful, wherever you stay! The buffet breakfast at Hotel Amira offers a wide choice of food, both hot and cold, attractively laid out and constantly replenished. We particularly enjoyed the yoghurt, the fresh fruit salad and lovely water melon. There was a good selection of nuts, dried fruits, cheeses, cold meats, fresh breads and cakes. Afternoon tea and cake was very welcome following a session of sight seeing. We are a couple in our mid 70's and had a wonderful trip - we cannot recommend Hotel Amira and Istanbul too highly. .

Reviews.Title: “If your visiting Istanbul, this is a great place to stay and great location”
Reviews.Author: lenny09
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location easy walk to all of the sights including the Grand Bazaar. The staff made you very welcome to their city and very helpful if you needed anything from directions or places to see or eat. One thing to look into is the further ahead you can book the better the rates are. I would have no problem going back to Hotel Amira in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely #1”
Reviews.Author: RuthCampbellvilleON
Reviews.Content: I booked our vacation in Istanbul so we could stay at the Amira, because it was ranked #1 on Tripadvisor. I'm glad I did! The room was large and comfortable, the breakfast selection was extensive, and the service was fantastic. The roof-top patio made our trip! We stayed 7 nights at the Amira, but had to stay our last night at another hotel, because the Amira was full. That really highlighted to us why Amira is #1. We stayed at the White House (ranked #4) for the last night. The service was good at the White House, and the room was very nice, but here are the differences: 1) The Amira provided bottled water (for making tea/coffee in the room, drinking, brushing your teeth) every day (no one else we spoke with on our trip had this amenity, and when you arrive after an overseas flight, tired and wanting to freshen up, the last thing you want to do is go hunting for bottled water to brush your teeth!) 2) The breakfast buffet was extensive, and everything labelled. I appreciated the labels, or I may never have tried "rose jam"! 3) Orientation - the Amira provides you with maps and makes sure you know of the best sights and restaurants in the area 4) roof-top patio. We visited the rooftop patio every afternoon, from about 4:30 - 6:00 pm to relax after our long day of walking, and enjoy a beer, and/or tea (there is a complementary tea at 5 pm) before going for dinner. The chairs/couches are comfortable, the view spectacular, and the service top-notch. You can walk anywhere you'd want to go from the Amira, and if you want to go far afield, you can get a tram token at the front desk and catch the tram. The tram is modern, clean and efficient. We thoroughly enjoyed our week in Istanbul. Just one warning for light sleepers. The Amira is on one of the main roads that the tour buses take to get to the Blue Mosque. I was glad I had earplugs (my husband didn't hear anything!); with this the only thing that wasn't perfect, I would still stay here again, and recommend it to anyone! I have already recommended it to friends planning to come to Instanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: Karen C
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights in early October. As many have commented, the hotel is a great location in the old city and is an easy walk to the Blue Mosque. We stayed in a deluxe room on level 4. The room was beautifully decorated, the bed was very comfortable, and we had a great view. A big plus for me was that there was an Ipod dock in the room. The rooftop bar has great views and wsas a welcome retreat. However, the highlight was the fantastic service we had. In particular from Ferhad who gave us a run down of places to go and some great restaurants to eat at. Two of his recommendations were particularly good: Karakol (Ottoman cuisine) and Kiva Han (Anatolian cuisine at Galata). We travelled with another couple who had a 'significant birthday' while staying there. Ferhad arranged a lovely surprise on the day.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful - all the great reviews were true!”
Reviews.Author: Indigo1613
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked 8 nights in a deluxe room, directly through the hotel's web site. I was really impressed by how quickly and efficiently the team responded to my emails. We also arranged collection from the airport via the hotel, as we were due to arrive very late in the evening. We knew this would not be the cheapest way of doing it, but we wanted peace of mind and a driver who definitely knew where he was going! We were pleased to find him waiting for us holding a card as we came into the arrivals lounge and enjoyed a swift transfer back to the hotel. Our room was lovely, at the side of the hotel (overlooking another hotel). There was very little noise from traffic etc. I think the room number was 701 - there were no rooms on either side. It could be accessed via a lift but then (due to the disjointed nature of the buiding) we had to walk down a small spiral staircase and then up a few more stairs. This was no problem to us, but if you have any disabilities you should discuss the access to your room before booking. I am sure there are other rooms that are more easily accessed. The room was spacious, light and airy; and decorated in a very modern 'boutique' style - you can see the pics already provided by other travellers. The AC was appreciated in the heat, and the fridge/minibar also useful. There was a patio door at the side onto a small private roof terrace, which was very pleasant. The bathroom was small but functional, with a jacuzzi bath (which we didn't try) plus a shower. The staff were always smiling, helpful and polite, and the front desk staff speak excellent English. Note: you can buy tram tokens from reception (at cost price) and they will charge them to your bill if you wish...which is handy if you don't have change for the machines and want to avoid queuing. The breakfast buffet was more than adequate with lots of variety, and they seemed happy to accommodate special requests for other items made by other guests. My only complaint would be the lack of fresh fruit juices - which I had read in reviews before we travelled. They serve something that tastes like cordial, which is really not in line with the quality of the rest of the buffet. Free internet access 24/7 (throughout the hotel) was a real bonus. The roof top terrace is a wonderful place to relax with a glass of wine after a long day of sighseeing. The furniture is both stylish and comfortable and the views are stunning. This hotel does have a nice 'boutique' feel to it. It provides a more personal service and is intimate without being claustrophic. It has the advantage of (probably not) accommodating large groups - who can sometimes be a nuisance! It is well situated for walking to all the sights around the City, but do note that Istanbul is built on many hills and the cobbled streets and pavements can be quite arduous in the heat. This is a place for sensible shoes and people who are reasonably active - don't bring your high heels ladies, they will be ruined and you won't want to wear them anyway :) P.S. Outside the hotel is a taxi office, where you can book a minibus transfer back to the airport for a fraction of the price charged by the hotel, so just book one way with them for your arrival and then book your own taxi back.

Reviews.Title: “If you're going to Istanbul, this is the place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: DuckeyLondon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the old town and is 10 mins from the Blue Mosque, Cistern and tram station. It is a perfect base to sightsee from. The staff are friendly and the service is second to none. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: BeehiveBlue
Reviews.Content: Stayed here to be near the finish of the Istanbul Marathon and based my choice on other reviews. Staff were very friendly and helpful, having lived in Istanbul for a while I didn't need a great deal of information but overheard another couple being given some very good advice on how to get the most out of their stay. The room was very nice and clean but some mould around the bath let the bathroom down a bit. Also we had some problems getting the air conditioning to work, we didn't need to report it but it was a little temperamental. The room itself was very quiet and peaceful although for some reason anything that happened in the next door bathroom could be heard clearly in our bathroom!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, 5 stars service, good location”
Reviews.Author: Simon R
Reviews.Content: The hotel amira is a really luxury hotel, beautifully decorated. I stayed during 4 nights and i can tell you i was amazed by the top quality of the service!. The staff is 110% efficient. The hotel is nearby the most important places to visit. If you visit Istanbul just book amira hotel, you will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Get the most of your Istanbul visit”
Reviews.Author: JMFChicago
Reviews.Content: We liked Amira because the staff are so helpful, and will make sure you get the most of your stay. Just ask! The hotel has a beautiful rooftop garden bar, great breakfast, and very walkable distance to the sights of Istanbul. There are taxis at the door when you need them. Also small convenience stores nearby, and minibars in the room. Because you are fairly close to the Blue Mosque, you will probably hear the first call to prayer in the morning (sunrise). By the second morning, we were sleeping through it.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury, service, location, and amazing breakfast!!”
Reviews.Author: Daniak04
Reviews.Content: Hotel Amira was the most elegant hotel that we saw in Istanbul! We were so lucky to have been able to stay there, I saw the reviews on tripadvisor but the hotel was already sold out so I sent a frantic email to the hotel asking if they could spare a room for us and they did! I was sooo happy and for good reason! The decor in the room was absolutely beautiful! The breakfast was the best during our entire staying Turkey. My husband and I would be the first ones there at 7:30 am sharp. They had everything from deli meats, cheeses, all kinds of breads, eggs, jams, fruits, and fresh yogurt :) the service was great, everyone had a smile on their face. Ferhat was especially nice because he helped arrange all our transfers and also booked the room us. Absolutley amazing hotel, would recommend it to anyone. I want to go back there already! They even upgraded us to a better room upon our second arrival (we stayed on two occasions during our trip) and the upgraded room was perfect :) we love hotel Amira!!

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL STAY”
Reviews.Author: JOHN M
Reviews.Content: We stayed her 2 night prior to a Silversea cruise. Very nice room, well appointed, good size and very clean and updated. Staff, from the front desk, to the bar, to the room attendants couldn't have been more helpful or pleasant. We we offered a complimentary welcome drink while we checked in and we were asked of our plans so staff could orient us and offer suggestions on things to do to supplement our existing plans. We had tours planned but it was nice to receive this introductory info on arrival. Breakfast (included) was of very good quality. If you prefer a smaller "boutique" hotel this is highly recommended without reservation. Plus, location is great for efficiently seeing the sites of the old city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: Ivor B
Reviews.Content: Definitely the best hotel I've ever stayed at: friendly, hospitable, helpful, excellent location, lovely simple food) great room service. The staff are brilliant - not aloof at all and happy to speak English or just smiles!

Reviews.Title: “It really IS that great an experience”
Reviews.Author: Saazi
Reviews.Content: Cannot write enough superlatives here. Great location, gracious staff. Have them arrange for taxi service for you if your Turkish isn't up to it, and to avoid being taken for a figurative ride. But you won't need taxis that much: you can walk from here to Haggia Sofia, the Blue Mosque, the Grand Bazaar, etc. They have set the new standard for Istanbul accommodations and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay - great location and service”
Reviews.Author: MalachiWilliams
Reviews.Content: We recently visited Istanbul and based on the reviews we had read, we booked to stay at this hotel and we were not disappointed. Our room was 602. Prior to arrival I had contacted the hotel for advice on places to visit, things to do and places to eat. An employee called Ferhat kept in good and regular communication and gave some useful advice. The hotel is situated in Sultanahmet and is easy to get to from local transport. It is also in the old part of the City and the site of the Blue Mosque, so a great place to stay. We received a warm welcome on arrival and taken to the wonderful roof terrace area for a welcome drink and some advice on the local area. The server who sets up tea and serves the drinks is very pleasant and accommodating - great service! The hotel offers free WIFI and complimentary tea at 5.00 pm every day. They also have a computer for free use and an ATM in the hotel. Breakfast is plentiful, fresh and offers a good variety. It is also served until 11.30 am daily. Your room also has a complimentary bottle of water daily, a very comfortable bed and on a wet day, the hotel gives you an umbrella. We ate at Khoransani (which we highly recommend), Sofyali 9 (good) and The Han (OK). To give balance to the review, you should note that you will hear the call to prayer at this location, so unless you are a heavy sleeper, expect to be woken, but that is all part of the experience. Whilst the hotel has a high standard of cleanliness, the bath in room 602 was not great. The finish was below standard and the the bath edge was not well maintained. There is a Bosphorus river trip for 10TL which is worth taking and do not bother with taxi's as public transport is good. Simit Sarayi is all over Istanbul and a good place for a quick snack. Finally, James Bond fans will want to visit Yerebatan Cistern (10TL).......

Reviews.Title: “Amira hotel : excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: sissi n
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Amira 4 nights on October 2011 to celebrate our 30 th wedding anniversary and we want to share our experience. Location : excellent , just 10min from Blue Mosquee and Ste Sophie. Quiet at night time , good sleeping . There is a taxi stand just in front of the hotel , very convenient . Room : we have a deluxe room which is very large and comfortable . We request a room with view , and we got it , wonderful view on the sea . Thank You to Mr Ferhat Sahin! Service : very nice , polite , helpful , from pick up at airport to check out . Breakfast : good choice , fresh salad fruit , fresh turkish yogurt .( Only bemol : you have to pay if you want a Cappucino ). Internet : very good connection , and free of charge. Conclusion : it's a small hotel but with great services! We hope we will return in Istanbul soon , it's a amazing city !! And for sure , we will come back at Amira hotel again !

Reviews.Title: “Trip Advisor Reviews Are Not Wrong”
Reviews.Author: bs081288
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Amira prior to a Greek Islands cruise. I can tell you that I was skeptical about visiting Istanbul but glad we did. I am also glad that we chose Hotel Amira for our 2 night stay. The hotel location is excellent being in close proximity to main attractions in Sultanamet. The staff was extremely knowledgeable & helpful - directions, reservations/recommendation for dinner, transportation assistance, you name it. While is was rainy the night we checked in, you have to see the views from the terrace, they are fabulous. Buffet breakfast was substantial (typical of European standards - unless you are a super picky eater you will not have a problem with getting a good start on your morning) We would definitely stay there again and recommend it to others (as I already have)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Boutique Hotel & Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Diane44444
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled to Istanbul Turkey from Toronto for the first time on August 29., 2011 We were to acutally arrive on the 30th, however due to a hurricane in North America elected to travel a day early. We contacted the Hotel Amira and they happliy accomodated our early arrival, in addition, they arranged for transport from the airport to the hotel. We began each day with a generous continental breakfast which was always well topped up and porvided a great selection. Due to the location in Sultanhammet, we were able to walk to all of the attractions we wished to tour to. The Blue Mosque was in fact just up the road and Topkapi Palace was a very easy walk. We were most amazed to learn that the ancient wall visible from the rooftop lounge was in fact the far end of the Hippodrome. The rooftop lounge area was absolutely beautiful with a fabulous view of the city and immediate service if you required a drink or snack. The staaff were more than accomodating with a wram welcome each time we returned and a quick response to any request. We stayed at the Armira for 8 nights and thoroughly enjoyed the hospitality and wonderful setting. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone selecting Istanbul as a travel destination. We highly recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Amira stands out”
Reviews.Author: Deborah P
Reviews.Content: Our group of 6 were met at the airport, assured of each step along the way to the hotel. When we arrived at Hotel Amira, Arthur treated us as VIPS, took us to the roof at sunset--beautifully distracting!--for complimentary drinks and to meticulously explain in flawless English our tour options, directions, answer any questions we had. The boutique hotel was small, service was excellent, location was very convenient. Rooms were well appointed; bathrooms perhaps a tad small, but well within every European standard. Breakfasts were amazingly varietal. I would love to return to the same hotel again. Our experience in Istanbul was made all the more special because of the excellent service from every staff member.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to Stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: greeneg
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights post cruise at the Hotel Amira in Istanbul in September, 2011. I wish we could have spent two more. Our room was quiet, very clean, very comfortable with totally modern bathroom facilities. Breakfast was just wonderful with an extensive selection of breads, eggs, cold meats, yogurts, jams, and HONEY!!. I think that Turkish Honey must be the best in the World, just delicious. Hotel Service was outstanding, I find it hard to see how we could have been more welcomed. The Hotel is conveniently located in the Sultanahmet area and is a short walk from the Blue Mosque, Haigi Sophia, and the Topkapi Palace. The Hotel has a roof top restaurant for light suppers on warm evenings; the view is just astounding on a clear night. Two problems: 1) I would suggest that a grab bar be placed in the bath tub, it would make it easier to get in and out of the tub. 2) Our room was at the top of some very steep and curving stairs. I would not have been able to get our luggage up them, but the Hotel Staff took care of that with a smile, even at 4:30 AM which was when we had to leave to go to the airport to come home. Over all, an Outstanding Hotel which I will stay again when we return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Formidable!”
Reviews.Author: Janice C
Reviews.Content: I have lived and travelled in Europe, Africa, Middle East and Asia and this is the most welcoming "boutique" hotel I've ever stayed in. The staff (with a special nod to Arthur : - ) are most warm and friendly without being invasive. Their suggestions for restaurants and sights were always spot on. The location is perfect as a central point for exploring the old city on foot. Definitely made my stay in Istanbul special and left me keen to return. J from Cork, Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Experience at the Hotel Amira”
Reviews.Author: AnneandEric
Reviews.Content: Three couples from Vancouver stayed at the Hotel Amira after a 12 day cruise, and we were unanimous in our praise of this delightful small hotel. Our arrival was very early in the morning, well before check-in time, but we were warmly greeted, offered a full breakfast (gratis), given an orientation tour of the facilities including the roof top deck with its incredible views, and generally made to feel exceptionally welcome. The location could not be better and we walked to the many historic sights in the area. There is a very good bazaar two blocks away, not nearly so crowded with a very good selection of jewellery, leather goods and antiques. I could not think of a better place to stay in Istanbul than the Hotel Amira and give it full marks on all levels.
