Reviews.Title: “Overall excellent with a very high standard of service”
Reviews.Author: Hairshirt
Reviews.Content: Friendly attentive (but not intrusive)staff. Well decorated and clean. Comfortable spacious room. Good location for the sites in the old city and easy tram access to the modern city side and beyond. Big shower in a spacious well-provided bathroom. Good breakfast. Pleasant roof terrace (where we managed to get served very easily). Quiet location at night. We were on the street side one floor up and scarcely aware of traffic noise. Two quibbles - for a deluxe room the bed, in my opinion, was a bit narrow and for a 5 night stay, the wardrobe hanging space was a bit limited.

Reviews.Title: “Five star service at reasonable rates!”
Reviews.Author: tmgjmg
Reviews.Content: After cruising for 10 days, we recently ended our trip at the Hotel Amira and were delighted with every aspect of the hotel. We arrive early in the morning and were offered a complimentary breakfast before setting out on our first day's adventures. The hotel was spotless and very centrally located to all of the historic sights. Rooms were large by European standards. Hotel Amira offers modern amenities, yet captures traditional Turkish design. The staff was simply outstanding. They were warm and welcoming which is an important criteria when we travel internationally. All staff was truly interested in making our stay there special. We did take advantage of their roof top terrace which offered spectacular views of the Bosphorus as well as good food. We would highly recommend the Hotel Amira to anyone looking for a centrally located and reasonably priced accommodation that offers outstanding service.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: RBK00007
Reviews.Content: great hotel, great location, great staff. HIghly recommend. RK

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: Dee Z
Reviews.Content: At the end of our 12 day European cruise we spent three nights at the beautiful Hotel Amira. The hotel had been highly rated on Tripadvisor and we were not disappointed. The accommodations were just as described and the staff was even better. The way they made you feel at home and like a close friend was just lovely. The terrace was perfect and the attention we received upon arrival and throughout our stay was beyond what I have found at five star hotels. We found easy access to the all of the attractions in Old Town and plenty of restaurants were close by. You never want for a taxi because they park right our front. The morning buffet was delicious and there was something for everyone. In the afternoon they had snacks and tea which was very strong and delicious. Hotel Amira was the icing on our wonderful trip to Europe. I assure you that you'll have a exceptional stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IanandShen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights and had a fantastic time. The rooms were spotless and had everything needed for a very comfortable stay and the location central to everything we wanted to see. We cant praise the staff enough, they were always smiling, friendly and very helpful. It is clear once you walk through the hotel door why Hotel Amira is number one on trip advisor and if we revisit Istanbul again we would not stay anywhere else. Thank you Hotel Amira, for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was nice, but for me the best was the Staff”
Reviews.Author: Ramon B
Reviews.Content: All what you can expect from a Hotel was really nice for me. I'm not to get into details about that, the other reviews are quite clear in that aspect. What for me was the most important point was how the Staff people behaved with as (always friendly and helpful). We had a severe problem with our reservation and the Hotel Staff just though on how to help us, that made us to think just on the Hotel Amira when we really could go to Istambul.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Carlos23
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Amira and its staff's friendliness. The hotel is within walking distances to Istanbul's main attractions. Opprotunity areas are: a hotel of this quality could offer freshly squeezed orange juice and expressos w/o extra charge at breakfast. There seem to be some problem with the exaust system at the patio on the roof as a wave of unpleasant smell goes around from time to time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Argas
Reviews.Content: Excellent small hotel featuring most friendly and helpful staff, spotless comfortable rooms, good internet and great breakfast featuring superb jams and fresh fruit.

Reviews.Title: “High expectations met and more”
Reviews.Author: Hamilton6
Reviews.Content: Being a #1 TA hotel sets some very high expectations for sure. Amira met them all handily. As others have said, the location is perfect. Our room (505) was comfortable and tastefully done. It was on a street corner slightly above grade, but the windows were very high quality and sound-inhibiting. The only problem was when a crowd of cabbies gathered outside one evening (a taxi stand is in front of the hotel) but it didnâ€™t last very long. If noise might be an issue for you, request a higher floor. But this IS a hotel in a city, and noise is to be expected. Every guest receives a personal orientation on arrival â€“ generally on the roof terrace in good weather. Gemil provided us a nice overview of the area and sights with a terrific and helpful map produced by the hotel. Although heâ€™s undoubtedly done it many, many times, it still seemed fresh and personal and not rushed. A great feature is the roof deck with the view of the water and a stunning sundown. We retreated to the roof in the afternoon for drinks and to relax. They have a light menu which was a welcome respite from the tourist restaurants in walking distance. As an aside, the other nice dining respite was Seasons at the Four Seasons. A visit to that hotel reinforced our appreciation for the intimacy of the Amira, but the food was excellent. Best part, clearly, was the staff. Without exception, they made us feel welcome and answered innumerable questions about sights, restaurants, etc., with patience and a genuine desire to be helpful. On the roof terrace, Aziz is an amiable and frenetic (in a good way) host, making sure everyone is well taken care of. This hotel clearly has its act together and understands the value of delivering a personal guest-oriented experience. Kudos and appreciation to them for a wonderful stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite memory of Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: Wise333
Reviews.Content: The hotel was better in person than all the reviews claim. We had welcome drinks upstairs on the lovely rooftop, the service on the roof top and hotel staff were the best! The rooms were upscale, clean, great beds, nice breakfast. We were sad to leave our rooftop patio and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location for seeing the tourist sights”
Reviews.Author: WendyJS98
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a suite room 801, after a very kind upgrade, which was wonderful! The room was very spacious and very clean. Breakfast was excellent I don't think there could have been much more choice given its a buffet style breakfast (although you can also order). The staff were very helpful and friendly and we would very much recommend this hotel to others. It was our first visit to Istanbul and we found this an excellent location, very accessible to the Blue Mosque and the other tourist attractions. The roof terrace has a wonderful view and very good service. A few recommendations:- for somewhere cheap to eat try Doy Doy (note they don't serve alcohol) the food is excellent, great value and the roof terrace has a view over the Blue Mosque. Also would recommend getting the tram around the city to make the most of your visit, you just buy a token from the machines for 2 lira for any length of ride. Also would recommend you do the Bosphorous trip on the IDO ferry it is 1.5 hrs each way - with a reliable timetable so you can stop and eat on the Asian side and come back - very well worth it - and cost only 25 Lira for a return trip. Get to the port earlyish to get a good seat.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you want in a boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: SuzyChapstick30
Reviews.Content: Perfect location within walking distance of major attractions. Rooms were absolutely charming. Best of all was the staff. We were greeted upon arrival and taken up to the rooftop terrace for a complimentary beverage and Arthur took the time to walk us through the map of attractions and other recommendations. Aziz and the rest of the staff were so attentive and kind. I highly recommend this hotel and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the Amira”
Reviews.Author: ballen122
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, about 1-2 blocks from Hippodrome, Blue Mosque. Another block to Tram, Aya Sofia etc. Plenty of shops, cafes in easy walking distance. There is an abundance of small hotels in the vacinity, Amira looked as if it was one of the newer ones. Staff was very helpful with usual hotel stuff like arranging tours, airport transfers, etc. and desk is open 24 hrs. Rooms were clean (except I agree with another review that bathtubs/showers could use a little attention). Terrace is nicely furnished and has view of Sea of Mamara and back of Hippodrome, but you will not see great view of major sights. Buffet breakfast was typical fruits, cheeses, olives, yogurt etc. Well done, overall. Omelets available on request for additional charge.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing people”
Reviews.Author: BLUFFTONZS
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable! Great location! Lovely tea. Good breakfast! We have really enjoyed being here and would like to stay here again. The staff is amazing. With our window or door to outside closed we didn't have any noise from the street

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mehulsonia
Reviews.Content: We just arrived in Istanbul today, but I'm already amazed at the city and this great hotel. It is in a fantastic location, very clean, modern and -- the best part -- is definitely the service. They go way above and beyond. We are all very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, can't recommend highly enough”
Reviews.Author: Kay1015
Reviews.Content: Excellent location in Sultanahmet for easy access to all the major sites. Close to the Blue Mosque (be prepared for the 5am call!) The staff couldn't have been more friendly and helpful. Lovely atmosphere, rooms were clean and comfortable, breakfast more than adequate to set you up for a day's sightseeing. With all the choice available it's satisfying when you get it right and this one certainly didn't disappoint. A great little find.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: vumaas
Reviews.Content: The Amira really is a wonderful hotel and lives up to its rating on TA Great value and location but what sets it apart is the incredible ability the staff have in making this a dream stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel for business & leisure”
Reviews.Author: Marta T
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Amira Hotel for Business and had an amazing personalized treatment. The staff is very friendly, helpful they speak perfect English and they make you feel at home. Location couldn't be better, walking distance from the major touristic attractions and completely safe for women solo travellers. Breakfast is very good and they have a breathtaking roof top to chill out or enjoy the sunset. Rooms are very spacious and tastily decorated. I strongly recommend it and will surely go back there soon!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Business and Tourist Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rich_in_Mesa
Reviews.Content: We loved the Amira. It was great i every way - the design and decor, the view of the Bosporus, location was walking distance to the tourist attractions, and the breakfast was good. Arthur and his staff gave us excellent advice on restaurants, cabs, and finding things. The hotel seemed to us at first a business hotel, but we found it an excellent tourist hotel, too. In fact, it was better than the tourist hotel that our tour company had arranged for us in the old city. we came into Istanbul a few days early before our tour and needed place to stay. We would have preferred the Amira for the whole stay instead of the place we got stuck in! Try to get a room facing the Bosporous - it was quieter on that side.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Connecticut_Couple
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in some of the best hotels all over the world, and while the Hotel Amira is not 5 star luxury, the staff makes it as good as any hotel in Istanbul. The location in Sultanahmet is ideal...15 minutes walk to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, and the tram station that will take you to the spice bazaar or Taksim Square. Ferhat and the rest of the staff were fantastic...arranging airport transportation, restaurants, sights to see, and anything else we needed. We couldn't have enjoyed Istanbul as much without them.

Reviews.Title: “Superb customer service.”
Reviews.Author: Mick R
Reviews.Content: Excellent customer service, clean rooms, great staff, great roof top terrace. The hotel did make an error but went over and beyond to correct it, awesome hotel well worth its rating!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: blondie4908
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience at Hotel Amira. It was in a great spot, easy walking to all major attractions. The rooftop is beautiful. I great spot for a drink at sunset. Upon arrival we were taken up and an employee went over how to get around and major attractions. They were very helpful with restaurant recommendations over email before we arrived. The rooms are small but clean and unique. Breakfast in the morning is wonderful and so is the afternoon tea. I would highly recommend this hotel compared to staying at a major chain. It has character and is a wonderful place to stay while in Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: Travelnathalie
Reviews.Content: This hotel arrange you a pick up at the airport. Very handy, you just have to look for you name and 30 minutes later you are at your hotel. When we arrived the staff was very very friendly. The invited us to the rooftop and we got a refreshing lemonade. And Arthur brought a map and he explained everything we had to know, his English was fluent and he was so helpful, also the other staff. About the rooftop, what a great view! Very relaxing in the evening with some lounge music! The rooms were very nice, modern, bathroom rather small, but everything you need. Breakfast was also complimentary. The location of the hotel was fantastic to visit the old City!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic in every way”
Reviews.Author: surreal67
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of reviewing before choosing Hotel Amira for our three day stay in Istanbul before our cruise in mid-September. The hotel lives up to the hype reviewers give it. We were picked up at the airport by a firm the hotel sent. A member of the staff greeted us immediately upon arrival and took us to the the roof terrace where we were given whatever beverage we wanted. We explained we hadn't slept in the past 24 hours and the man immediately walked us to our room which turned out to be a suite they had upgraded us to. The room was spacious with every thing we needed and even though it was at street level, very quiet. There was never a time we were bothered by noise. The location was perfect with the major sites we wanted to visit easily within walking distance. Istanbul was hot! At least hot compared with what we were accustomed to and it was easy to return to the hotel to cool off and rest. One night we went up to the roof top terrace to relax and watched a beautiful sunset while chatting with a couple from the UK. He had his Canon SLR and I had mine and we talked photography and took shots of the sunset. The hotel Amira is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel to explore Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: joe c
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just satyed for 3 nights to start our honeymoon. The hotel was in a great location and a very easy walk to some of the amazing places in the old city of Istanbul. Service was top notch, the continental breakfast was always a great start to the day. The rooms are good size and very modern. We will be staying there on our next trip to Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “A little gem with amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: Phantasialandfan
Reviews.Content: We were recommended to stay here and in turn I must recommend it to others. It seriously is a little gem in the heart of the old town of Istanbul, a stones throw from the Blue Mosque and pretty much everywhere of note is within walking distance. Walking is the only way to do anything anyway due to the seriously bad traffic queues! Several restaurants and bars nearby and a lovely rooftop terrace for early or late evening drinks with superb views of the city and Sea. All the staff were lovely, especially Arthur who greeted us and gave us all the information we could possibly need for our trip. He organised our Bosphorus boat trip/spice market tour and also our private taxi transfer back to the airport. The rooms are clean and spacious. The breakfast room is very pleasant and the spread is quite decent. The whole hotel is pretty and has some really quaint touches. It's worth having earplugs though. It is a city hotel and there is traffic all around - plus of course the calling to prayer in the early hours. I don't know the name of the waiter who serves up on the roof terrace, sorry, but he was absolutely lovely and extremely efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Attention to every detail . . . and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Dunford23
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Amira for three days. What a pleasant experience. From the moment we arrived to the checking out process, we were treated professinally and with a feeling that we were old friends. We were helped with sightseeing in the "old city", offered complimentary drinks on their rooftop restaurant overlooking the Bosphorus, enjoyed a wonderful free breakfast in their dining room . . . and all at a very reasonable and competitive price to other boutique hotels in the area. We would not stay anywhere else in the old city. Can't say enough good things about this hotel and their management.

Reviews.Title: “Warmest welcome ever”
Reviews.Author: YvonneB145
Reviews.Content: I think the entire staff of the hotel deserves a 5* plus rating! I have never experienced such a warm welcome at any hotel around the world. Excellent location in the old city. 5 minute pleasant walk to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia and the tramway. Another short walk to a broad selection of good restaurants. The rooms are rather small but very nicely decorated. Only minus perhaps was the bathroom. Very high and uncomfortable access to the bath/shower. Spots of mildew in the corners. Great rooftop terrace with views of the Blue Mosque and Bosphorus. Superb breakfast buffet. After our return to Belgium I contacted the hotel with a special request. I take this occasion to express my sincere thanks to Arthur, the Front Desk Manager, for his courteous help and kindness.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding customer service and extremely clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: a300zx4pak
Reviews.Content: I give this hotel 5 stars for their attention to detail and for their service to their guests. My wife and I arrived at 6AM the day we were suppose to check-in. I had emailed the hotel prior to arrival and told them we were arriving early in the morning and were hoping to check-in early if possible. They said if a room is available, they would let us. When we arrived, we were extremely tired from the flight and our previous travels. Our room wasn't available yet, but the hotel gave us a temporary room downstairs (Room 102) at 6AM so we could go to sleep, use the restroom, use the shower, and just relax!! This is what I call service and taking care of your guests! What hotel lets you do that!? The staff was always very friendly and helpful when we had questions about something. They provided us with tram tokens which made using the tram easier. I would suggest keeping some extra tokens just in case cause you never know when you will need them (they just add the cost to your room). The tram is about a 10 minute walk from the hotel (to Sultanahmet Park and the Blue Mosque area). The staff called many places for us trying to make dinner reservations even just a few hours before we wanted to go for dinner. They moved our bags around when we needed and ALWAYS smiled. I cannot say enough about how polite each and every person was to us. The breakfast in the morning downstairs was amazing. They had cereal, eggs, fruit, yogurt, pastries, juice, coffee, and much more. That was the best watermelon I've ever had! There is also a computer downstairs if you want to use it. But the internet in our room worked excellent so we used our own laptop. Speaking of our room (room 302), it was extremely clean and well kept. The attention to detail, the design, and layout was excellent. We had a standard size room and it was just fine for us. The only issue I had was that the bathroom was a tad small for me since I am 6'1. The shower didn't have a lot of room to move around. The temporary room we stayed in was probably a Deluxe room and had a bigger shower/bathroom. I originally wanted to get a Deluxe room, but they were all booked. It was a small issue, but not a huge problem for me. The finishings in the bathroom and bedroom were top notch (I loved the light shade with the Mosque on it!). We did spend some time on the rooftop where there is a nice view of the water. But we did not have a chance to use the Wellness Center (jacuzzi and fitness area). Overall, this was a spectacular boutique hotel which truly cares for their guests. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “first time in istanbul at a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: guita d
Reviews.Content: A very cute and cozy boutique hotel in the heart of Istanbul!! great location, superb staff!! the afternoon complimentary tea is great after a long day. The breakfast buffet is very good. The view from the roof in the afternoon is spectacular- I am glad we picked hotel Amira!

Reviews.Title: “I was treated like royalty”
Reviews.Author: 101travelled
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. We arrived and they took us up to the rooftop terrace for a drink and an orientation of the city. Both the Hammam and restaurant they recommended were excellent. They are extremely service oriented and kind. There is complimentary wi fi. The breakfast is a beautiful and delicious spread. I highly recommend this gem of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE BOUTIQUE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: epicroman
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay in istanbul. The hot,,l located in the earth of the old town, is the perfect location to visit the city and it features excellent services. The staff has been really kind and helpfull. The rooms are new and very spacious, provided with every confort available. I would suggest the Spa after a long day of walking around old town, it is definetly worth it. I would definetly suggest this hotel to everyone and i will certainly choose it again if i'd return to istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Only Place to Stay in Istanbul!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mia T
Reviews.Content: Hotel Amira is a fantastic hotel, that well and truly exceeded our expectations. The location of the hotel is fantastic, right in the heart of historic old Istanbul - Amazing!! We were in Turkey for around five weeks, and stayed at Hotel Amira on two different occassions. Our first stay we had a standard room which was perfect for the two of us! The room was very clean, and the staff were beyond helfpul, (in particular hotel manager Kartal), and was the main reason we returned for our second stay! The hospitality and the professionalism shown by the hotel staff was more than we could of hoped for. On our second stay we were given the a complimentary room upgrade, to a suite (I think) it was brillant, more room than the standard room, and I would recommmend booking the suite, if you are wanting a little extra room. The roof top area of the hotel is a great place to have dinner or grab a drink! My partner and I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Istanbul, if you want value for money, this is your place!! We will be back! Thanks Amira!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Kwolers
Reviews.Content: The Amira, really lived up to the Trip Advisor review. It was very reasonably priced and the staff were incredibly accomodating. Right in the middle of the Old City with views of the Blue Mosque from their superb roof terrace we could not have picked a better spot to stay in. We will most certainly be back.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem of a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GregoryRShaw
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Amira from July 28, 2011 to August 4, 2011 and loved every minute of it. It is a beautifully done boutique hotel at a very good price point. The staff was very attentive and helpful. We were greeted upon arrival with a welcome drink and the Front Office Manager, Arthur, sat down with us to orient us to Istanbul by pointing out our location and the locations of sights we wanted to visit. All four of his restaurant reccomendations were excellent. The location is very convenient and we would return in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful small hotel with outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: Carol_Isles
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in the Amira and enjoyed it tremendously. We stayed in the Amira Suite, which was spacious, well lit, comfortable, and clean. We spent a couple of hours each evening on the lovely rooftop terrace where we enjoyed wine and snacks. The breakfast buffet was excellent, and the free wifi was absolutely reliable. On the morning of our departure, the hotel arranged for a car to the airport, and because we would be leaving too early to have breakfast, they offered to have a variety of food and coffee brought to our room at 6 a.m., at no charge. The hotel is well located for sightseeing. There aren't a lot of posh restaurants nearby, but for a casual lunch or dinner we really liked the Hippodrome restaurant and bar, just a few steps up the street from the hotel. Unfortunately this restaurant doesn't appear on the map on the iPad tripadvisor app, but it did get good tripadvisor reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: grungeee
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our 5 year old son for 4 nights and was given a great welcome by the staff. We were brought up to the rooftop and given free drinks while he (sorry I forgot his name but will never forget his face) explained to us about the city, where to go, places to visit and recommended places to eat as well. We tried two of the places he recommended and absolutely loved it! Great view from the rooftop too. The hotel is a walking distance to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Arasta Bazaar and a few others. Breakfast was great and complimentary wifi was an added bonus. Only complain is that the bathroom lacks storage space but the room and everything else makes up for the small grouse. :) We were also given complimentary late check-out by their Sales & Marketing Supervisor, Mr Ferhat Sahin. Will recommend this to friends and families. :)

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: Sarah R
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently visited Istanbul and stayed at Hotel Amira. We were highly impressed with the hotel, room, the staff, and breakfast. Everything about the hotel was first class and the staff are very professional and helpful. My husband was very sick when we arrived and someone from the hotel ran to a nearby pharmacy to get medicine for him. We so appreciated all the little things that made this hotel stay uniquely pleasant and enjoyable. We went to almost every restaurant and hamam the hotel recommended and they were all spectacular. Stay here when you go to Istanbul - you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: volunteer1980
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel after our cruise. We were not able to check in until noon but the hotel reception staff was very helpful and provide us with maps & bus tokens to immediately start sightseeing. This hotel is only a few blocks from all the major sites. When we were able to check into the room we were happy with all the amenities plus the bathroom also sported a jacuzzi. Their breakfast buffet the next morning was extensive with juice, meat, cheese, cereal, eggs, bread & sweet rolls, etc. The hotel has a lovely roof top bar with a beautiful view. I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “The staff couldn't have been more helpful”
Reviews.Author: Hugh M
Reviews.Content: The hotel was lovely, great location, good sized rooms and a roof terrace with a great view. It was the staff that really made the difference though, they really helped us get the most out of our few days in Istanbul by suggesting tours, restaurants and other highlights of the city. Thoroughly recommend it and we'll be back.b

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: rroddy13
Reviews.Content: For value and convenience, cannot be beat. Great breakfast included. Nice rooftop terrace for evenings. Decent room size, moderate comfort and amenities relative to a luxury hotel. We generally stay in the upper level hotels everywhere and this compares well even with these. It's not the Four Seasons, but it is a third the cost. As boutique hotels go, this is top notch. The very best tip I can share is to hire a local guide by the name of Erkan ("Air-kahn"). Fantastic knowledge of the area and history, good English, and passionate about his town. He used to work for a tour company called Bitinya but can now be hired privately. Find him on TripAdvisor. Worth every penny to save time, avoid crowds and lines and to see the not-so-touristy, real Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: JLVSuffolk
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful welcome; taken to the rooftop terrace for a drink and we were given good information about the sights and the restaurants. We enjoyed the complimentary afternoon tea each day . Breakfasts were beautifully served with plenty of choice. Our room was spacious, clean and stylishly furnished. All the staff went out of their way to be helpful. This is a hotel we will recommend to friends and family

Reviews.Title: “Such a Great Place - In the Old City”
Reviews.Author: William_Genereux
Reviews.Content: We found this boutique hotel on Trip Advisor based on its reviews and it did not disappoint. The location in Istanbul is ideal for sightseeing and for getting to and from the airport - which is about 35 TL each way. There is a tiny taxi stand right outside so there is always a cab waiting, but most of the time you will want to walk, because the location is close to the Blue Mosque and all the sights of Sultanahmet district including the Hagia Sophia. For getting over to Beyoglu, the Bosphorus boat tours, and even simply to get over to the spice market for some shopping we often walked up from the hotel past the site of the Hippodrome and the Blue Mosque to the tramway, and for 2 TL took the very modern light rail transit, which was a breeze, except usually very crowded. What can you expect for a city with something like 15 million inhabitants? The Amira hotel staff were all very professional, yet each one seemed personable and friendly. We had lots of questions about where to eat in the evening and how to get around to see all the sights. They had great recommendations. The front desk staff were all young and spoke English very well. I would say, they rocked. The rooms were clean and modern (we stayed there twice, in different rooms each time). The air conditioning was very efficient. The rooms were quiet at night. The hotel appears to be two original buildings linked by a light-filled atrium. The decor reminded us of the Mondrian Hotel in South Beach Miami, with a lot of retro frilly-bits, red and white - chic, yet a bit whimsical. There is a rooftop patio for relaxing, with a great view. The breakfast was plentiful and fresh each morning. The warmed milk for the coffee was a nice touch. The hotel felt very comfortable, safe and friendly. What more could you ask for. A home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very friendly.”
Reviews.Author: markpilks
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the end of august. Minutes from the main sites. No need to set your alarm clock as the blue mosque WILL wake you up. Hotel sorted out a transfer from the airport for our group of 7 for e60. Big buffet breakfast included. Free wifi. Massive roof terrace and bar. Big clean room with AC. Great view of the river from the terrace. All good

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: JJ416
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Amir is located in the Sultanahmed (old) district of Istanbul near most of the historical attractions. It is within walking distance and fun to do so! The rooms are clean and spacious--the staff is incredibly accommodating and pleasant. The rooftop is a nice place to sit and relax for an hour at sunset. It was extremely hot when we were there, (August) but we were having so much fun we just dealt with it. My only word of caution is to choose your restaurants wisely. Some of the ottoman cuisine is difficult to digest and kepap (kebab) is everywhere! We had the most fun hanging out withthe people celebrating in front of the Blue Mosque every night t the break of their fat since it a Ramadan. I have never met such incredibly nice--happy--generous people. They set up a temporary mall of wooden shops and every night we tasted treats like the best Baklava I ever tasted! (I don't generally like Baklava) For daytime--we had a personal guide that was amazing--I contracted Ozcan Bicer--but he was sick that day and sent his brother instead--His brother was fantastic, but unfortunately I forgot his name!!! We felt so badly for him since he couldn't eat or drink all day(Ramadan) in that heat & still insisted on taking us to lunch and sitting with us. We saw al the sight and he was incredibly knowledgeable and informative. Anyway I highly recommend the hotel and Ozcan Bicer's brother. (look up Istanbul guides for his email) Istanbul is GREAT! The Moslems who live there and conduct themselves with such grace, openness and peace--should be the example for Moslems throughout the world. The Hotel Amira is great value for the price we spent although i notice the prices are changing because of all the great reviews. The breakfast they serve there is also wonderful and included in the price. Don't miss the Grand Bazaar and Spice Market!!! The shopping is insanely good.....

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Great staff!”
Reviews.Author: bazza815
Reviews.Content: I was there with a friend in mid August and we had a great time. If you're looking to stay in the old city, Amira is a great, reasonably priced spot. Hotel is pretty quiet, rooms are clean and modern, breakfast is good and the staff are super helpful. Arthur and Kartal are amazing concierges. They gave us great recommendations on where to go, what to see, where to eat/play and believe it or not, they even helped us plan the rest of our stay in Turkey... booking our hotel and flights for us because we didn't have any time! Amazing. They really went above and beyond and were are forever grateful!

Reviews.Title: “we loved it and we'll come back”
Reviews.Author: 188644Marc_V
Reviews.Content: The hotel is 18 months old and very nice. The staff is very helpfull and very kind. We had a welcoming drink and a briefing of what to do and where to go Rooms are clean and very comfortable Very nice view on marmaris sea from the terrace, where you can have a light lunch or drinks; sitting very confortably We had no time to visit the spa.

Reviews.Title: “A truly wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Yvonne M
Reviews.Content: We had an absolutely wonderful time at the Hotel Amira, it's a pity that our stay in Istanbul was so short. It was lovely to receive such a warm welcome from all the staff at the hotel, everyone was so helpful and friendly. The hotel is beautiful, the rooms immaculate and the roof terrace is a fantastic place to relax and enjoy the stunning views over Istanbul. We absolutely loved it! The breakfast was delicious, so much to choose from and we also very much enjoyed the complimentary afternoon tea and welcome drinks on arrival. The excellent and efficient service made our stay at the Hotel Amira a wonderful experience and we hope to return again to enjoy the wonderful delights of this boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel near heart of Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: sotte01
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 3 nights in October 2010 and were very impressed with this hotel as it was small, boutique, hip and friendly. English speaking staff was beyond helpful and the traditional Turkish breakfast (included) was one of the best I've had in all my travels. The rooms were charming with a mix of modern and traditional and very nice, updated bathrooms. The hotel was in a great location just a few minutes walk from all the historic sites, albeit a little tricky to find the first time as it's down a hill on a small side street. Make sure to check out the views from the rooftop terrace which we only found the last day of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Julie B
Reviews.Content: Welcoming and warm. The staff was so friendly and helpful. When we arrived the concierge took us to the restaurant for a drink and enthusiastically talked to us about what do and see in Istanbul. The room was really nice and the hotel is charming. Good location too!

Reviews.Title: “Just what you want when you don't want a big hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jerbina
Reviews.Content: Amira is a great example of small hotel that saves you from the impersonality and over-expense of large 5 stars. And unlike many smaller/less expensive hotels, it doesn't trim down the basics but rather offers you everything you need in an intimate environment. It's very reasonably priced; the staff is helpful and available for information and advice; the menu is not extensive but the lunch/dinner food is as good as you'll find in many of the restaurants around (breakfast eggs not so great but other things available); the rooms are sizable and clean and the beds very comfortable; the hotel in general is clean, and there is none of that terribly perfume smell that so many hotels have these days; there is a lovely rooftop area to sit and watch the water or have a drink or meal; the location is great,close to major sights and the waterfront. the only problem is that most or many of the rooms face the street, and it can be a noisy corner. I wore ear plugs so didn't hear anything at night, and the windows keep out much of the noise. But it's not a calm/out of the way area.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: newwalla
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Amira hotel towards the end of our vacation. We loved this hotel. We loved the location as it was within walking distance to the Blue Mosque, to a bazaar and a number of cute restaurants. The rooms itself were very nice as pictured on their website. The staff was extremely helpful. The front desk person gave us advice on the taxi situation within Istanbul as my mom cannot walk around as well. He gave us his personal mobile number should we run into trouble which thankfully we did not. Next time I am in Istanbul I am staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “A must stay Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KoKo006
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Istanbul and the staff at the Amira Hotel made us feel like we were at home. Before our arrival in Istanbul the communication from the hotel with regards to our accomodation was very prompt and efficient. We cannot praise the staff at the Hotel enough - nothing was any problem for them, from helping with restaurant reservations, sightseeing options, phoning airlines, the list goes on. Our room was nice and spacious and very clean and modern. The breakfast buffet was delicious and the gorgeous girl that served us each morning was very friendly and efficient. There is also a computer in the breakfast room that can be used by guests. There is even an ATM in the hotel. Most evenings we enjoyed a drink at the roof top bar ,which had the most amazing views, before heading out to one of the many rooftop restaurants nearby. The Amira is situated in Sultanahmet (the old city) and it is the perfect location for first time visitors as it is close to all the major sights. I cannot recommend this hotel and it's staff highly enough. We would definitely stay here on our next trip to this beautiful city of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Intrepid260
Reviews.Content: I've never written a review for anything before but Hotel Amira inspired me. From my first phone call to my checkout I had nothing but positive experiences. The entire staff could not possibly be friendlier or more helpful. The hotel is well located with a great view from their sadly underused gorgeous roof deck where you can eat dinner or have a drink, skype on with their wifi and watch the sunset on the water. The hotel is clean, comfortable and tasteful and the rooms actually feel like they have character and lots of modern amenities including rain showers and jacuzzi tubs, ipod docks and flat screens. The fitness center and spa are perfect and just maybe a little bit small but well suited to the size of the hotel. The breakfasts which are included are heaven......fresh fruits, yogurrts, breads, meats, eggs, coffee......It is a true luxury boutique hotel that is incredibly well priced.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel deserves it's top ranking with Trip Adviser!”
Reviews.Author: ElanAust
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Amira for a week recently and it met all the (high) expectations I had from the many positive reviews on Trip Adviser. The staff members at this small, personal hotel are superlative: professionally attentive and going to great lengths to ensure your stay with them is an enjoyable and successful one. The superior room we had (#304) was lovely and light, with views from it's little balcony down the street to the ocean and in the other direction along the street. The bed was superb, the room was quiet and very comfortable. I was very pleased to find no evidence of the 'disappointing breakfast buffet and lack of choice at breakfast' referred to by some previous reviewers. In fact, we found the (inclusively priced) breakfast generous in the extreme: with an extensive range of cold and hot beverages and foods - certainly enough to cater for all tastes and appetites: including a choice of fruit juices, cereals, breads,cakes and patisseries, fresh fruit platter, fresh fruit salad, natural and fruit yoghurts, charcuterie, cheeses, olives, nuts, dried figs, dates and apricots, and a variety of prepared hot foods including scrambled and boiled eggs, sausages etc. The extremely pleasant and professional man in charge of breakfast who unobtrusively, efficiently ensured that our used dishes were promptly removed and the buffet was always freshly replenished: remembered after the first morning that I preferred tea in a teapot so had one freshly filled with my choice of tea whenever possible ready for me when I came to breakfast. The roof top restaurant at the Amira is a must for an evening drink to enjoy the view from a peaceful haven. We also dined there and although the menu is very limited (same menu as room service) - it was very fairly priced and great as a quiet and relaxing alternative to going out. The superb position of the Amira meant we walked to all the major sights, and Arthur and his great crew gave us all the advice we needed with where to go and when. We heartily recommend this hotel, in particular for anyone who is visiting Istanbul for the first time and/or who is travelling alone and wants a hotel in which they feel secure.

Reviews.Title: “4 Star Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: keithkcleung
Reviews.Content: ** Summary ** - Rooms are decent, but nothing special - Location is great, since it's very close to all major attractions - Service is amazing with friendly staff ** Rooms ** - Small, but nicely decorated rooms (Toilet is a bit cramped) - Daily housekeeping, so the rooms are clean and tidy - Free, but spotty WiFi shared on each floor (You can connect via LAN as well) - Bed is clean and decent, but don't expect a 5-star hotel bed - Our room had no view since it was on the ground floor - (Not a room) but they have a roof garden with an amazing view which hotel guests can use for free ** Location ** - Around 5 minutes walk from all main attractions in the "Old District" (Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, etc.) - Neighborhood is safe, but quiet. Most bars and hangout spots are in the Old District, which is 5 minutes away - There's a taxi queue right outside the hotel ** Service ** - Staff is very friendly and helpful - Responded to our emails and questions before our arrival - On our first day, they spent over 20 minutes answering all our questions and made restaurant and site recommendations for our next 4 days - Once we decided on the restaurants, they were happy to help us make the reservations

Reviews.Title: “Excellent B&B boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Teesside_tourer
Reviews.Content: One night stay at end of cruise. Reception staff extremely pleasant and helpful. They were happy to let us leave bags following early arrival and before late departure; they advised on sites to visit and they dealt efficiently with transfer to airport. Superior rooms were spacious and clean, with good air conditioning. Roof terrace a good location for late evening drink. Breakfast choice was very good and food well presented. Whilst lunch/dinner options appeared to be limited, there are many restaurants within a few hundred metres.. Would definitely choose again for a weekend visit.

Reviews.Title: “Ladies and gentlemen, it is all true what they write here, hotel Amira is a gem!”
Reviews.Author: Ndfeed
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, our host Kartal made us feel very welcome, while enjoying a yummy house-made lemonade, he told us about the do's and don'ts of the city. The recommendations they made were very accurate. Then he introduced us to the roof terrace which wowed us, it's an oasis in the city, offering spectacular views. The room: very clean and comfortable, very good shower and comfy bed. The AC worked very well, and the windows are very well isolated, no noise from the busy streets came in. We had a Deluxe room with a big bed and a little extra bed as we were 2 females travelling, but we didn't bother with the little bed, just slept in the big bed, and they removed the extra bed for us in just a few minutes. Food in the hotel was ok, the karpuz (watermelon) and mixed fruit platter was yummy. Drinks were good and not overly expensive. But most of all, the staff make this place a gem, they are so genuinely friendly, and they are what makes this hotel so special. The hotel is really an oasis in this big city. Location: perfect for visiting the old city, you can even see the Blue Mosque from the roof terrace. I can not wait to come back here. A big thank you to Kartal and his colleagues, you make the difference!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it too...”
Reviews.Author: Essex-Hardys
Reviews.Content: Our experience of this lovely hotel very much match the other reviews on this site. The hotel itself is small, but very well presented. The facilities, including the fantastic scenic roof terrace are excellent. The rooms are comfortable and well appointed. But it stands out for the attention friendliness and service from its staff. We had a great stay and have no hesitation in highly recommending Hotel Amira.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way, including great staff”
Reviews.Author: nangu_pangu
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, the concierge took us to the dining room and had the bartender bring us a welcome drink of our choosing (a nice cappuccino). He then presented a tourist map that was custom-made for the hotel and showed us how to go to the different places around Istanbul. He spoke excellent English and was very pleasant to deal with. All of the front desk staff spoke great English and was very helpful with answering any questions we had. The restaurants they suggested were good and their descriptions were accurate. Sometimes in countries like Turkey, you assume that every vendor recommendation is based on a kick-back agreement between the two businesses, but I never ever got that sense with the hotel staff here. They were just earnestly interested in us having a great stay. Another nice touch: they gave us subway tokens at the front desk so we wouldn't have to fuss with the token machines. On the bill, they charged for the tokens at cost, with no markup. The complimentary breakfast included lots of fresh fruit, which was especially nice given that the Istanbul tourist diet can be heavy on the meat, light on the fruits and vegetables. The hotel was a 5 minute walk from the Blue Mosque and the tram line that goes through the middle of Sultanahmet and across the Galata bridge. It was also a short distance away from the main road that led to the airport, so the taxi fare was never more than 35 TL and 30-40 minutes. (Don't arrange for a taxi through the hotel, as they mark it up heavily). All in all, fantastic hotel in Istanbul and I would recommend with enthusiasm! We truly had a very pleasant stay. This hotel is very new so it wasn't in our guide book, but we sourced it through Tripadvisor and it certainly lived up to its great reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Staff doesn't get any better than this”
Reviews.Author: 1FS
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, our son and daughter-in-law and their two teen age children were guests here July 9-13; we were on our way to Africa from the US and wanted to deal with jet-lag before arriving in Kenya. We had Room 304, our son and his family were adjacent in what the hotel calls a family room; it was an excellent arrangement. The kids had a private, but connecting room to their parents. The hotel is perfectly located for the first-time visitor to Istanbul - in Sultanamet. While on a busy corner, we were never disturbed by traffic noise. So many of the favorite sites are located within a 10 minute walk - Hippodrome, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace and Hagia Sofia. There are good restaurants nearby (we weren't looking for "dining" experiences, except when we went to an outstanding fish restaurant one evening - Balikci Sabahattain. Now about that staff....You would have thought they worked for the most upscale hotel you can imagine. It seems anything about which we we inquired was the most important task of the moment for them. They "read" our family very quickly and realized our preferences for eating, walking and touring. Taxis are stationed right outside their door and manners were impectable.Need tokens for the tram or stamps for postcards? - they are produced for you (yes, they go on your bill). The daily breakfast is quite good (although predictable) and we had no trouble stoking our bodies for the day ahead; servers are attentive to keepng the buffet filled. The roof terrace is a jewel and our family spent R&R time there in the evenings; food and drink is available (I believe brought in from outside restaurants) Our flight from the US was delayed a day and we did not have the time required to cancel our first night at the hotel. No problem, that night was canceled for us with no charge by our host, Ferhat, who served as our guardian during the stay. Ozzy (his "English" name) was outstanding at the front desk and did everything in his power to make our stay enjoyable. All in all, I can't imagine a better choice for us. We did not want a large hotel, and we wanted to be in Sultanamet. Hotel Amira won't disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous stay”
Reviews.Author: robertafs
Reviews.Content: The hotel was one of the highlights of our trip. From the moment we arrived until the moment we left, the staff could nto have been more friendly and helpful. The restaurant suggestions, map reading and taxi directions were as appreciated as the personal and warm engagement of all members of the Amira team. The room was lovely, clean and wonderful view and the location superb. Highly recomemnded.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with the Amira - exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Kathy186338
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Amira in Istanbul recently. The very best feature is the staff - they were extremely accommodating and friendly. Our room was on the 3rd floor and I was initially concerned that it would be noisy. However, it was so quiet at night, and we always enjoyed a peaceful night's sleep. The bedroom was spacious and the bathroom fine. It was not luxurious, but attractive and perfectly acceptable; excellent value for money. The free wireless was one of our requirements, and it always worked perfectly. We used the iPod docking feature every day, too. The air conditioning provided welcome respite from the summer temperatures. The Hotel Amira's breakfast buffet was generous with a lot of variety - something to suit all tastes. It was always fresh and replenished frequently. The rooftop deck was our favorite place for a pre-dinner drink each evening. The view is spectacular and the staff made sure we always had bowls of mixed nuts and crisps. The hotel is conveniently located, within walking distance to major attractions and some very good restaurants. There is a fish restaurant up the street (recommended by the concierge) with excellent food served on a rooftop terrace. We took taxis several times, with mixed experiences. Taxis from the hotel are fine, but when took taxis back to the hotel, we were grossly overcharged and they did not drop us off in front of the hotel. Take the tram or walk whenever possible. I am including some suggestions to make the Amira even better for guests. It would have been nice to have bottled water provided each day, fresh bed linen each day, and more than 1 bath towel per person. Fresh squeezed fruit juice would be a nice addition to the breakfast buffet. These are the reasons I am rating it very good rather than excellent. The Hotel Amira was an excellent choice for us, and we enjoyed our stay tremendously!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Kaschu_BR
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very beautiful and well decorated. The service is excellent, and we got very useful tips from the front desk on what to see in Istanbul and how to get there using public transportation. The breakfast is also very good, with large variety. The room had a confortable bed and was very beautiful as well. I was only a little bit disappointed about the bathroom. As I read so many positive evaluations about the hotel in Tripadvisor, I expected the shower to be cleaner - there was mold in the corners. This is something I really don't like. We did not complaint about it, since we wanted to enjoy the trip without stress. Even a little bit overpriced, it is a good place to stay in Istanbul. Consider looking a little bit further for a cheaper hotel with the same confort, Istanbul has a lot to offer (please see my review on the Hotel Sultania, also in Istanbul).

Reviews.Title: “no hesitation to recommend the hotel amira”
Reviews.Author: gregh1234
Reviews.Content: My son and I visited Istanbul for 5 days and stayed at the Hotel Amira - we would recommend it to anyone - Close to the major tourist sites, the value is exceptional for a hotel in a major city. The staff were friendly, helpful and spoke good to excellent English in the main. The room was comfortable and clean and the beds were very good. The breakfast was one of the best we had in Turkey - which is saying something as the breakfasts in Turkey are often very good. No hesitation in recommending the Amira - we had prebooked another hotel at the end of our journey and regretted it once we arrived there - the Amira was far better.

Reviews.Title: “Uncommon thoughfulness and professionalism of the staff”
Reviews.Author: tdandrea333
Reviews.Content: A peach of an Istanbul hotel -- a lovely calm oasis to repair to after a busy day out in this most dynamic city. Nicely appointed bedroom and bathroom, very attractive breakfast room, a rooftop terrace with fine lounge furniture and some superb views of the environs, and an excellent spa area. Best of all is the uncommon thoughtfulness and professionalism of the staff and their desire to make your stay as enjoyable as possible: they went out of their way in my brief stay to accommodate me (including with a change in my reservation) and to make me feel welcome. You will have to travel far and wide to fine service of this sort. Expect princely treatment, and you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MBSawyer
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, it was clear that the positive reviews of this hotel were entirely justified. Unless you stay out of town, there is no such thing as a quiet hotel in Istanbul but here, my wife and I found our little oasis away from the madding crowds, so to speak. The only issue we had was the noise of traffic at night but there isn't much anyone can do about that. Even the double glazing doesn't solve the problem. Nonetheless, we enjoyed seven nights in a delightfully spacious and refreshingly decorated, air conditioned room which served as a cooling respite from the summer heat. And boy it was hot outside, day and night. The Amira Hotel is nicely positioned close (but not too close) to the historic attractions of the old city. The staff were extremely friendly and gave us some great tips for sightseeing and eating out. You never need to walk more than 10 minutes to find the best restaurantes and apart from airport transfer, we never used a taxi once. However, we found the superb buffet breakfast was quite enough until dinner. This is an uncomplicated hotel with a lovely airy and minimalist feel about it and if there is such a thing as 'Feng Shui' in a European tourist metropolis, then the Amira has probably captured it. Overall, we felt very much at home and always welcome when we passed reception. A special thanks to Kamer, who gave us special attention. A very nice person with a great smile. Verdict: Extremely enjoyable and worth every penny. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved It”
Reviews.Author: Killcare
Reviews.Content: We Loved the Hotel Amira. The web site enabled me to book a room for us and a single room for a friend who was leaving earlier (relief). On arrival we were greeted with coffee/juice and a chat about Istanbul The three of us could not recommend suggested resturants near by and places to visit for those staying longer than just a couple of days. Breakfasts were superb, the rooms were the same as the web rather than the usual lesser. Up stairs terrace was magic for an evening pre dinner drink (nibbles were always included). All the staff were particularly friendly and spoke excellent English. I need not mention the location, as a glance at the web displays how central it is for the tourist attractions. The three of us were delighted with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Xtrem123
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel. Lovely terrace to have a drink or meal. 5min walk a to all the great sights

Reviews.Title: “My cup of tea”
Reviews.Author: FFMTL62
Reviews.Content: Strategic spot near Istanbul landmarks, strategic advices given by the concierge, great hospitality, and delicious Turkish tea in the morning.;-) Totally satisfied!

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Respite in Turkey!”
Reviews.Author: maustin8
Reviews.Content: This was a perfect hotel for our stay in Istanbul. We highly recommend it! Location: Hotel Amira is within walking distance of most of the major historical attractions and wonderful restaurants in the city. It is only a 10 minute walk to the Blue Mosque and the Aya Sophia, and 15 minutes to Tokapi Palace. We found nice restaurants nearby, and small shops to explore. The Hotel: Beautiful and spacious! They have a lovely rooftop bar, and the hotel is nicely decorated. The gentlemen behind the front desk were extremely helpful, and aided us with communicating with taxi drivers and recommendations for restaurants. We felt very safe here, and very well cared for! Breakfast was nice with a large buffet and coffee/tea. Additional items such as omelets or cappuccino were available for an additional cost. The Room: Was lovely!!! Is was large, clean, and had a very nice bath. Finely decorated! We were thrilled with the room.

Reviews.Title: “Best service EVER”
Reviews.Author: KFlash88
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel was the best I've ever experienced. Every single staff person there went out of his way to make you feel comfortable, to help you out with all your questions, and to greet you with a smiling face. I even joked with my mom that I wanted to pack them all up in my suitcase and bring them home with me because they were so wonderful. Especially noteworthy -- near the end of our trip, we returned to the hotel at 7:00 am after having been on a sleeper train all night on which we were not able to wash ourselves. Of course our rooms were not yet ready, but the hotel let us use their wonderful wellness center free of charge even though we probably went through at least six towels and bathrobes and spent an hour or so in there. The breakfast served every morning was great, and so was the rooftop terrace where you could enjoy a drink or have a meal. The service on the rooftop was also impeccable, as my father and I were on the terrace late one night when a group of drunken, loud hotel guests joined us. A staff person asked if they would like anything (even though I'm sure it was after hours) and rushed off to fulfill their requests after being treated quite curtly and rudely. Only downside was that the rooms and amenities in them were not super fancy ... definitely very nice, but not what you would find in a super upscale, five-star hotel. One of our rooms had air-conditioning that did not work consistently and the other had a shower that did not drain properly. Although upon reporting these things someone came to look at and try to fix them immediately (within a couple minutes), they never really ended up working properly. But honestly, with service like this, who really cares ...

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: Dalimans
Reviews.Content: We were 3 families in 4 rooms and we had a fantastic stay at the Amira!! The staff were very helpful, breakfast was great, transfers organized, restaurant recommendations and bookings made, late checkout, no problem! Walked to all the sites, Grand Bazaar etc from there wit 2 small children! Highly recommend a stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Deserve's the Number 1 rating”
Reviews.Author: Sue331966
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights in June at the Amira Hotel (after reading all the good reviews on Trip Advisor), and it definitely deserves the number 1 spot. From the moment I arrived, the staff were very helpful and greeted you each time they saw you. They give you a city map and show you where all the main attractions are (all within walking distance), together with a welcome drink. They also recommend restaurants nearby. The room was gorgeous with a lovely bathroom. Spacious, very clean and you could not hear any outside noise. And the bed was very comfortable, ensuring a great night's sleep. The rooftop terrace has lovely views of the Bosphorus. You can relax on the terrace with a drink, or just curl up on the chairs for a couple of hours with a good book. I would definitely recommend a stay at the Amira in Instanbul. It is where I will be when I return.

Reviews.Title: “They deserve the #1 spot on TripAdvisor”
Reviews.Author: RodrigoN
Reviews.Content: It doesnt matter if youre travelling alone, as a couple or with a group of friends: this hotel is an extraordinary experience (we spent 4 nights there). Im not going to repeat all things already said by other reviewers, but only stress out that the staff is amazing and they will go out of their way to make sure you enjoy the city. They dont have a bar; instead, they have the most charming terrace where you can watch the sunset and the bosphorus having a drink, with a staff member taking orders till late night. It is so nice that Ive met people from other hotels coming by. Breakfast is great. This hotel is new (opened early 2010), so rooms are comfy, decorated with good taste in boutique style and with safe/ ac/ cable tv. Location is great: in the old town area, walking distance from main historical attractions but in a quiet block, a few steps away from the busy and loud area.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place”
Reviews.Author: aleksvp
Reviews.Content: Great location, great staff. It was our honeymoon, and so they upgraded our room. We got a great welcome, with a lot a explanations on the city and also free drinks. Our room had a nespresso machine, a ipod dock and a lot of nice details.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, very helpful staff and convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: nmelba
Reviews.Content: Lovely boutique hotel , within walking distance to main sites. The breakfast was great and bonus afternoon tea after a hard day sightseeing!. Great staff at reception, very friendly and helpful ieg recommending restaurants - all good and reasonable price - and helping out with directions. You can even buy token for trams at reception. Rooms were airy and clean and the terrace was great to chill out after a hard day. We would definitely recommend to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “I cannot recommend this place enough!”
Reviews.Author: Vissy_DC
Reviews.Content: This hotel made our stay in Istanbul amazing! The staff were very professional and would always go above and beyond to assist us. Upon arrival, the hotel manager sat down with us in the restaurant and recommended some sights to see and restaurants to try, we were also supplied with a welcome drink. Some additional services the hotel provided which proved most useful was the offer to make reservations at restaurants/clubs and with tours. They also supplied Metro tokens at cost with the option to return any unused tokens. The hotel facilities were very nice. It was a clean funky boutique style hotel. The included European style breakfast with fresh fruit, cheeses, meats and even some hot food was excellent. To top it off the hotel had a rooftop bar with seating area which had lovely views of the harbor. Location wise, it's proximity within the old town meant that we could walk to all the old sites.

Reviews.Title: “The excellent service is second to none...”
Reviews.Author: CelticSis
Reviews.Content: We have travelled to many countries in the world and I have to say that the service in this hotel really sets them apart. On the day you arrive, there is a 1:1 introduction to the city highlights whilst sitting on a beautiful terrace overlooking the sea - how wonderfully relaxing and it immediately sets the tone of the holiday! Just be careful of the recommendations on the restaurants - personally, we did not enjoy the food in any of them, but then that's much the same story for the whole tourist area of Istanbul - you can expect very poor food at quite expensive prices. We were really impressed with how the hotel staff handled a small complaint, going the extra mile to deal with it swiftly and make sure we were happy. Breakfast was great and it was a really nice touch that they waited until everybody had left the breakfast room before clearing away the buffet. Our room was spacious, well decorated and impeccably clean. One tip I have for visitors is to try the spa for an hour and ask for exclusive use. It's small but beautiful and extremely relaxing after a busy day touring the city. A tip for the hotel is to let the guests know that you serve meals on the terrace - we did not know about that so we missed out.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious clean rooms and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: AGrassini
Reviews.Content: A family run hotel, the Amira offers the amenities you would expect for this class of service. We enjoyed the spotless and large bedroom, the comfortable bathroom, and the first class breakfast buffet. The bed was very comfortable, while the pillows were just ok (slightly lumpy but ok overall). The orientation we received upon arrival was very good--we cut our short as we had been to Istanbul before, but we could see that it would have been most valuable if this were our first time here. The location is convenient to the Blue Mosque, which is slightly up hill from here. Perhaps not as ideal as others but the great rooms are worth it. If you have a problem with stairs, keep in mind that the elevator is not on the same level as some of the rooms!! Walking distance to the Arasta Bazaar which is smaller but perfect for laid back non aggressive shopping. Good restaurant recommendations...and great help in getting directions and reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service and nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: gopgov
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Amira for two nights and truly enjoyed the service. Prior to my arrival, the hotel set up transportation from the airport to the hotel as well as a personal tour guide for my visit. When I arrived at hotel, I was quickly greeted by name and checked into my room. Before I went to the room, the guest services representative offered me a drink and we sat in the dining room where he proceeded to show me a map of the city and mark "must see" items. While I had never been to Istanbul, I felt at home in this hotel and really appreciated the attention to detail and the efforts made by the staff. This is where I will stay on my next trip to Turkey. The only negative was that the spa is small and if you don't make an appointment, you can't simply walk in to the steam room.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel - over 2 stays here/deserves its reputation”
Reviews.Author: barusso
Reviews.Content: We (me, husband and 14 year old daughter) had two stays at the Hotel Amira in June for 3 and 4 days respectively. It was outstanding in all respects. I had been attracted by the ratings and by the seemingly beautiful rooftop terrace and we were not disappointed. We had a room on the 3rd floor for the first and 1st floor for the 2nd visit. Neither room suffered from either hotel or street room. The windows are so well sound-proofed that we would have to open them to hear the call to prayer which we came to love hearing (couldn't hear with windows closed). The rooms were modern, air-conditioned, nicely decorated, the shower strong, the Wifi steady and strong (iMac in breakfast/leisure room). The rooms have safes big enough for laptops and iPhone players/chargers in the room. The ATM on premises was helpful. There is a taxi stand right outside the hotel which was convenient and the hotel watched over the guys who lined up so you had sure service when using them. We ended up using the Tram so much though as it was safe, fast (often faster than the taxi through traffic), clean and cheap. Just 10 minutes up the road to the closest Tram stop. Reviewers keep talking about how difficult the uphill walk is. it isn't THAT uphill or difficult and we're in our mid-50s. Good exercise. Istanbul is on 7 hills so there are hills and up-hill walks everywhere. It took 5-7 minutes to the Hippodrome area, Blue Mosque and Arasta Bazaar, 10-12 minutes to Aya Sofia and the cistern, 10-15 to Grand Bazaar. you can walk to so many things The hotel at the front desk and door was always well-staffed, ready to jump and help you with anything you possibly needed help with and answer any question or provide any suggestion. The breakfast staff was extremely friendly and happily endured our attempts at speaking Turkish. They happily held our luggage for us while we were in Cappadocia. Aziz, who had the late shift and helped with the bar and drinks and food on the terrace is wonderful - charming and so helpful. We used the terrace every single night as it was beautifully decorated, furnished (even a bathroom on the terrace) and had nice views of the Sea and the area. You can see the little Aya Sofya (now mosque, was church) down the street (worth making a quick visit) day and night, the minarets and top of the Blue Mosque (with the seagulls flying around the minarets at night). The terrace is a quiet and modern oasis, with wide umbrellas in case the sun is too strong (didn't go above 80 F our entire visit. We ate there one night as we had come back too tired to go out again and dinner was good and the setting on the rooftop terrace with glasses of wine, Raki and Efes even better. Wonderful place - we will go back both to Istanbul and the Hotel Amira.

Reviews.Title: “Loved hotel and would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: sue0704055
Reviews.Content: 2 families traveled with adult children. Friendly, very helpful, english speaking staff gave us a little orientation with welcome drink upon arrival. Wonderful breakfasts. Rooms clean and attractive. Flat screen TV, Wi-Fi, Roof top terrace great for lounging. Walking distance to major sites like Blue Mosque, Bazaar,etc.

Reviews.Title: “A+ for Amira”
Reviews.Author: Londonmammoth2
Reviews.Content: I must admit that before our trip to Istanbul I was a bit suspicious of the rave reviews for Hotel Amira on Tripadvisor: there were just too many! But only after one hour of arriving at the hotel I realised that my concerns were unjustified and Amira did really deserve the praise it had received. I am not exaggerating when I say that the service we received from the team at Amira was on par with that of the better 5-star hotels my wife and I have been to. Either they have been very lucky to have - without exception - naturally friendly and professional staff, or someone in charge is a pro in the hospitality business and has been training his team expertly. Our room was of ample size, and it was very clean, comfortable and well-appointed. The breakfast is excellent, and at other times the breakfast room turns into a nice lounge you can rest and relax in. The roof-top terrace/restaurant is atmospheric and offers excellent views of the city. We had dinner here on our first night in Istanbul and were not disappointed. There is free wifi everywhere in the hotel. I agree with other reviewers who said you can easily walk to all the major sites in Sultanahmet quarter. The location also feels safe. What really makes this hotel special is the friendliness, helpfulness and positive attitude of the people who work there; we never heard the word 'no' from them. If you want a great base from which you can explore the city of Istanbul, choose this hotel. Thank you Hotel Amira!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Better than my Hilton room for half the price!”
Reviews.Author: Austinroamer
Reviews.Content: Great clean small hotel with attentive English speaking staff and central location. I wish I had more nights to stay here. FYI my room was 100euro per night June 26th 2011

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, endless smiles from staff”
Reviews.Author: AllanMCCosta
Reviews.Content: The fame Hotel Amira achieved among tripadvisor community is really well deserved. Absolutely every detail in our 4 nights stay worked well. The staff is amazing. Is hard to believe that even the person that stays all night long at the reception (thanks ozzy) keeps a smile on his face and is unconditionally ready to help. The room was better than on the pictures and you can't miss the spa. Make sure you reserve at least one hour for yourself. I bet you won't regret. Location is also perfect, walking distance from everything in Sultanameth. I really can't give enough compliments.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, staff and location”
Reviews.Author: JAH1
Reviews.Content: My friend and I enjoyed a 3 night stay at this hotel and were so pleased with both our rooms, the location and the helpfulness of the staff. It was our first time in Istanbul and we had ideas on what we wanted to see while in the city. The front desk was helpful in making suggestions and offering advice when we were making our plans for the day. Take the tram, it's clean, safe and a great way to get around the city. They sell the tram tokens at the desk so we did not need to try and figure out how to buy them at the stops in the city. They also offered great assistance in which stops to use for some of the sites we wanted to see on the other side of the "Golden Horn" . The staff also gave great advice and told us to visit the Chora Church. They recommended lunch next door to the church at wonderful restaurant. called Asitane. It's really a must when you are in Istanbul. The food is authentic Ottoman cuisine made from recipes dating back to the 16th century. The Hotel Amira staff cautioned us about the cab drivers that would just be on the street in this area as they are not all honest. The hotel told us to have the restaurant call a cab for us to ensure we were brought directly back and not driven around to run up the fare. I felt that the Hotel Amira staff takes great pride in Istanbul and wants every guest to walk away loving the city and their experience in it/ They do everything they can to accomoodate the weary traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: PatoColumbus
Reviews.Content: Booked Hotel Amira based on the reviews on this site and I must say it fulfilled all my expectations and more. The super friendly staff made me feel at home from the moment I arrived. Nothing was difficult for them and they always responded with a smile. The breakfast was delicious and the room tastefully appointed. The location was excellent - you can walk to major attractions easily and safely. Their restaurant recommendations were also excellent. The only disappointing thing was the Bosphorus cruise/Spice Market tour they arranged for me - not worth it, very poor guide. I can't wait to stay at the Amira again. I found the best rate by booking directly in the hotel website.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel...what are you waiting for? Book it!”
Reviews.Author: magicpixiejo
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading the great reviews on tripadvisor and was not disappointed! Hotel Amira is an oasis of calm and tranquility in the middle of the craziness of Istanbul. The hotel is beautifully and stylishly decorated, with a fantastic roof terrace with views of the Marmara Sea and (just) the Blue Mosque. The location is great...a five minute (honestly!) walk to the centre of Sultanahmet and the main sights (Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia etc) up a small street with great shopping and some good restaurants (try Sunrise for dinner...great staff and a cool terrace). The breakfast was varied, with an amazing array of fresh fruits, the a la carte food and drinks menu was pretty good too (I was very pleasantly surprised by Turkish wine!). We also used the small but perfectly formed sauna and jacuzzi which was great after a crazy day of shopping...
