The rooms (I stayed in two different ones) were decorated in pale colours with splashes of luxurious silks and velvets, the beds were some of the most comfortable I've ever slept in and the rainforest shower in the bathroom was great. The deluxe room had more space and two huge double beds, but the standard room was also a pretty good size as well and both were as well laid out and beautifully decorated as each other. The other point to mention is the staff who did everything they could to make our stay in the hotel, and in Istanbul, as enjoyable as possible. They were unfailingly polite, courteous and helpful - without being obsequious (a common problem I find!) and their advice definitely made a difference to our stay. Best bits: fab roof terrace and amazingly comfy beds...I've already booked my next stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Drunkmuppet
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, great staff! Try not to get a room in the lower level as it can be very loud. The best thing about this hotel is it is outside the major tourist districts but close enough to walk to everything. Everything is top notch and they have a great buffet breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Amira is Turkish hospitality with a modern, professional approach”
Reviews.Author: ksredl
Reviews.Content: The two best parts of the hotel are the rooftop balcony and the hospitality of the front desk staff. We would return to the hotel in the early evening just to enjoy a moment here, listen to the call to prayer echo across Istanbul, reflect on all we saw that day, and drink a nice glass of wine. The view in the front is of the water, with the Blue Mosque and Istanbul behind. It is an elegant spot, and I enjoyed overhearing the comments about Istanbul made by other travelers who also enjoyed the rooftop. The guests are an international crowd of experienced travelers; you feel far from the crowd of mass tourism. As for the front desk staff, they gave us excellent advise on where to eat, which means a lot to me as I see cuisine as an entryway to local culture. In the morning, I would talk to them about my impressions of Istanbul culture from the day before, and they gave me in-depth explanations of all the things that had surprised me the day before. We arrived at the hotel by accident after being swindled by a travel agency - Amira is next door to the place the crooked Istanbul airport travel agency sent us. In the process of making our booking, we explained the situation to the front desk manager, Arthur. From that point on, the staff made sure we embraced our time in Istanbul. They seemed to take the crooked agency's behavior as an offense to their profession and their local tourism and hospitality industry. The staff is well-selected and proud of their profession, hotel, and city. The rooms are elegantly decorated with local details such as the art hanging on the walls. They have global standards of functional, appealing, comfortable design. The breakfast is a nice exposure to local, fresh cuisine. I think the price of the rooms is a steal. By the way, if you are looking for elegant art, gifts, etc from Turkey, please visit Sofa, an art shop near the Grand Bazar. I bought some nice prints there, by local artists.

Reviews.Title: “Deservedly number 1”
Reviews.Author: pdm535
Reviews.Content: Stayed 12-15th June. Excellent hotel. Service really good and I particularly liked the helpful chat on arrival about places they recommend. We had a de-luxe room which was well worth the money. Didn't inspect the ordinary rooms, but I beleieve they will also be good standard. Great roof terrace to relax after walking around the sights. Slight irritation that they charge extra for fresh orange at breakfast. With this standard of hotel it should really be a given.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in old city”
Reviews.Author: Pupsomaniac
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and new. Service was excellent. Good breakfast. Great value for money. Perfect for a short sightseeing break. If you go for shopping or nightlife would recommend to stay in athe new city . And be very careful with Istanbul taxis (check that the meter is on, remember there are no night rates and in the night ask to turn on the light before giving money and remember how much you gave as they play tricks with money so you pay much more)

Reviews.Title: “Par Excellence”
Reviews.Author: lindsle1
Reviews.Content: Any time we are in Istanbul we will stay at this hotel. It has everything going for it - great location, rooftop sunset view/lounge, excellent breakfast and nice rooms. None of that makes any difference when compared to the service, which is absolutely the best. From the first sit-down chat to all the help throughout the stay the people are what make the hotel wonderful. I don't think the staff ever sleeps. It is also a bonus to have an ATM in the hotel, the tram tokens available at the desk and the airport car service available. We have been raving about this place ever since we returned.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great breakfast buffet”
Reviews.Author: Maria_sophie
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellent. You can visit all the sightseeing destinations just by taking a short walk from here. The taxi facility to the airport is also good. There are also many good restaurants nearby. The rooms are good and have a view of the road below. You are given a warm welcome when you enter it. The customer service is also great. The breakfast buffet had quite a lot of variety in it and was excellent. There were many international and local preparations. The roof terrace is a nice place to relax in the evenings after sunset. We would love to stay at this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Amira a terrific hotel in the Old City!”
Reviews.Author: RiderRipper
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the front and back end of a month long visit to Turkey and were lucky enough to come across the Amira Hotel as our introduction to the country. Privately owned and immaculately fashioned, this hotel was the perfect stop for us. In addition to the phenomenal rooms and attention to detail, the staff are really where itâ€™s at. Arthur, who was trained in California brings a nice bridge between cultures and he is worth his weight in gold to this hotel. Having said that, Iâ€™d also like to throw out big Thank youâ€™s to Ferhat and â€œThe Eagleâ€� for terrific work. We hadnâ€™t even arrived yet and they obtained conert tickets for us which were waiting upon our arrival.The door staff were also great. The location, here in the Old City had the right mix of â€œneighbourhoodâ€� to go along with tourist amenities. The Blue Mosque was only 2 blocks away and right next to it the really nice Arasta Bazaar, where the high pressure sales attitude is pleasantly subdued. Another thing about the location is that it is right at the entrance to the Old City so getting out of Dodge is quick and easy. The cabbies congregate here too, so ther is 24 hour access. All in all a great stay and we wonâ€™t be staying anywhere else on our next visit! Ron & Deb - Calgary, Canada

Reviews.Title: “location, location location!”
Reviews.Author: luzurich
Reviews.Content: The best thing was the welcome, the gave us a introduction of Istanbul and the things to the location was for us perfect. The breakfast was nice (try the rose jam with yogurt very yummy) The rooms where very nice except the bath, the silicon around was black! overall it felt clean. The problem with such a nice staff is that they where always around like sharks looking what where you doing or if you need something, after a while I felt like a boarding school. Another thing is that one of the staff got really upset when we took a tour from another company. I can only guess that he didn't get his commission. Other thing is if you have any walking disabilities ask for a spacial room. Ours was between floors and we had to take stares to take the lift.

Reviews.Title: “Better than excellent”
Reviews.Author: OzLou
Reviews.Content: Amira you deserve your #1 position!! From our time of arrival and throughout our four night stay at the end of May, we were made to feel very welcome and it felt that we were staying with members of our long lost family. We were welcomed to the hotel with an ice cold beer on the roof terrace, had our introduction to Istanbul with the very friendly and informative Arthur and told "this is your home, please use it as such". The rooms are welcoming and clean, have every amenity and if you cannot find it, then the staff will ensure it is brought to you immediately, or in your room for you once back from your day in the city. Very well located close to all historical sites, shopping and Bosphorous. Staff recommendations on dining, shopping and site seeing - this hotel has every element of service. Although I did not get all names of staff during our stay, both Arhur and Izir (from the roof top terrace) were amazingly patient and helpful during our stay. Thank You Hotel Amira for an amazing stay in Istanbul !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best welcome never had”
Reviews.Author: cervino75
Reviews.Content: Frankly speaking I think it was really the best welcome I've never had. The guy whom welcome us brought us on the terrace and offer us a drink while introducing all the interesting area to visit, restaurants and club as well as reservation service and so on, with lots of details. The hotel is really nice, clean, smells parfume everywhere. Room was beautiful with wooden floor and lot of space. Just the bad was not really big and long, but the sleep was nice. The location I can just confirm it is perfect if you are here for a vacation. All main point of interest are walking distance, Blu Mosque, Topkapi, Gran Bazar etc.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, excellent staff, beautiful atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: boloca
Reviews.Content: Hotel Amira was an amazing find! We couldn't have been happier! The Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia, the Grand Bazaar and the Underground Cistern are all within close walking distance. The staff were some of the best we've encountered in any hotel around the world. On arrival they gave us a complete briefing on everything and helped us with dining ideas which turned out to be great as well as arranging shuttles for the 5 of us for arrival and departure. The rooftop deck was awesome with an incredible view of the Bosphurus. We enjoyed morning coffee and cakes there upon arrival and enjoyed wine and the sunset views. Breakfast buffet was excellent as was afternoon tea. We loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and wonderful rooms”
Reviews.Author: rlemon81
Reviews.Content: I can only echo previous reviews - our room (Standard room) was huge and so well appointed - the bed was comfortable and there was plenty of space. The spa bath was great for my aching legs after three days of sightseeing in Istanbul. Breakfasts were buffet and offered plenty of choice - watch out for the coffee though - an espresso is â‚¬4 while the standard filtered stuff (Douwe Egberts) was included. The terrace on the 5th floor offered a great opportunity for relaxing and the wonderful gentleman who served drinks there was delightful. In fact, the entire staff we interacted with were wonderful. The hotel's location is perfect for seeing the old town but the best restaurants and bars are across the river in Beyoglu, which we accessed easily by tram. The hotel also organised a Boshporus cruise excursion for us - don't leave Istanbul without taking a cruise down this gorgeous river. We loved the Amira and will be recommending it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: golonghornsgo
Reviews.Content: Great location for visiting all the sights by foot or tram. As quiet as can be expected given the central location. Great taxi transfer from and to airport. Very nice and brandnew rooms. Excellent breakfast buffet. Awesome roof terrace. Service out-of-this-world. Arthur is simply the best. "You will always have a room here".

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to expectations and more . . . .”
Reviews.Author: travellers_tw0
Reviews.Content: It's not very often that a hotel delivers such a welcome and we wondered if it would live up the excellent reviews that we had read. I am pleased to say that it did and it proved to be the perfect location to enjoy the old city and see the main attractions. This little hotel really know how to deliver customer service in a relaxed and friendly way. From the outset, we were given helpful advice from Arthur about how to make the most of our three day stay and because of this we managed to see a lot and we enjoyed some very good local food as a results of his restaurant recommendations. The Amira itself was spotless and the room was comfortable and well organised with a great shower. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet which had a wide variety of foods and the fresh fruits, cheeses, breads and pastries were particularly good. The afternoon tea with freshly made cake was also a treat after a busy day sightseeing, but what was even better was a drink on the roof top terrace in the early evening watching and hearing the sights and sounds of the old city and beyond. Mr Aziz, the waiter on the terrace was particularly good and the service he provided was friendly and respectful at all times. If you are thinking about visiting Istanbul and want to stay somewhere where you are really welcomed and looked after, this is the place for you. It's the perfect location to spend a few days finding out about this fascinating city.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: skylark24
Reviews.Content: We decided to book here on the basis of other reviews on TripAdvisor. This relatively small hotel is ideally situated within easy walking distance - but not in the midst of - the major attractions in Sultanahmet. The rooms are spotless, the service warm and genuinely friendly and the breakfast offerings are great.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: monicadavydov
Reviews.Content: simply the best hotel !!!! Nice hotel, clea rooms, staff is really great, an d i also liked that the owner is Armenian . good luck you guys!!!!!! i"ll be back!!!!!! and thanks again

Reviews.Title: “Simply the Best”
Reviews.Author: Tangels10
Reviews.Content: Myself and wife stayed for 7 nights in a suite. The room was very large with a balcony. The bathroom was large and the shower great. The value for this type of room I thought was very good. The roof lounge area had a view of the Bosphorous and could also see a slight view of the Blue Mosque. The staff were all outstanding, extremely helpful with restaurant, metro and general tips on getting around -the most helpful hotel staff I have come across in all my travel years. ATM in the hotel is very useful. Breakfast is good. Location of the hotel is very convenient to all the major sites, shopping and restaurants. T-cell the local sim provider (iphone4) is just around the corner although the hotel provides free wifi in the rooms which was great for the iPad.

Reviews.Title: “Superb value for money and extremely welcoming”
Reviews.Author: mike_tinsley
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 day break and wasn't disappointed. Intimate atmosphere with excellent staff; they couldn't have been more charming and helpful. Room elegantly furnished, very comfortable bed and superb shower. The roof terrace has a great view and the basement sauna and spa are available for your exclusive use. Superb location for the main sites in the old city with a plethora of great places to eat for all budgets within 15 minutes walk. If you're minded to get up in time(!), breakfast is very good and tea on the terrace at 5pm is a great way to end a day's sightseeing. Surrounding streets are busy and noisy but this applies to the entire area; with double glazing and air conditioning this is not a problem. Overall, highly recommended and the perfect base and an oasis of calm for a visit to this hectic but wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel in the heart of Old City”
Reviews.Author: gpahuja
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at this hotel centrally located walking distance from many of Istanbul's greatest landmarks such s the Blue Mosque, Topikapi Palace, Haga Sofia and shopping and restaurants and much more. The Hotel it is small but perfect, it is beautifully furnished and the rooms are clean and comfortable. Breakfast comes with the rooms and has a wide selection. The staff was extremely courteous and helpful. For the money that we paid to stay the value was much more. i would highly recommend staying here if you are planning a trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the Best....”
Reviews.Author: Neesie1
Reviews.Content: From the minute you walk into this hotel you know you have chosen well. The friendliness and helpfulness of all the staff is exceptional. A very special thanks to Arthur...nothing was too much trouble for him. The room was wonderful and it was very nice to have tea and coffee making facilities in the room, a room which was absolutely spotless, the breakfast lovely . Nothing negative at all to say. Was one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. When I go back to Istanbul this will be the hotel I stay. It makes such a difference to a holiday to have such a wonderful place to come back to at the end of each day. THANK YOU Hotel Amira!!

Reviews.Title: “10/10”
Reviews.Author: TravellerAbuDhabi
Reviews.Content: It has all been said before so just want to add that Hotel Amira rightly deserves it's number one slot. What sets it apart from the competeition is the attitude of its staff. We usually stay at Four Seasons hotels but as we were only in Istanbul for one night we thought we'd try the Amira. Great little hotel where the staff are truly amazing. Went for dinner to the nearby Four Seasons & found the staff there condescending & over-fussy - they could lean a thing or two from Hotel Amira staff. Will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “THE place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: luxo52
Reviews.Content: From the time you arrive to your leaving time the hotel and its staff take you into their care. From the welcome sit down drink and information session about what to see and how to do that to the food at the restaurant all is first class. The rooms are very comfortable and homely. There are many greta little touches. The front desk guys always have good suggestions and will do any arrangements for you. Locality is in the old town and in walking distances of where ever.

Reviews.Title: “Service makes this four star feel like a five star plus!”
Reviews.Author: hermosabeachlady
Reviews.Content: I was here on a trip with my parents. They had a room directly above me with a view of the Bosporus. The rooms are spacious and elegantly decorated. The staff was fantastic. We were greeted by Arthur, who come to find out lived in Santa Monica, CA for three years. He took the time to sit down with us and make sure we were seeing all the important historic sites. I had never had someone take such time and care to make sure our visit was valuable. In addition, I inundated them with email requests and they were always prompt and courteous. There was nothing they would not do to make your stay enjoyable. Location was fantastic for what I wanted. You are literally a 5 minute walk straight up the street to the Blue Mosque. If you want to be in the heart of the old city, it's another 5 minutes. It is on a busy street, but the double pane windows kept it quiet. Personal tip - Learn the tram service. Traffic is a nightmare so even taking a cab won't help.

Reviews.Title: “Jewerly in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: BPBSMS
Reviews.Content: All I can say is that this hotel is simply EXCELLENT. We've been to all different chains of five star hotels and we can say that Amira does not ask favors to anyone. I would give them 5 stars on the spot! Absolutely clean rooms every day, spacious rooms, EXCELLENT service, friendly and efficient staff and excellent location. Highlights were that (1) the check in is accompanied by a comprehensive explanation of the area and its surroundings, recommendations as to what to do, when and where (like a travel agency, only at no cost), restaurants and shows recommendations (they recommended Kurosami..a MUST). (2) complimentary tee from 5-7PM (3) that they found out it was our daughter's first birthday while we were in Istanbul and organized cake and a little party for her...I don't see that happening in the Marriots, Intercontinatals and movenpicks of the world. THANK YOU AMIRA for a wonderful experience!!! I should also add that when we arrived, it was after a long journey and so they made our room available immediately so our baby could rest, and sent us breakfast to the room (even though it was past breakfast time) so that we can rest and start the check in "Istanbul introduction" only once we had rested and had a bite. Oh, I almost forget to say that the location is EXCELLENT. You are walking distance from the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, etc etc etc Did I mention that we got free wi-fi? we had to pa for it at all other hotels we went.... And the list can go on an on....

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice for a romantic city break stay”
Reviews.Author: Fernihough
Reviews.Content: We booked a romance package at Hotel Amira, which was only 20 euros more than the standard room rate. For this we were met and dropped off at the airport, had a welcome drink on arrival at the hotel, rose petals on the bed and had a bottle of wine and strawberry chocolate fondue in our room. If we had had time, we could have booked some time in the wellness centre (Jacuzzi and gym) free of charge as well. If you want objective advice on where to eat or what to see and someone to book it all for you, the staff at the hotel are BRILLIANT. For example, when negotiating the tram system, the staff gave us tokens to make this really easy and added the charge to our bill. Their restaurant recommendations were spot on for each of the three nights we stayed. For a romantic city break you just want life to be fun and easy, a stay at the Hotel Amira will guarantee that.

Reviews.Title: “A superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marypatricia67
Reviews.Content: A superb hotel. Very well located in the old city, 10 minutes walk from the main attractions. The rooms were luxurious, really beautiful and extremely comfortable. Breakfast was a feast, with the buffet table laden with fruit, meat, cheese, yoghourt, cereal, jam, honey, hot dishes - and 13 different types of bread/ cake! Moreover all the hotel staff were friendly, courteous and helpful - they made us feel special. The best rooms were those with a balcony - we sat in the sunshine and enjoyed views of the sea and the blue mosque. We gave this hotel top marks and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel And Staff”
Reviews.Author: SHStirchley
Reviews.Content: All the other reviews say it all really. Special mention for the great breakfast buffet and also thanks to Kartal for being a great help getting us tickets for the Besiktas match!

Reviews.Title: “The Amira Hotel GREATLY Deserves its # 1 Trip Advisor Rating!”
Reviews.Author: Bruce4730
Reviews.Content: Everything the Amira does is pure quality. The guest experience is as good as it gets and they treat you warmly, friendly, and try to accommodate your every request. The location is within walking distance to the highlights of the old city (Hippodrome, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and Grand Bazar). The rooms are comfortable to spacious, comfortable beds, great showers, and powerful wi-fi. The morning breakfasts are tasty consisting of eggs, sausage, potatoes, fruits, yogurts, vegetables, pastries, breads, cold cuts, cheeses, juice, coffee and tea. The roof terrace is a delightful respite and offers a great view of the city and the Bosphorus. The real strength of the Amira is its wonderful staff.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in a convenient setting”
Reviews.Author: Roundthewrekin
Reviews.Content: Attention to detail and quality of service were what we experienced at this hotel. On arrival we were given refreshments and a really useful briefing on sights and activities to match our length of stay. Restaurant recommendations were reliable and gave our holiday a good start. Breakfasts were very good and leisurely. The provision of late afternoon tea and cake was an unexpected but welcome service after a day spent sightseeing. The Hotel is in a very good position for the major sights. Staff are first rate.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and friendly”
Reviews.Author: kayapetai
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this boutique hotel in Sultanahmet with our 1 year old for one week and we were totally pleased with it. Everyone is praising the amazing staff with good reason, they are all very helpful and friendly, from the reception desk to the breakfast room. Nathalie would play with our baby every morning over breakfast and the guys at the reception always made clever suggestions for places to go (even in rainy weather, tricky with a baby!) or good restaurants. The whole staff is always polite and attentive, we really liked that. The hotel itself has a charming and relaxed atmosphere, good taste in decor (our baby loved the cartoons in the lift) and comfy rooms, if somewhat smallish-well, it's a boutique hotel. The location, next to KuÃ§uk Ayasofia Mosque and a 5 minute walk to Sultanahmet is perfect for sightseeing. Some guests seem to find fault with the breakfast; I only have one suggestion: a espresso machine would enhance it. For those like me who don't like American coffee, kicking off the day with a cup of good strong coffee would be a plus. The assortment of food is perfect, though: you have bread, cakes, jams, honey, cheese, olives, eggs, and great Turkish yogourt (the best!) plus fresh fruit. You can't possibly eat anything else... Great place to stay in this wonderful city!

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous hotel for the beginning of our great tour”
Reviews.Author: arie1946
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent from the first step in. The location is ideal, which gives you a chance to reach all city attractions. The Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia and the Grand palace were all close to hotel, and the dining opportunities, especially for Turkish food is varied.What I can criticize for this hotel is TV channels, which are not enough, especially if you are looking for an Italian channel. The rooms are lovely, ideal size, well appointed. I can only recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible staff”
Reviews.Author: ADO42
Reviews.Content: Three families, 6 days in Istanbul. This hotel has far exceed our expectations. Perfect location, centrally situated but in a peaceful area, extremely helpful staff (Ferhat, Arthur and the rest of the team...thank you so much), excellent price/quality relationship. We strongly recommend Amira when visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice, highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: PaoloT_10
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, I was happy with my choice due to Tripadvisorâ€™s evaluations: Excellent location within walking distance to the main attractions (Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia and Topkapi) and the restaurants area in Cemberlitas. Very warm and courteous service at the reception, people always willing to help. When I booked they confirmed by email, were helpful with recommendations, and organized Airport pickup. When I checked in they offered a beverage and helped us with maps and touristic indications at the restaurant. They also sent an email after we checked out thanking us for the preference. Nice touch! The only negative experience we had happened when they called a cabdriver that conned us. Not exactly a hotel fault, as tricky cabs seem to be an Istanbul institution. After that, they always came outside to talk to the driver and make sure we were to be driven to the right place with the right fare. Room and bathroom were very good, clean, and the only negative point was the poor choice of TV channels. Complimentary WiFi connection was nice. Very good breakfast. Excellent price / performance.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Martonds
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, and excellent location. All the major sights are in walking distance, or anything else is easily accessible on the light rail. Only criticism is that the fitness centre is rather poor.Â

Reviews.Title: “Our first trip to Istanbul made memorable”
Reviews.Author: ilovetravel026
Reviews.Content: Our stay was a fantastic experience, made enjoyable by the excellent facilities at the Hotel but even more so by the wonderful staff. They were caring, knowledgeable, always smiling and approachable. Our first greeting at Reception and introduction to the Hotel was memorable - offered a drink, given a map with all the highlights to visit and arranged for a sandwich lunch - even before we got to our room. The recommendations for where to see and eat were execllent as was the transport to the Airport.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Pauline186338
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, whereupon arrival we were taken to the restaurant for tea and cake to go through the tourist hi-lights in Istanbul. The staff were very helpful and very friendly. Luxury beds in the room. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A well-deserved first”
Reviews.Author: JacquelineMT
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 5 nights at the Amira Hotel in Istanbul, selecting the hotel from the excellent reviews it received on-line. Having started somewhat suspicious of such excellent ratings, I have to now admit that my skepticism was misplaced and that the Amira Hotel deserves top spot in the Istanbul hotel rankings. The hotel is very comfortable with modern decor, tastefully implemented. Fixtures and fittings all worked and there was comendable attention to detail in the provision of tea/coffee making facilities and the various sundries provided in each hotel room. Wi-fi was excellent, as was the breakfast each morning. All of this we have encountered in other hotels but the significant difference with the Amira was the quality of the hotel staff who were unfailingly helpful and polite, giving intelligent and considered responses to any and all of our queries. This they did without appearing overly anxious to please or obsequious. We would certainly stay at the Amira again should we be fortunate enough to revisit Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great for old town sights”
Reviews.Author: TheMeltons80
Reviews.Content: We went for the luxury package which included 3 nights in the amira suite, private bosporus boat tour and private days guided tour. No brain power involved, they arranged everything and even suggested excellent restaurants for the evening. The hotel is clean and the staff are very friendly and helpful. We would book the same package again taking in sights outside of the old city. Overall it is an excellent base to explore the old city sights including the blue mosque and aghia sophia.

Reviews.Title: “The best Location and service in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Firas146
Reviews.Content: Very helpful and friendly staff and and exceptional service , the location is an advantage for this hotel . Its highly recommended for Leisure travelers.

Reviews.Title: “A real Turkish Delight”
Reviews.Author: SamanthaC
Reviews.Content: Can only agree with all the positive things said about this hotel. We were met by Emre on arrival and invited for drinks. He gave us a map of the hotel and directions on how to get to the major tourists attractions, tours etc. He even gave us his personal contact number in case we got lost and needed directions. The room was lovely - exactly as it looks in the hotel photos. A whirlpool bath, great shower, tea making facilities, ipod dock, internet, great room service etc made our stay very comfortable. But the best part of the hotel has to be the staff. Helpful, friendly, well informed - nothing is too much trouble. Thank you everyone at Hotel Amira for making our trip to your lovely city so welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: pauldodgson
Reviews.Content: We wanted a comfortable reasonably priced hotel within easy walking distance of the main attractions of Istanbul. Hotel Amira was all this and a lot more.Their standard of service was excellent throughout as were their facilities.When we arrived we were taken to the bar where we were given a brief introduction to the city and given advice as to where to eat ,what time to go to the various places of interest and what trips were available etc. This standard of service from all the staff continued throughout our stay . The rooms were well furnished and very comfortable. There were showers rather than baths in our rooms but it maybe that other rooms have baths.The beds were very comfortable and all facilites were excellent down to the towelling dressing gowns provided. Breakfast was to a high standard. The hotel has a roof top terrace with great views over the Bosporus and is well equipped with sofas and sun-loungers. We all thought the Hotel was great value for money and would have no hesitation in recommending it. We would prefer to stay there than many 4 or 5 star hotels we have stayed in as it has more character and the staff are far more attentive than those usually found in large Hotels.

Reviews.Title: “There's A Reason This Is #1”
Reviews.Author: LagosLady
Reviews.Content: Oh-My-Gosh, after so many wonderful reviews what's left to say??? This was a trip of a life-time for us and its success in large part due to this lovely Hotel and its WONDERFUL Staff. Every morning (and most afternoons) we had the nicest conversations with Natali (Natalie) Dane who was amazingly informative and helpful with information about the area and Turkey at large. Hotel Amira, you have an incredible gem in this young woman! I truly hope you realize that! The entire hotel staff were extremely pleasant, friendly, and helpful. Their rooms were beautiful and the hotel is located in an enchanting area. This is the perfect location for a lot of the major tourist stops in Istanbul. Charming, Clean, and Lovely people in this country. We were overwhelmed by the kindness! We stayed at this hotel for 10 wonderful days, and still didn't see everything! The shop owner directly across the street from Hotel Amira, became our friend before our trip was over (Mehmet Aktas at the Little St. Sophia Style Home). He's a quirky little fella, but he'll do anything for you once he's won you over. He even took us to the local DHL office and helped us pack up and ship a number of items back to the states. EVERYTHING arrived in California (door-to-door) in great shape AND the best part is that DHL didn't cost an arm and a leg!!! We have traveled to a lot of destinations in our life, but I have to say that this trip to Istanbul rates right up there with the top 2! Hotel Amira, thank you from the bottom of my heart for providing us with such a fabulous experience! And to all you travelers out there, if you stay here don't forget to go up on their top floor deck! Wow-oh-wow, what a view! We look forward to one day coming back to this lovely destination and this beautiful hotel. Enjoy your stay!!! Regards, Collenette Vervloet (Expat currently living in Lagos, Nigeria)

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay, once our issues were resolved”
Reviews.Author: LearningItalian
Reviews.Content: We had a several night stay at Hotel Amira, and overall we had a good experience. The staff were attentive, the rooms attractive, breakfast was nice, and the beds comfortable. Potential guests should be aware of one drawback with the deluxe rooms. We had organized our trip to have deluxe rooms at Amira because of the reviews on TripAdvisor and because the rooms were significantly larger than rooms in other hotels in Istanbul. However, the rooms we were shown, while large, were in the basement and one of them smelled distinctly musty. The other room had only very small, high windows, so it had very little natural light, and also smelled faintly of basement must. After some discussion with the staff, we eventually switched to smaller standard rooms on a higher floor (one the first night, and the other the second), and that was much better. I do find it disappointing that these basement rooms were being sold on the basis of their space without mention of the drawbacks. It was nice that they have an ATM in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Service, every need catered for!”
Reviews.Author: smedley26
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Amira for 3 days recently with my husband and a friend. The hotel is in the old part of Istanbul and the mains sights are on the doorstep. I had arranged from the hotel a private transfer from the airport to the hotel for â‚¬30 (hghly recommended as Istanbul Airport is very busy and chaotic). The check in at the hotel was painless, we were offered a free drink and while we were unwinding a member of staff gave us an map,tips and recommdations. The public areas and the rooms are spotless clean and the fittings are of a high standard for a very reasonable price. Our friend had a double room to herself the same as our room, in some hotels the single rooms tend to be not as nice as the doubles. They have a free wifi service and use of a Apple mac computer. There is a lovely roof terrace which will be great in the summer. My only small negative point is the hotel is situated on a very busy intersection and despite the double glazing the traffic noise is noisy and would bother people who are light sleepers. So some good earplugs are required. Will definitely stay at the Amira when I visit Istanbul next time.

Reviews.Title: “You wont regret your stay in this Hotel for their Cleanliness & Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: tharak02
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were made very welome and given all information of the hotel + tourist information aswell. Rooms were very clean and their hospitable service was of 5* standard. I can recommend anybody this hotel if they are visiting Istanbul. It is located very near to all the tourist attractions and are walkable distance from the hotel. If we go again to Istanbul we sure shall go back to this hotel. Thanks to all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “It is as good as they all say!”
Reviews.Author: roland martin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is as good as all the previous reviewers say! It has only been open for one year and proves it is possible to create a great hotel. The staff are VERY friendly, VERY attentive and provide a very high level of service in an appropriate manner. When ordering something for the room I only just had time to put the phone down before it arrived. The beds are really comfortable - I had some of my best hotel sleeps ever. On arrival the staff give you a rundown of things to do, places to go and restaurant recommendations. We went to four recommended restaurants, all quite different and all good. Worth staying at the Amira for this aspect alone. Like others, I thought previous recommendations were too good to be true. They are not!! Do not stay anywhere else unless you like large impersonal hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: Willtravel18
Reviews.Content: What really made this hotel were the fantastic staff, who made everything so easy for us during our stay. In particular Artur was extremely welcoming and knowledgable. The room was abright, spacious and clean, with a good bathroom too. Breakfast was fine, but not great. Also we were unfortunately located next to some building work which was quite noisy and may have been the cause of the sewer-like smell in the room on occasion. Other than this I would definitely recommend this hotel, particularly because of it's excellent location for the old part of the town.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - enough to prompt me to write a 1st review on tripadvisor”
Reviews.Author: LondonJandL
Reviews.Content: I was a bit skeptical after reading such glowing reviews about this hotel - seemed almost too good to be true. And, why I asked, would anyone be bothered to spend time voluntarily writing a review about a hotel, it can't be that good? Surely? Having stayed there I now realise why. It was my girlfriend's birthday on the second day of our stay and I mentioned this to a reception staff. The hotel then went out of their way to make it a special day for her. I have to admit I was astounded by this, and also the overall desire of the staff to make our stay enjoyable. So, it's prompted me to write a review on tripadivsor, which I said I'd never do. Damn you hotel Amira! Or other words, thanks very very much for a lovely stay...

Reviews.Title: “You won't do any better than this at any price.”
Reviews.Author: JeanandKeith_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed five nights and grew increasingly impressed with the Amira. The hotel is visually lovely, the location ideal if you like a ten-minute walk to the major sites, and the breakfast well beyond expectations. The staff is incredibly accommodating and displays the ideal balance of friendly/professional service. The rooftop terrace, which offers views of the Bosphorous and Blue Mosque, is a delightful spot for a beverage. You will not be disappointed; this place is a gem and oasis of calm in a very busy city.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous & romantic”
Reviews.Author: NushyC
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a wonderful 5 days in the beautiful city staying at The Amira. From using the website, booking via email, to the smooth transfer, warm welcome, welcome drink & brief, room upgrade, gorgeous room and yummy food, it was fantastic. It's within walking distant of fab places to eat, shop & of course visit the sites. A hotel which is clean, smells delicious as you enter & makes you want to stat for more. A special thank you to Ferhat & we'll definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect - highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Ennifar
Reviews.Content: Was there in december for several days with a friend and this charming hotel definitely contributed to making our stay in Istanbul more enjoyable! The breakfast is great, even for healthy-conscious individuals, the staff are always very attentive and trying to solve every issue that may occur, the rooms are lovely, the location is great and the spa was a relief as when we were there, it was so cold outside so coming "home" to a sauna and jacuzzi was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service great location will be back”
Reviews.Author: carefulkate
Reviews.Content: Just spent a week at this hotel and it was superb the staff are all so nice and customer service is excellent It felt more like staying with friends than staying at a hotel the location was perfect for us as we walked most places If we return to istanbul we will return to the Amira Thanks for all you care and attention

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel close to all tourist sites”
Reviews.Author: DeniseLock
Reviews.Content: Friendly welcome very helpful. Room 505 was lovely. Jacuzzi charged for by the hour but is there with sauna for private use. Breakfast was terrific and lots of it. Staff are great most speak good English. Tours bit of a disappointment would probably do own tour booking outside of hotel preferred one. Would definitely go back again.location fantastic short walk to all tourist sites. Excellent amenities free WIFI great water pressure in shower.

Reviews.Title: “Magnifique/Magnificent”
Reviews.Author: walid_11
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with the hospitality and the attention given by the staff. The atmosphere is very nice. The interior is very well designed with nice combination of coulors. The Amira suite is beautiful and really confortable, the decoration and the colours show a great harmony. Good choice in the breakfast, might be completed with some turkish local sweets. The SPA is very nice and could be reserved for private use :-). Absolutely recommended. Walid & Abir

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with great stuff”
Reviews.Author: samuilo
Reviews.Content: It is not city center location but the hotel and stuff is number 1 !!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - but consider location”
Reviews.Author: doctorcoolpop
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Amira for ten days and they are wonderful, a superb facility and highly professional and helpful staff. Highly recommended. However, ten days may be too long in this location. The Sultanahmet neighborhood is purely a tourist area, near the Blue Mosque, and filled night and day with noisey buses. For a ten day visit, it would be better to stay a bit north in the Galata area which is more the real Istanbul, where local people live and work. Amira is perfect for a shorter stay.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT MODERN ROOMS,SERVICE AND FRIENDLY STAFF IN FANTASTIC LOCATION, GREAT VALUE FOR MONEY”
Reviews.Author: ardi_davinci
Reviews.Content: My wife and i travel regulary and we usually stay in 5 star hotels round the world. we decided to stay in Amira hotel after we read the reviews from the Trip advisory.We were very impressed when we arrived and greeted by thedeputy manager with a complimentory drink . Very helpfull and polite.,very frindly staff members and high standard rooms which was beautifully decorated and kept veryclean. Location is fantastic,walking distance to the monuments and the great bazar.Breakfast is very good and to be honest it is great value for money.We recommend this hotel very highly.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location with excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: subou5
Reviews.Content: Just had to share my wonderful experience at the Hotel Amira in Istanbul. Not only is the hotel a very tastefully decorated boutique hotel with a fantastic location for visiting many of the historic sites in the Sultanhamet district of Istanbul but the staff are fabulous too. On arrival, a charming member staff sat with us for over 20 minutes to explain the layout of the city and the easiest way to get to all the major sites. They answered all our questions in perfect english. We were offered free drinks and snacks - they lent us umbrellas when it rained, helped us arrange taxis and supplied tokens for the tramway. They were always cheerful and friendly, they made us feel very much at home. An excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely boutique hotel, friendly staff in an excellent tourist area”
Reviews.Author: bellaflood
Reviews.Content: The staff in this hotel were so friendly and helpful, and we were looked after very well. The facilities were good, the restaurant was very comfortable and the food very good. We were able to visit all the interesting sights in this part of the city easily and it felt safe and hospitable as an area. Charming rooms, though sometimes there was noise in the street below. The staff were the greatest asset to this lovely hotel which we would recommend highly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and great staff”
Reviews.Author: jporter1221
Reviews.Content: This is a boutique hotel five minutes from the Blue Mosque. The staff is excellent and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: RobinWebb
Reviews.Content: The staff was amazing, and it is located within walking distance to the Hagia Sohia, Blue Mosque and Arasta Bazaar among other great sites.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the Best!”
Reviews.Author: mcg212
Reviews.Content: Surreal Location. Beautiful Rooms. Great Food. However, what makes this Hotel better than any hotel I have ever stayed at is the personal attention that they pay to each guest. When you check in they orientate you on where you are, how to get around, what to do, and so much more. This continual extra effort makes the experience surpass all expectations. If there was a Hotel Amira in every major city, the people in it would be much more traveled.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: SpirosK81
Reviews.Content: First of, the hotel staff was amazing. They even had a person talking Greek (which was a very welcome surprise). Room was spacious and kept clean and the location was great, just a small walk away from the Hippodrome, Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia. The only downside was that my room faced the backyard and there was much noise from air condition units. Also there was a locked door between my room and the next one, also not offering proper noise insulation! But, it was not so annoying as to make me stay awake. I just shudder to think what would happen if more rowdy persons stayed next door...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastically friendly & beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: willeman
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was absolutely brilliant. We enjoyed our welcome drinks whilst having an extremely informative chat with 'Ozzie' about things to do during our stay in Istanbul. Our room was gorgeously luxurious, spacious and had everything we needed. Breakfast was lovely - lots of variety. Hotel staff were attentive and friendly and were only too happy to go out of their way to help us book trips/tours and restaurants. (An excellent food recommendation was Khorasani).

Reviews.Title: “Quite possibly the best hotel experience I have ever had!”
Reviews.Author: M0mentum
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many hotels all over the world and without hesitation I can say that our stay at Amira was the best hotel experience I have ever had. This is a wonderful boutique hotel. The rooms are gorgeous, VERY clean and very comfortable. As previously mentioned, the staff are exceptional and provide outstanding personalised service. A special note goes to Arthur, who was very attentive, and gave us a wonderful introduction to Istanbul as we sipped complimentary tea/coffee and ate some delicious muffins. The server in the bar is also very friendly and helpful (sorry I can't remember his name!). This hotel certainly added to our fantastic stay in Istanbul. The staff actually seem to be genuinely happy and enjoy being at work! If we are ever lucky enough to return to Istanbul, we will return to Amira for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the best hotel I've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Boraxwoman
Reviews.Content: Where to start? We treated ourselves to a deluxe room, and got 501, on the ground floor. We were more than happy with the room. It, like the rest of the hotel, was spotless. We'd requested a double bed - and got a room with two double beds! We'd requested a whirlpool bath, and got a whirlpool bath with overhead rain shower and excellent normal shower! There was plenty of space in the room and in the bathroom; we had nice, plentiful toiletries and lots of white, fluffy towels; the flatscreen TV had channels in various languages, including English Al Jazeera; there was a lovely red sofa plus two other chairs and a coffee table for relaxing; there was plenty of storage space, including a very large room safe, although I would have preferred a few more coat hangers; there were tea and coffe making facilities and enough drinking glasses; there was free wifi; the room looked smart and comfortable; it was alovely place to relax after a hard day's sightseeing. Breakfasts were superb, especially, from my point of view, the yoghurt, hazlenuts and fruit salads, and the tahina. They were only slightly marred by not providing inclusive fruit juices, just some kind of sweetened squash. Although breakfast theoretically finished at 10.30, there was no problem or rushing of people who arrived late. The computer in the breakfast room, and the well-chosen collection of books, were very helpful. The fitness centre (gym) is tiny - two treadmills, a cycling machine and some free weights - but clean, equipped with towels, and adequate for a quick workout. We didn't use the spa area, as we tried the historic hamams. (There is one three minutes' walk away from the Amira.) The location is good, with a taxi rank and small shops outside, and a choice of restaurants nearby. Best of all though, were the staff - so friendly, so helpful, so courteous, knowing always exactly how to treat you well. On arrival, we were given a personal introduction to Istanbul. Unfortunately we forgot to try the free afternoon tea - but we hope this means we must return soon, and make good this omission! I recommend this hotel thoroughly.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel with impeccable service!”
Reviews.Author: d_nassimpian
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in many different hotels all over the world, I was most pleasantly surprised by the little gem that is Amira hotel - from the moment we booked, until we said our last goodbyes to the truly excellent team at reception. Amira offers outstanding value for money, as its location, amenities and service exceed by far any expectations one may have at this price range: its location is right in the heart of the old city and within walking distance from, well, EVERYWHERE you'd want to see, and yet it is quiet. The rooms are beautifully decorated with inspiring attention to detail - from the bath robe, to the slippers, to the luscious little thyme soaps and rose water shower gel, not to mention the fabulous rain shower! Equally great are the communal areas of the hotel, that are also kept spotlessly (and seemingly effortlessly) clean and tidy, while the breakfast was truly special. The best part of our stay, however, was owed to the remarkably polite and helpful reception staff - and especially Emre and Natalie who made themselves available from the moment we arrived for anything we might need, including a very helpful and thorough welcoming talk that included a great map on which Emre noted everything we really needed and wanted to know, including key sights, how to get there, taxi fare estimations, tram routes, recommended restaurants, etc. I would highly recommend the Amira for a long or short stay in the city and would definitely want to go back, as it genuinely represents what high quality service should be like. Well done guys!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel! easy walk to Blue Mosque and tram”
Reviews.Author: aitcharsee
Reviews.Content: I really loved the Amira, the staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms are nicely decorated with jacuzzi tubs and great showers and tea kettles in the room - all nice additions for international travelers. The location was really good. I stayed at another hotel closer to the center but this was an easy walk and the neighborhood had some nice coffee shops and cafes. overall the experience was excellent. the room windows were well insulated and I slept like a baby.

Reviews.Title: “Wondefull time in the city of thousand & one nights!!!”
Reviews.Author: CaptCaverne
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend & me spent 3 nights in the Amira Hotel. Everything was perfect from our arrival until our departure. I'm a worldwide traveller for business and to be honest I never met a staff like this. This is incredible how they are friendly, helpfull, etc... You're really feel yourself at home far away from home. The room (403) was really well furnished, large and with a nice overview on the sea of Marmara and the old city of Istanbul. You're located only 5 min by foot from the Blue Mosque. This is the place where you need to stay in Istanbul if you still want to dream of the thousand & one nights...

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly”
Reviews.Author: MarkDodgson
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel, with a great location and very helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonScotgirl
Reviews.Content: I use Trip Advisor regularly but have never written a review. Having stayed at this hotel I felt that I had to. It is simply the best hotel I have ever stayed in, in terms of service, comfort and location. Situated just behind the Blue mosque the location couldn't be better. I've never been anywhere where I've felt so valued - nothing is too much trouble from a complimentary upgrade to numerous travel advice. I recommend sunset drinks on the rooftop and using the spa facilities. You'd be crazy not to stay here on a visit to Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable experience re service and accommodation”
Reviews.Author: ligilu
Reviews.Content: We had quite high expectations after all the reviews we read but what we found on arrival exceeded even our expectations. Such a warm and informative welcome, we fell in love with the place immediately. Our room was beautifully decorated, generously sized with a nice little balcony. It was kept immacuately clean throughout our stay of 5 days and they catered to our every need. Everthing was done with a big smile, a professional attitude and without delay. I would particulary like to mention the service provided by Emre and Arthur who went out of their way to assist and help. When we left, it felt a bit like leaving a family member behind. Breakfast was very enjoyable with a lot of variety. Another positive aspect of the Amira is its location. Easy walking distance to the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, the Cisterns and the Topkapi Palace as well as to the Grand Bazar. We highly recommand the Amira to everybody. Not only is it a very beautiful place but it is the service you receive there that sets it apart from all other hotels we know and makes your stay such an memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to the hype”
Reviews.Author: tpdv21
Reviews.Content: I chose the Amira on the basis of the Tripadvisor reviews. It is good to know that this system works. The staff are friendly and helpful, and speak excellent English (not always a given in Istanbul). I was told I got a room upgrade on arrival. Room 305 was spacious, (no bath, but not a problem for me), the wi-fi worked fine, and it had a sea view (though with the excellent roof terrace, you don't need a sea view from the room. I exchanged euros to TL at a decent rate. They helped me with transport routes to business locations. They also had plug converters. The other reviews tell you all the good points, so I will just add a couple of tiny caveats. I booked their 30-euro shuttle form the airport to the hotel. That was excellent. For the return, they were honest enough to tell me that hopping in a cab at the rank right outside would be cheaper - which it would have been, if the driver had not stiffed me when we got to the airport. What was supposed to be 35 TL ride became 50 TL. I assumed that because the porter had called the driver over I would be OK - don't let your guard down like me. Also, all the TV channels are news channels. One movie channel would be nice... Sultanahmet is notorious for poor restaurants. I tried the little place out the door and turn right, with Christmas lights. Pretty poor fare. I also went to Cozy on the main drag - awful. The two room service meals I had in Amira were much better. Otherwise, it is all good.

Reviews.Title: “Definately our home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: KarianneTB
Reviews.Content: We chose Hotel Amira for a long weekend based on the reviews here on Tripadvisor and we were not disappointed. From the very first minute we felt so welcome, and everything was wonderful. It is not extreme luxury that makes this place so wonderful, but rather the perfect mix of attentive and wonderful staff, clean and nice rooms and a great location for browsing the Sultanameh area. We were four girl friends travelling together, leaving our families back home, and we seriously considered missing our return flight back home. Also, Arthur - the wonderful front desk manager, made some great reservations at several wonderful restaurants. We spent four days eating, smiling and relaxing in an incredible city. Definately coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Melmooh
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in Hotel Amira and had such a wonderful time. It's in a great location, the staff are all very friendly and helpful. We were even given a detailed briefing on where to eat, what to visit and were given a detailed map. I wish every hotel gave a reception like this! The only negative I experienced were noisy neighbors with their TVs on pretty loud late into the night. The walls are fairly thin, so you hear phones ring, TVs on, talking etc. But this is a small price to pay really. Be careful of taxis!! They like to rip tourists off! Make sure the meter is running and never accept a lift from a young taxi driver - we found them to be the worst. The gorgeous old taxi drivers are great and honest. It's good to get an indication of cost before getting into a cab. It's much easier just to brave the cold and walk. I'd also recommend that you avoid the restaurants under the bridge on the water. They look appealing but the food is awful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, well managed and hospitable”
Reviews.Author: Katzip
Reviews.Content: We were in Turkey for 11 days and stayed in 5 different hotels in various parts of Turkey. Amira was our last stop and we saved the best for last. We stayed in the family room on the ground floor with our two teenage sons. Rooms were very clean, warm and tastefully furnished. Management and staff of the hotel were friendly and helpful, giving us useful tips on where to go and good resaurants nearby. Their attention to our comfort was awesome - even down to selling us tokens for tram rides to save us the trouble of buying outside.

Reviews.Title: “an absolute gem”
Reviews.Author: foxdown88
Reviews.Content: All the superlative reviews are spot on ; great location in the old town, lovely comfortable room with view from balcony of Bosphoros and sun sets, superb service from the happy smiling staff and great breakfast buffet and room service menu. And they have in room tea/coffee making. There is free internet access using a computer in the lounge. Thoroughly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “They really take care of you in Amira”
Reviews.Author: svetcoal
Reviews.Content: It's a lovely realtively small family owned hotel, great location, very safe neighborhood, 10 min walk from the Blue Mosque and 15 min from St. Sophia. Everything in this hotel is really thought through, everything looks new, stylish and very good quality. There are reading lights above your bed and Ipod playstation on the night table, there is a complementary bottle of water in your room every day and a tea/coffee tray with a tea kettele and supplies also refilled daily. The breakfast/cafe area also serves as a cosy livingroom, with a Mac computer, TV, fireplace, books about Turkey, guidebooks, just things to read - also a nice surprise. There is free Wi Fi all over the hotel. There is also complementary tea and cakes served there at 5 pm. The terrace on the roof has nice views, but it was too cold when we were there, must be lovely in the spring or summer...We haven't tried their fitness area, so can't comment on that. The stuff is really helpful and friendly. As soon as we arrived Natali, one of the stuff members, provided us not just with a city map, but also with a detailed orientation in the city, explained to us everything we wanted to know, about transport, sights, weather, excursions, booked us a Bosphorus boat tour (a must), we were really happy with everything she recommended and with the way she took care of us every day, asked if we needed anything, checked schedule of events for us, we always knew we had someone to ask if we needed something... The people at the reception are also really friendly, always smiling and helpful. You can change money and buy transport tokens from them too. Basically this is a hotel where someone actually thought of what a traveler may need in Istanbul and provided it all.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, real gem”
Reviews.Author: DJ1972
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, boutique style, small and personal with great service. In stayed there for 3 nights, we had a large room with two double beds and big bathroom. Room was clean, nicely decorated and very comfortable. Rate included a lovely breakfast buffet, everything was fresh and hand made. In the afternoon, you can pop in for a complimentary tea or coffee and cake, homemade cake, always a winner! In fact on our last day before going to the airport, we did some work in the cafe area and they served us cappuccinos, cake and the Turkish coffee all on the house... Really nice touch! Location is great, very close to the Blue Mosque, Ayasofya and other attractions. On the roof there is a nice terrace with lovely views across Istanbul, would be lovely in Spring and Summer. Neighbourhood is really nice, lots of restaurants and cute shops in the surrounding area. Overall this is a lovely hotel, would recommend and will definitely return...

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: BLUE5KY
Reviews.Content: I read glowing reviews of Amira before deciding to stay and the reviews are pretty accurate. Excellent location but a few minutes walk to the tram. Hotel decor is funky, modern and the free wifi is greatly appreciated. The staff is a delight and other reviews are not exagerated. They are truly warm and friendly. Highly recommended and I have stayed in a whole range of hotels around the world from the finest 5 star hotels, beautiful boutique hotels to scary hotels in India. Go enjoy Amira and the richness of the culture and history of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: travelfromportugal
Reviews.Content: Very well located hotel, at walking distance from Topkapi and surroundings. Very friendly and helpful staff. Rooms are large and well decorated. Sound proof from street noise is quite good.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service&decor with a great location”
Reviews.Author: skarim02
Reviews.Content: I've enjoyed my stay at Hotel Amira. The service was superb with a fantastic staff[everyone is smiling and always courteous]. The location is great, a very short distance to the blue mosque, hagia sophia, and Topkapi Palace. It is located at sultanahmet which has incredible restaurants(e.g. khorasani, sarnic(authentic ottoman)) and you can even walk to the grand bazaar and about 3 or 4 short tram stops to the spice market at eminonu. also, the hotel has excellent spa&message service. Once you book it, you get a relaxed message with sauna&jacuzzi reserved for you....We've particularly enjoyed this service especially after walking all day around the town and exploring different parts of istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “What a trip !”
Reviews.Author: traveler530070
Reviews.Content: Our stay our the Hotel Amira, Istanbul was without words, one of the best trips ever. It had to do with the Hotel staff and hospitality. The location is great (walking diatance to most points of interest) and the taxi station is jsut across the street if you need a taxi. The hotel is a great Boutique Hotel with only stories and a roof top terrace. But the staff makes this place "the" place to stay. The rooms area very nice and comfortable and large comparing European hotels. The buffet breakfast lets you start your day off in style. We had the staff make out boat cruise and turkish bath reservations. They were very helpful in suggesting all types of acitivites and points of interest to see. We highly recommend this hotel to all of our friends and other individuals wanting a nice and reasonable place to stay. They get a "thumbs up" in my book. Sincerely, Vicki and Larry Galbreath Harlingen, Texas Via Abu Dhabi, UAE

Reviews.Title: “the best hotel in the world”
Reviews.Author: Islam14
Reviews.Content: the hotel is fantastic i had never imagined that something like that really exists the staff are very kind and friendly they smile at you all time and help you with everything you need 24 hours the provide you with all the important information about the city and the best places to visit they start to accompany you since you make the reservation, welcome you, provide you with information you need and answer all your questions and doubts the breakfast is awsome and very well served the hotel is extremely clean and always perfumed the rooms are spacious, comfortable, elegant, luxurious, happy and calm colours. its 5 minutes from the blue mosque aya sofia , basilica, islamic art musuem, topkapi palace, also from the tram station from where you can go to taksim and istiklal avenue this hotel really made my vacation the best vacation i have ever had i highly recommend this hotel , if you need to garantee and enjoy your vacation

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly good”
Reviews.Author: benhatoronto
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is amazingly good. We went there with our 10 month old son. Everything about this hotel is good!! But most of all, the people who work in the hotel are tooo nice. They make you feel guilty because they give you whatever you ask and go the extra mile to make you happy. I beg you not to demand something you don't deserve though. It's not fair. They treat our son like a king. They loved him so much. They treated us like a family and not like guests. Thank you so much!!! We already miss all of you and hope to visit you soon.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Sara_Artist
Reviews.Content: Best location, excellent service, great rooms, totally worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel, Amazing Staff, Amazing Manager!”
Reviews.Author: sylvia2006
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Amira for business purposes, but will return again - for a holiday - same location! Firstly, I'd like to say, staying at Hotel Amira was like staying at a friends/relatives house, the manager and staff were warm, helpful and friendly. Nothing was too much trouble and went that extra mile to make sure your stay was comfortable. The hotel itself was spacious, clean and comfortable, even my mother would have approved! Free wifi through the hotel. Breakfast in the mornings was also fantastic. Hotel Amira has easy access to the Sultahnamets historical sights blue mosque - 200m, museums, bars, restaurants and the most amazing bazzar in the world, I think my wife on the next trip may need a week to sift through this underground treasure of delights! All in all a great hotel run smoothly with the guidance of a fantastic manager who ensures the comfort of his guests. Chris O'Grady POWER FLEX CABLES.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for exploring the touristy old district of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: GeraldSingapore
Reviews.Content: The good thing: location; the bad thing: location. Conveniently located behind the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia, this hotel is perfect for the traveler who seeks to explore the Sultanahmet area of Istanbul where bulk of the tourist sites are. I stayed there for 3 nights from Dec 31 till Jan 3 and everyday, walking past the Blue Mosque was an amazing experience; the grandeur and beauty of Istanbul really strikes me. The nearest tram station is also nearby Blue Mosque (Sultanahmet) and if you want to visit the Grand Bazaar, Spice Market or Tokapi, this hotel is perfect as the base for you. However, I realized that most of the restaurants near this hotel are mostly tourist centric and after speaking to a few locals, most of them told me that the old district is indeed catered mostly to tourists and if one wants to dine more like a local, the Beyolgu district is a better fit. That said, I had to make my way to the Beyolgu district by tram every night I was there as I simply refuse to be part of the whole tourist trap dining circuit in Sultanahmet. The hotel itself is very comfy and the beds provided a soulful sleep for me. However, if you, like me, got a room that has a door to connect to the next room, then be prepared to hear some of the noises from your neighbor. For the price of $130 a night that I paid through expedia, I find this to be a great hotel for the first time visitor to the amazing city. The staff are helpful and accommodating; what impressed me most was that they actually gave me another room as I got into Istanbul at 5am and checked in at 6am, as such, my original room was not ready. They immediately offered another room for me to rest before calling me in the morning to inform me when my room was ready. Ozzie from the front desk was so helpful in explaining the sites and the location and he is a true gem that any guest there should approach! Another plus point is the free wifi in the hotel and rooms! Very fast and reliable connection to plan any last minute itinerary. However, if i ever return to the city again, I'll like to try a hotel in the Beyoglu district near Taksim so that I can zip the streets more like a local and escape the touristy sites since I've seen it before.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible hospitality”
Reviews.Author: petrosg
Reviews.Content: During our travel in Istanbul we stayed at Hotel Amira and we don't have the words to express their hospitality and willingness. When we arrived at the hotel (at 9:00 pm) the room was ready and the staff offered to us breakfast (free of charge) even if we weren't entitled of. The staff led us to the breakfast room and one sits with you and explains where you are, what you must see, where to eat, everything you can think of. Any question you have or any request they have the answer and if they don't they will find it for you (the next morning a couple checked in and a guy from the staff gave them his mobile phone just in case they needed anything). They all speak English of course. Every afternoon they offer at the hotel tea (again free of charge). They have an ATM inside the hotel, but if you want to exchange money they can change it at the concierge. The location of the hotel is perfect. Within walking distance at every touristic site of Sultanahmet (Top Kapi, Aya Sofia, Blue Mosque) and 15-20 minutes walking from Galata Bridge. Rooms are wonderfully decorated, very clean and if i must find a fault is the fact that they are small (we stayed at a double standard room). And finally a detail that might concern travelers from Greece is the fact that at the concierge is working a girl that speaks Greek (Her name is Natali). Ask for her and she will help you with anything you might need. We have stayed at several four stars hotel at the past but their willingness is remarkable. When we return to Istanbul Hotel Amira will be our first choice again.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD HOTEL, BUT BEWARE WITH THE ROOM YOU'LL STAY”
Reviews.Author: PMLC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Amira for 4 nights on january 2011. We stayed at room nÂº 305. It's a corner room, spacious and beautiful, but connected with the room 306 by a door. Because of this, we could hear conversations and noises from the next room, wich was not cool. So, don't stay at this room! Also, the bathroom is small and quite dark. However, the staff is very, very kind! The breakfast is delicious too, and the location is very good: just a few minutes from Aya Sophia, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazar (we knew all these sigthseeings on foot)!

Reviews.Title: “A great little boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: janhough
Reviews.Content: What a great find the Amira was. Modern, light and yet very cosy. Very well located within walking distance from most of the sights. Staff are exceptionally friendly, considerate and helpful. We arrived at 06h30 tired from our overnight flight and the receptionist arranged a room for us where we could rest until the room we have reserved became available later in the morning. The breakfast spread was also very good and different from your average hotel offering. Could recommend this hotel withou\t hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful boutique hotel in the heart of historical penninsula”
Reviews.Author: nurcadisi
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent hotel in terms of service, rooms and location. Interior design is superb, has a very comtemporary but also very historical feel. They provide a great free breakfast. You can walk to Blue Mosque, Sophia Hugia, Topkapi Palace or Basilica Cistern in minutes. They also have a roof top, make sure to go there for the beautiful view. Overall, excellent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “hip, modern & in striking distance of everything that matters!”
Reviews.Author: zanaida
Reviews.Content: Hotel Amira was such a surprise - we had already booked into Tomtom suites in BeyoÄŸlu (which were absolutely fabulous!) but we were arriving in Istanbul one day earlier than planned and decided a night in the old town would allow us to see the sites we had not yet visited. We were blown away by the chic and tasteful decor, the modern interior, the brilliant location (in a quiet street walking distance from the Blue Mosque) & uber helpful staff. I was very sorry not to be staying for longer. All in all, a great inner city boutique-style hotel with outstanding room rates!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, wonderful, wonderful--charming and well-located, with awesome service”
Reviews.Author: NYNYNYNewYork
Reviews.Content: The rooms are charming, the hotel well-located, the public spaces lovely (even though it was winter so we didn't use the roof terrace), the services gracious, such as the lowkey afternoon tea and snacks and the lovely breakfast buffet. What really sets the Amira apart, however, is the extraordinary hospitality and skill of the staff. They are friendly, welcoming, and really will make your stay in Istanbul the best they can, no matter what your needs.! My husband and I have stayed at all kinds of hotels thoughout the world, including five-stars legendary for their service, and the Amira's service shines among them. I'd give it a score of six out of five if I could! We came to the Amira after staying elsewhere, because our flight home was cancelled. We checked out and in again, ordered, rescheduled, and cancelled cars for the airport, and through it all every single person on the Amira staff made us feel welcome and at home, and as though nothing we asked for was anything but a pleasure. The most extraordinary on the team, the concierge Egde, found our luggage in a few minutes with a smile, when it had been delivered to a random address without telling us--this included tracking down the delivery driver, but he made it seem like the easiest thing in the world. Bravo!

Reviews.Title: “One word....Spectacular!”
Reviews.Author: NYCtraveler19
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at this hotel for two days during the end of September 2010. It was fantastic. We arrived early, so our rooms were not ready yet. The hotel staff immediately took our luggage and then allowed us to partake of the buffet breakfast until our rooms were ready, and the food was great. We stayed in the basic (standard) room and it was absolutely beautiful. We all took naps before heading out into the city and none of us wanted to leave the room! The beds were SO COMFORTABLE! You could sleep for hours. The showers were phenomenal. There was a rain shower head and a regular shower head. It was like bathing under a warm waterfall. Although the hotel is small in size, it is large in character and overall presence. Everthing was clean and spacious and the staff was attentive and friendly. We will stay here everytime we go back to Istanbul. The hotel is centrally located for the old city excusrsions and everything is within walking distance. In addition, the hotel provides all the information you need for tours, restaurant recommendations and reservations. We had a whirlwind two days and Hotel Amira was our anchor. The roofdeck was beautiful as well and we took lovely pictures of the blue mosque at night. If you are thinking of traveling to Istanbul, this is the place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay”
Reviews.Author: jjjf2510
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I checked into the Hotel Amira for two nights last week - before we arrived the Sale and Marketing manager sent me an email welcoming us to Hotel Amira and attached a very helpful document with the main Istanbul sites.
