I emailed back and asked for restaurant suggestions and got a great list with links to the websites. The hotel itself is beautiful on the inside, the rooms are new and furnished in a minimal fashion with elegant bathrooms. We had the standard room which was very spacious, the room faced the street and it is a little noisy but stopped pretty much after midnight. The hotel breakfast is great with a ton of choices and the dinner food for room service was great too!! The location is amazing. you can walk anywhere and the staff gives you an overview of how to get places and the best times/days/routes to take. Stay at the hotel amira!! you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service in the heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: SiMa1123
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Amira from the 23rd until the 28th of December 2010,we have booked a deluxe double room. We were delighted by the outstanding and honest friendliness of the staff of the hotel. When we arrived, we received an almost one hour introduction to Istanbul: all the sights, what to do and not to do... The room was large and clean, the bathroom was a small wellness oase in our room - including a whirlpool. The interior is very stylish and comfortable. Since it is a city hotel with no special windows, it has to be mentioned that you hear noise from the street as well as the calls of the muezzin. Hence, we recommend people with a light sleep to take their oropax with them! Breakfast was delicious and we can not say anything bad about it. Although it was the same everyday, we did not get bored by it during our five days stay. Moreover you have the chance to order additional food (e.g. omlette) for some extra-Euros. We also used sauna and jacuzzi - nice place. You can rent it for 1.5 hours for 5â‚¬ per person what is really a bargain worth to invest in. We have stayed in a huge amount of hotels all over the world, but we have never experience a hotel staff this friendly. They really made our stay perfect in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Go there, you won't be disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: CelaviCelavi
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a week in Istanbul and stayed at Amira based on the Tripadvisor reviews. We had a great week and the hotel is perfect for such city trips. The location is great, near Marmara's see and close to the tourist attractions (200m to Blue Mosque). The staff was very helpful, they showed us all the main sites on a map with interesting tips. Room is nicely decorated and room service is efficient. Small examples: - a reading lamp stopped working and without us asking, it was fixed the next day. - we wanted something to eat at 1AM one night, the guy at the reception literally ran outside to check if any of the restaurants around was opened and since not, he prepared a club sandwich for us. They take care of the restaurant bookings, Taxis etc.. very impressive considering the competitive price. The free WIFI was useful and worked perfectly. They also have a computer in the breakfast room that is also free to use.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay thanks to amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: buduku
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed with my wife at Amira Hotel in Istambul. As our first time in the city the location of the hotel is perfect for sightseeing through the main monuments and the central Sultanahmet area (everything in the area was 5-20 minutes away walking), and this boutique hotel couldnÂ´t have been more perfect for us. The hotel stands in two refurbished otoman houses offering a certain level of local flavour but with a full modern offer as it seems that the hotel is brand new. The rooms were modern, comfortable sizeable and perfectly clean, with no noise in the night despite ours pointed to the main street going up to the Blue Mosque, with plenty of traffic at all times. Breakfast was also great, with an ample combination of local tastes and international options. Nevertheless, as it has been highlighted in other reviews what was really outstanding at this hotel was its staff, which literally was on top of everything at all times and was willing to help stright away with every single request we made to them. At arrival all guests are invited to a welcome drink in the hotel's bar (or even breakfast for early arrivals, which wasn't our case though) while a member of the staff provides maps, activities' leaflets and an amazingy good advise on things to do and places to go, which we found extremely helpful throughout our stay. Just one negative point on our stay, which didn't cause any troubles at all. The free wi-fi connection offered in all rooms at times worked quite slowly if it worked at all, but this could be easily solved by using the shared computer in the bar area. All in all, a perfect place to be in the old part of the city fully worth the value, and I would certainly go back if I had the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: JoH1292
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel, incredible staff, so helpful! Would totally stay here again, without a doubt, and would encourage anyone I knew to stay here. Thanks for an amazing stay!

Reviews.Title: “All the excellent reviews here are true”
Reviews.Author: globalskier100
Reviews.Content: I absolutely concur with the excellent reviews here. The hotel itself is clean, comfortable and modern; but it really is the staff that make the place. I don't think I have ever encountered such an unfailingly helpful and friendly group of people. Nothing is too much trouble, which was especially welcome when we arrived early off an overnight train from Bulgaria - they welcomed us with early check-in and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and clean rooms, excellent hospitality”
Reviews.Author: CE95076
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this small boutique hotel in Sultanahmet for three nights in summer (the peak tourist period in Turkey). The hotel itself was tidy and comfortable but what stood out was the friendliness of the hotel staff. They made us feel at home with a nice refreshing welcome drink (very helpful in the heat!), and provided us with useful tips and tourist maps. The breakfast spread was pretty varied and ample in portions. As first time visitors to the city, the location was also ideal for all the sights of the old city (though a bit of a walk to get to the nearest tram). Overall, definitely recommended if you are looking for a comfortable stay in Sultanahmet.

Reviews.Title: “Truely amazing”
Reviews.Author: Zakaria7
Reviews.Content: I am very particular when it comes to hotels and I must say this is definetly one of the best hotels that I have ever stayed in. I cant say anything negative about out experiences. From the minute me and my husband walked into the hotel the staff were extremely friendly; Arthur was excellent, he sat down with us and offered us drinks on our arrival and gave us tips on local attractions, and answered any questions that we had. I felt like I was staying at a friends place; one morning we missed breakfast so we recieved a call saying that they noticed we didnt have breakfast so they sent it to our rooms. Arthur was very kind through out our stay; We had a request about the bed and he upgraded us to a delux room. The breakfast was perfect, alot of variety and the hotel is simply beautiful. The standard room could have been a little bigger but it was still alot better than others that i have seen on this website. The delux bedroom was ideal. On our last night we wanted to use the spa but it was closed so Arthur asked one of the staff to open it for us and we had our privacy to use the entire spa facility. Every member of staff was helpful (sorry i dont remember their names)I think the manager of this hotel should be very proud of all their staff. I could write pages and pages of how hospitable they were. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone (we have already decided that when we go back to Istanbul we will only stay at Hotel Amira). A big thankyou to Arthur again for a memorable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific, small, modern hotel in a super convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Speeder-7
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying here very much. The hotel is comfortable and well located, the staff are pleasant and competent and, though not inexpensive, the very handy location is real plus. For a long weeked break doing mostly touristy things it was ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul: Amazing City: What took us so long? Hotel Amira: Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: unomeaskr
Reviews.Content: We visited Istanbul over the Thanksgiving holiday season, which was a good time as it was not too warm, but not too cold. We had searched Trip Advisor before booking a hotel and Hotel Amira came up with good reviews so we booked our 7 day stay there. We were happy to find the hotel was â€˜true to postingsâ€™. Itâ€™s a great value for the money! Sulyeman Karakas greeted us on our arrival at night. He immediately seated us and, with map in hand, gave us an overview of the Old Town, circled the major sights, suggested restaurants, and answered our many questions. We like to roam around on our own, so he circled the â€˜stopsâ€™ for the tram and circled where to catch the ferries. The map with its comments became our valuable resource and Sulyeman became our â€˜go toâ€™ person during our stay. His 'tips' on how to get around and where to eat were 'spot on'! Btw, if you like to try different foods you must eat at Cija Sofrasi for a true 'home cooked' meal and deserts you have likely never eaten before! What I liked best: free wireless, free wireless (and a desk to place your laptop)! Clean, good-sized rooms with clean, modern bathrooms! Free yummy breakfast! I love trying different foods, so the breakfast was awesome! Great location: short walk to Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, the Sultanhamet tram stop and since we like to walk, walking distance to the Grand Bazaar and Topkapi Palace. And, of course, thank you to the staff and especially Sulyeman for taking us under his wing and helping make our stay more enjoyable! Re: Istanbul: it's an amazing city!! The Aya Sofia, Blue Mosque, Basilica Cistern are all amazing to experience. There is soooo much to see! The city is easy to get around using the tram and ferries. We were happy we came (what took us so long?)! We have been to many, many places: Machu Picchu, Angor Wat, Cairo, Tanzania, Bali (beside the usual European and Asian places, etc.). Istanbul is high on the list of 'best places' we've been and should be one of the top places on the everyone's 'bucket list'.

Reviews.Title: “If only every hotel was this good”
Reviews.Author: Stoury27
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Amira late November for 4 nights covering my 60th birthday with my wife two children and their partners.The hotel was excellent in every respect. Staff are extremely friendly, with very good English, knowledgeable about their city and extremely helpful in recommending sights, trips, restaurants and making the necessary arrangements. I am convinced that without their good offices we would not have secured a table in some of the restaurants we wanted to go to. The hotel location is excellent for the Old City sights (the Blue mosque appears almost in touching distance) and easy enough to get across into the New City.Slight downsides are early morning street noise and I heard the calls to worship twice out of 4 mornings - but with all of Istanbul to see in a bit over 3 days who was going to be lying late in bed? The rooms are lovely (my children had standard rooms which they pronounced excellent) with the superior being more spacious (strangely though my daughter's standard room had a bath whereas our superior did not). Everything bright, clean and smart. We sat out briefly on the roftop terrace which must be a great spot to relax in the summer. Breakfast too are very good with a wide range of dishes frequently replenished (inc. a few hot dishes). Special touches - my family had ordered a birthday cake and champagne which was duly delivered - alongwith a gift of a lovely backgammon set from the Amira to mark my birthday. After checkout we got back a little early for our car to the airport (again arranged by the Amira) so we asked for tea and cake while we waited, which arrived promptly "compliments of the hotel". Istanbul is a great city to visit and the Amira is the perfect base from which to enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience!”
Reviews.Author: hazegray78
Reviews.Content: I decided to take my girlfriend on a surprise 2-day trip to Istanbul and didn't want to spend much time planning, so I relied on TA to book the hotel and restaurants--hoping to minimize the likelihood of poor experiences during our short time there. We were NOT disappointed. Hotel Amira lived up to its TA reputation in every way. Prior to our visit, I mentioned it was a surprise birthday trip and to my surprise was presented a very nice handmade, traditional backgammon set, along with a nice birthday note. It was the first time in my many travels that a hotel had provided such a personal touch and kind gesture--which really set the tone for a pleasant stay. After a bit of difficulty linking up with our driver, and a bizarre trip from the airport, we were greeted warmly upon arrival by Ferhat and another gentlemen, who offered us a nice drink, showed us the property (up on the lovely patio) and gave us a brief tour of Istanbul by map--which included several recommendations. The deluxe room was clean, well-appointed and comfortable, with modern bathroom fittings and a jacuzzi tub (a bit too small for two, however ;) Ours had a small patio with a slight view of the Bosporus and the immediate surroundings. The location can't be beat, with the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and Arasta Bazaar all within minutes (walking) and much more within easy reach by tram or taxi. We had a wonderful dinner at Pasazade (also highly rated by TA) as well at the Aloran Cafe (down near the Four Seasons Hotel), recommended to us by Ferhat. There are several small bars and cafes just up the street from the hotel, and many more within walking distance. I had seen several posts complaining about the breakfast, but I can tell you that I saw nothing worth complaining about. The dining area is nice, and there was a plentiful spread of scrambled eggs, breakfast meats, fresh fruits, pastries, cheeses and vegetables--something for everyone--every morning. And the tea and coffee was plentiful. Perhaps this was all in response to earlier grumblings, but I was pleased, nonetheless. The only thing I would suggest is to either take the train from the airport (Attaturk) to Sultanhamet, look for a more reasonably priced transfer company (there were several advertising near the hotel) or even a taxi. We booked the airport transfer through the hotel and although comfortable and reliable, found it a bit pricey at 60EUR considering the relatively short length of the journey. Overall, Ferhat and company did everything they could to make sure we thoroughly enjoyed our stay and we did! I will definitely return to Hotel Amira on my next trip to Istanbul (possibly in a couple of weeks)!

Reviews.Title: “Places a perfect highlight on a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: veryfrequentravel
Reviews.Content: Although I have consulted Trip Advisor in past for bookings I was going to make, this was the first time I found and booked hotel solely on Trip advisor input. It was well worth it. Rooms ,although a bit small were beautifully appointed as was bathroom. Hotel is boutique style and as my wife pointed out actually looks like pictures on their web page.Breakfast was very good as was steadiness of internet connection(both included in price). Roof top terrace has amazing views of the Bosporous. Location is fantastic as you can walk to most major tourist spots. But what made it exceptional was the friendliness of the staff especially the front desk and the lady who has studied Greek. One last point , there is a store across the strret which sells souvenirs significantly cheaper than the Grand Bazaar. I can not comment on quality as we had already bought out Istanbul prior to seeing him but it might be worth checking .

Reviews.Title: “Very good located hotel with a friendly service it is a happy reminder!”
Reviews.Author: IkkeenBi
Reviews.Content: I went to Istanbul with a friend to visit, to rest and to enjoy and we did it all! The service in the hotel was very good the employees were very kind and helpful. It is located in the old city,so you can visit the city on foot or go for a walk between the ancient walls in the evening. It is also located in a quiet street. There is a small trainstation near the hotel but after a day you don't hear it anymore. You can request a room at the other side of the hotel if it is necesarry. The room was neatly. We booked this hotel for the location, the nice price and the accomodation and we were very satisfied!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: E-TravellerBrazil
Reviews.Content: Amira Hotel was my best stay in Europe. Its a wonderful hotel, geat location, great staff (thank you Emre). The breakfast was marvelous as everythin at the hotel. I miss Istanbul and Amira Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel... Far exceeded my expectations. 10 out of 10!!”
Reviews.Author: RubinaD
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel on our honeymoon in August 2010. The location was excellent, only a few mins from the centre of Istanbul. The staff were VERY helpful and friendly, everyone from the hotel manager to the porter, to the catering staff. The rooms were spacious and spotless. The breakfasts were AMAZING, wide variety to choose from, something different every day. There was freshly baked bread, fresh pastries/pies, olives, cheese, meats... lovely breakfast. The sun terrace was spacious, clean and nicely furnished. All in all, an EXCELLENT hotel at a VERY reasonable price. I would definitely recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Stays I've Had”
Reviews.Author: parisiensalon
Reviews.Content: I found the Hotel Amira on Trip Advisor and chose this hotel for my stay based on user reviews and their photos. And, as I discovered, there's a reason why the hotel is the top rated one in Istanbul. I arrived in the car the hotel had arranged for me (at an additional cost), to be greeted by what felt like the entire staff of the hotel. After a very quick check-in, I was brought to the rooftop terrace by Kamer (the hotel's coordinator) and, after being served a welcome glass of wine, spent the better part of the next half hour with Kamer being given an in-depth orientation to the city. Kamer then brought me to my room, which was exactly as it looked in the hotel's photos. Absolutely chic and beautiful. Everything about the hotel screams first class, from the provided toiletries to the fully-stocked mini-bar and the incredible spread of a breakfast presented each morning. I didn't have a chance to check out the spa, but the rooftop terrace and breakfast room are beautifully furnished (the rooftop terrace was South Beach chic ... and I'm from there). The only thing that isn't five-star are the prices. The room rate ... and even the mini bar prices ... are beyond reasonable. Throughout my stay, I was always greeted with a smile by the staff. Knowing I was a photographer, Kamer and Kartal, the General Manager, showed me their collection of books from a Turkish photographer. When I decided to take tea or a glass of wine in the lounge, it was always brought to me with a warm smile. Istanbul is one of the most extraordinary places I've visited, and the Amira is it's best hotel. I can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Liked it- alot!”
Reviews.Author: Vestfoldgirl
Reviews.Content: Great location just a few minutes walk to the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia. Upon arrival one of the staffmembers provided us with a map of Istanbul and gave us tips on what to see, and how to get there. Everything is uphill from the hotel, so be sure to bring good walking shoes, as you can get a long way by using your feet. There is a really nice souk on the way up to the Blue mosque with high quality merchandise. The room was clean and nicely decorated. So was the rest of the hotel. Both the room and bathroom was quite small, but OK when you are not going to spend to much time there. Bathroom had jacuzzi bathtub, and two showerheads (rain shower). The minibar was reasonably priced. I found the matress to be a bit hard, but then again my husband claimed it was the best bed he had ever slept in.... Breakfast was good, with a nice variety of food. Liked the fresh fruit, nuts and dried fruits. A computer was available in the breakfast room, good for checking e-mail and printing bording cards. Free wi-fi in the rooms. There is also a safe in the room. Great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable $ hotel, 4 + star, clean, spacious,modern, incredible breakfast, excellent, prof. cust. service and a spa...”
Reviews.Author: MadridDevera
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the cust. service; exceptionally helpful and professional. It is newly opened...double bed room was spacious with art decor,modern furniture, bath facility with two shower heads, maybe large second one was for massage??? and a jucuzzi. The breakfast was incredible, with a variety of fruit and vegetables and bottled water was available for free. The lower floor has a fitness and spa facility, I stayed one night and paid 99euros. It will be difficult for me to stay in a standard hotel for basically the same price after staying at the Amira Istanbul where I had incredible 4 star + comfort features. After a day and night on the town, I do want to rest comfortably. The price is only a little more than some of the basic boutiques hotels in the area and it is in Sultanamet where many historical areas and objects are located, easy access to the bazaars and spice market.

Reviews.Title: “Only one place to stay...Hotel Amira”
Reviews.Author: DenverMomPeace
Reviews.Content: I was directed to Hotel Amira from the reviews on tripadvisor and I know why they score so high. The hotel staff is friendly, informed, great at speaking english and superbly attentive. The rooms are CLEAN and big. The beds are comfortable with a duvet in a clean duvet cover (not an old bed spread). The hotel is located in a terrific area. Just a five minute walk to the Hagia Sofia...you're right in the heart of things without being in the bustle of the noisy metro and walking tourists. We loved the hotel breakfasts, coffee and meeting people from all over the world. Ask for Arthur behind the front desk...he used to live in LA and he'll send you to the locals hot spots. We've already told all our friends to go to Turkey (it's such a cool country) and while in Istanbul stay at Hotel Amira.

Reviews.Title: “MAGNIFICENT EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: tpiessens
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel to stay, eat, sleep and point of start to discover the city of Istanbul. The staff is really helpful and the rooms are super clean and comfortable. Breakfast is really incredible, a very wide range of delicious fresh food. A reason to go back to Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “The Place To Be”
Reviews.Author: RawyaBeirut
Reviews.Content: Amira Hotel was the place to be. I went there with my husband and another couple during the Adha holidays. We had booked the romance package. It exceeded our expectations. The location was very convenient. The rooms were superbly comfortable and unbelievably clean. We were welcomed with red wine, fruits and chocolate, and red rose petals on the bed! In addition, the breakfast buffet was delicious and more than sufficient for a good morning start. Furthermore, the fitness services were outstanding. Above all, the staffâ€”from the manager of the hotel to the concierge as well as all employeesâ€”was exceptionally professional and friendly. Their affable attitude along with their warm hospitality and continuous assistance made the place unique and the best among the world highest class hotels we have ever stayed inâ€”and I am a constant traveler! Thank you Amira Hotel for making our stay exceedingly pleasantâ€”Habib and Rawya Kairouz

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: UkLucinda
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a brillaint location10 mins from the Blue Mosque. The hotel staff were incredibly friendly and helpful - booked us a nice restaurant each night and told us how to get there. Breakfast is fresh and extensive. The roof terrace has great views. Our room was spacious and very clean with a good sized bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever?”
Reviews.Author: Zacharius
Reviews.Content: I must preface this statement by saying that I have stayed in just about every style of hotel possible - from $12/night hostel beds in the Czech Republic to $600/night luxury hotels in Hong Kong...all combined, this is perhaps the best hotel I have ever stayed in. The location is top notch - 5 minutes (though sharp uphill there, but downhill back) walk to Sultanahment (Blue) Mosque, and an additional 3-5 to Hagia Sophia and the Basilica Cistern, as well as Sultanahment tram stop. Many restaurants within walking distance, and a view of both the minarets of the Blue Mosque and the Sea of Marmara from the lovely rooftop terrace. Check out Kucuk Aya Sofya Mosque - it's the minaret you see while looking towards the Sea of Marmara. Just a few minutes walk away and nearly empty of tourists, this is a nice little mosque to see to escape the crowds, and the Imam is very friendly and welcoming of tourists. The staff - fantastic. From the porters to the front desk staff to the bartenders/restaurant staff to the housekeeping staff, all are extremely friendly and always willing to help. Their English is excellent, and they are clearly professionals at their trade. The rooms - very comfortable. Beds are on the firmer side, but if you like (as I do), you will be in heaven. TV choices are decent, though only a few English choices. However, if you are watching TV too much, you are clearly missing out on one of the greatest cities in the world. The hotel overall - WiFi is free and quick. Rates are very attractive considering service, location and overall comfort. Rooftop terrace offers a beautiful place to relax and watch the world go by, or a stunning sunset to the west over the Sea of Marmara and outskirts of Istanbul. Airport transfers very nice and reasonable considering you get a private ride - 30 EUR to Ataturk, and 60-70 EUR to Sabiha Gokcen. If I had to fault anything, and I am pushing it here, it's the food. That being said, the (free!) breakfast is far from bad! Typical European buffet with meats, cheeses and breads. Dinner at the hotel, while good, was not great - there are tons of hotels in the area with better food at more reasonable prices. However, when the food is the only thing to "fault", it's a darn good hotel... Turkey is an amazing country, and Istanbul is one of the world's greatest cities. To be the best hotel in one of the world's best cities is truly amazing...and the Amira takes that place in my book!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and Extremely Welcome”
Reviews.Author: Spiteri
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Amira hotel for 4 nights in June after staying in a business hotel for a couple of nights. We booked a deluxe room and it was just wonderful. The owners/ staff made us feel very welcome and went out of their way to make our trip as comfortable as possible. The room was large and finely decorated. Even though we had a cot for our son, there was ample space for him to run around. We also had a jacuzzi bathtub, which is a blessing after a long day running around. The hotel is very central in the Sultanahmet district and within walking distance of all the major sights. I would recommend this hotel without any hesitation. Thanks and keep it up.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice especially with a toddler”
Reviews.Author: The_EdVenture
Reviews.Content: My wife booked this hotel after finding it on another website, and verifying on TA. We were very pleased with almost every side of our stay - to summarise: - Location is really good, very near to eat-streets and the main sights, but in a quiet and spotless neighbourhood. - Rooms were fine; not amazing, but good. Our room was fairly small but not out of the ordinary size for a hotel. Bed was very nice, bathroom was good, with a jacuzzi bath. Air-con was ok. Roof terrace great. Gym looks good although we didn't use it. - Cleanliness was perfect. - Staff were absolutely amazing; not sure whether all Turks are this friendly and helpful but we had a pushchair and a 1yr old kid and they could not have been more helpful; really. - Breakfast was average; cordial instead of fruit juice, and no toast. Fine, but not impressive. All in all, a very nice hotel, which made our stay in Istanbul very pleasurable. Definitely a recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Matti_R
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Amira for four nights during our first trip to Istanbul. The hotel was a top choice. The hotel itself is a nice one (looks like just renovated), the location was a great one just a few hundred meters from e.g. blue moskey, and what is the most important thing: I have never met such a friendly atmosphere during my holiday trips. The personnel really cared about their guests and really did their best to make sure that our holiday would be as good as possible. As firsts timers in Istanbul it was really easy to get good tips for what to do etc, as well as it was enjoyable to relax in the hotel with this kind of service and atmosphere

Reviews.Title: “Totally Worth It”
Reviews.Author: HereAHaven
Reviews.Content: I have used Tripadvisor for many years, but this is the first review I've actually wanted to write. When I first reserved this hotel, it was ranked 10th because, well, it hadn't been open for very long. But every one of the 15 reviewers raved about the place, and they were right. Because it's only been open for a short period of time, everything is NEW, from the bathtubs to the beds to the air conditioning. There is literally no wear and tear. Also, this is the first time in all my years of booking hotels online where the pictures on the hotel website are what the place actually looks like (unlike some hotels that basically post only their best looking, most expensive room complete with the benefit of good camera lighting and angles). What you see is actually what you get. This is a modern hotel, but it isn't a crazy modern hotel with an odd-shaped wicker basket plonked in the middle of your room just because it's "boutique"-y. The rooftop terrace is fantastic and totally chill. The front desk guys are so helpful and genuinely nice that you want to hug them after every interaction. Artur at the front desk especially was the best - he even recommended a restaurant where he threw his sister's engagement party. And the restaurant was great! Unlike many establishments in Turkey, you never feel like they are trying to sell you something you don't want or trying to pull one over on you. And free wireless, free wireless, free wireless. There are two minor detractions: first, the walk towards all the sites in Sultanhament, while close (8 minute walk) is an uphill walk (but at the end of the day, when you are tired and sweaty, the walk back to the hotel is thus, downhill); second, the free breakfast is a little weird. There's a LOT of food, but I wasn't a fan of what appeared to be the typical continental Turkish breakfast. But again these two things are minor. I saw a lot of crappy hotels abounding in the Sultanhamet. If you don't want to feel cheated in Istanbul, book this hotel. We world travelers need to keep places like this in business!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to hang out...”
Reviews.Author: Ankitjain
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel for 7 days and the professional attitude of the staff is worth mentioning.....as soon as we arrived in the hotel a warm welcom with a welcome drink and the staff was pretty good with english.....nice cozy place to stay in the beautiful city of Istanbul....

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: Retirees10
Reviews.Content: We have spent three days in Istanbul at the Hotel Amira and were very impressed. awe were greeted by Arthur, the Front Office Manager, and taken to the roof top terrasse for an introduction to the hotel and Istanbul. He offered suggestions on sites and restaurants. The two restaurants suggested were great (the Khorasan and the Aloran) . The rooms at the hotel are well appointed and very confortable. We had room 404 with a baicony and a view of the Bosphorous. Room 405 next door would also be great. The breakfast offers a good selection of cold and hot dishes. The internet is free. The hotel is only a few minutes walk from the Blue Mosque and not too far from the Grand Bazaar. It is weel located for easy access to the main sites of the city. For my wife's birthday, Arthur arranged for a chocolate fondue to be delivered to the room, along with a lackered backgammon game as a birthday present. This attentiveness and thoughtfulness is what made our stay at the Amira extra special. Thanks to all the staff for a very pleasant stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Brilliant staff, Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: gogggsy
Reviews.Content: Just got home from a few days in Istanbul and stayed at the Amira Hotel. Its the first time we have been to Istanbul and we couldn't have picked a better hotel. The Amira is right on the doorstep of the Blue Mosque, 10 mins walk to the Grand Bazaar and 10 mins to most other places in the old part of the City. On arriving at the hotel the staff are waiting to greet you with smiling faces and are happy to help you with anything. During a welcome drink the manager will show you a local map and point out places of interest and recommend some local restaurants (visited 2 of them and they were worth visiting) Thank you to all of the staff at the Amira, we had a lovely time. .

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mmarch
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Amira for 10 days. I have traveled extensively for both work and pleasure and this is among the 3 best hotels that I have stayed in (and that includes hotels like the Four Seasons and the Mandarin in Hong Kong). Every person at the hotel could not have been nicer or more helpful. Every recommendation that they made - from an "easy" neighborhood restaurant, to a good travel agent to book our travel within Turkey, to a restaurant for a special occasion - was perfect and exactly what we were after. The rooms and beds were extremely comfortable (included terry robes, and all the usual amenities), the breakfasts were delicious without being "showy", the roof garden was lovely, and - above all - the staff could not have been more lovely. The Amira gets the highest rating from me and my husband.

Reviews.Title: “Great, friendly little hotel”
Reviews.Author: MissBunski007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Amira during early November 2010. This well situated, spotlessly clean hotel is run by an extremely professional yet friendly staff who speak impeccable English. Their attention to detail in ensuring an enjoyable stay was highly appreciated. We arrived with nothing to change into due to a baggage delay and they immediately supplied us with nappies for our toddler (which they didn't charge us for), and gave us directions to the most appropriate shopping centre for our immediate clothing needs. The room was beautifully cleaned every day and everything we could have possibly needed was arranged for us, including a lovely cruise on the Bosphorus, good old city sightseeing, with map directions and transport recommendations and lots of little extras. They were very kind to our two year old son and made a big fuss of him and generally made us feel as if we were very welcome in Turkey. The only negative thing I would draw attention to is their restaurant recommendations- we were recommended to go to a fish restaurant named Balikci Sabattini which was overpriced and overrated.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect little gem.”
Reviews.Author: audrytec
Reviews.Content: I am so glad I relied on the other reviewers of this wonderful little hotel. -The service was one of the best I've experienced anywhere. -The restaurant is like an oasis of tranquility in that bustling city, with a Power Mac for guests can surf the web. -The roof terrace has a lovely view of the Bosforus. Downsides: -The rooms a a bit small, and the bathroom vanity has really little space for the toiletries. -Sound insulation is not great. -I could not figure out how to work the automatic ac. Luckily, the windows opened to a lovely street. Overall, one cannot beat the value of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “perfect boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: fanzoni
Reviews.Content: great hotel,great location,great service.walking distance from all the sights in Sultanhamet,otherwise always ask the hotel or the restaurant to call a taxi for you,they are very cheap[don't forget a little tip],street taxis sometimes try cheat you turning off the taxametert.We had the "Romance package" and it was absolutely worth the money.Lovely terrace,nice room,little but very clean spa.But what makes the difference in this hotel is the service:from the concierge to the barman to the youg lady in the spa they are all professional smiling and friendly,thank you guys!just a couple of things otherwise you might think that i'm a relative of the owner:few rooms are accessible only with stairs,few others have quite a poor view and maybe in summer you'll prefer a hotel with a swimming pool.other than that the hotel is a perfect choice

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: LJB06A
Reviews.Content: My friend and I used this hotel as a base for our recent city break. We were very well looked after by all the staff; when we arrived we were shown where the hotel was in relation to all the major sites and given some recommendations of when to visit them. We could easily walk to everything (everthing was up-hill from the hotel!) - but the tram was also close by should we have needed it. Some restaurants were also recommended to us by the hotel (though we never actually made it to any of them - our fault not the hotels'!) and they happily booked trips for us during our week-end. The rooms were well furnished and very clean. The air conditioning was rather loud so at night we had to juggle being too hot with being kept awake! Breakfast was tasty and there was plenty of it. The roof terrace provided superb views and looked very inviting (unfortunately the weather on the day we went to sit out on the roof was not dry, sunny and warm!). All in all a really great hotel that we wouldn't hesitate to return to.

Reviews.Title: “The best experience possible”
Reviews.Author: SimonTroy
Reviews.Content: With 40 years in the travel business I have never experienced such excellent service from a hotel. From the moment we arrived it was clear that this hotel was a cut above the average. Whisked down to the bar for check in we were given free drinks and a 20 minute comprehensive explanation of what to see and do which was really useful having never been to Istanbul before. Throughout the stay all the staff were genuinely helpful and friendly, the hotel is in a great location just a 5 minute walk form the Blue Mosque etc. and rooms exceptionally well appointed for the price, which is most reasonable given the location.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous & Super in every thing..”
Reviews.Author: Tourist27882
Reviews.Content: We have spent 5 nights in Amira Hotel. My wif & me & my little baby. It has been the greatest & most enjoybale time I have spent in my vacation holidays ever. The moment you walk into the hotel you feel yourself home. All the staff is showing terrific & super treatment to customers, VIP treatment. Everything was really perfect from a warm & kind reception on the first moment of check-in till the lovely goodbye on the date of check-out. Staff is very professional & well taking care of the customers. Room cleaness is excellent. Food & Beverages are super & great. We really felt ourselves home, & deelpy wished if we have had more time to stay in Amira Hotel. I defintely would recommend Amira Hotel for everyone who wants to have great vacation. For sure I am booking in Amira Hotel for any future vacation plan in Istabul. It adds a great value to your vacation. Deep thanks to all the staff in Amira Hotel, & well done. Best wishes.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST staff ever”
Reviews.Author: bbbuckles
Reviews.Content: We just returned from spending 4 nights at the Amira. It was such a great experience. Simply the best staff we have ever encountered. There were always available to help with anything and seemingly happy to do so. A very nice addition for travelers who have never been to the city before. We felt like we always had a friend to call if there was any kind of a problem away from the hotel but there never was. I so agree with the last review, good location slightly off the busy beaten path so quiet and soothing. Wonderful breakfast, lovely terrace for a sunset and a comfortable room complete with an iPhone docking station and self closing drawers. My only complaint....and it is small.... is that the lighting in the bathroom was not the best. If you are going to stay in Sultanamet---this is your hotel. I understand why it is the #1 rated hotel in Istanbul in Tripadvisor---quite an honor.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience, Friendly Staff that went Above and Beyond, Excellent Attention to Detail, Quiet and Clean”
Reviews.Author: happycycle
Reviews.Content: If you are traveling to Istanbul the Hotel Amira is the perfect place to stay. I travel frequently for business and am spoiled when it comes to hotel stays. I could not have been happier with my experience at Hotel Amira. The staff was perfect. They were all very nice, knowledgable and smart and they took the time to make sure that each and every detail was perfect. In fact, after staying there for 3 nights when we were scheduled to transfer to another hotel we extended our stay at the Hotel Amira. The rooms were very clean and well done - Very comfortable. The They were nicely appointed and (unlike some European hotels) took care of all ammenities. Breakfast was fabulous and filling. Lots of fruits, cheeses, meats, different Turkish pastries with cheese fillings, cereal, breads, yogurt, juices, eggs, potatoes. The location is perfect because you are within walking distance of all of the fabulous sites in the old town, but not so close that you get traffic or tourist noise. The rooftap terrace is a lovely place to enjoy some quiet downtime looking at the water. The hotel is small (about 30 rooms) and it is family owned, so you get extra care, but the owners and operators are sophisticated and well traveled enough to truly provide 5 star service for a boutique hotel price. We also stayed at the Sirkeci Konak during our trip and it was ok, but there was NO comparison between it and the Hotel Amira. If choosing between the Hotel Amira, the Sirkeci Konak or one of the American 5 star hotels then definitely stay at the Hotel Amira. Amazing service and the value truly can't be beaten.

Reviews.Title: “Special treatment in a special place.”
Reviews.Author: NPCerto
Reviews.Content: Hotel Amira was lovely. Set in the historic Sultanhamet section of Istanbul this boutique hotel was a highpoint of our trip. Modern decor and traditional service combined in a memorable lodging experience. The location is superb for access to the historic old town and trams to the modern sections of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “top notch service, amenities and location”
Reviews.Author: therenownovel
Reviews.Content: brand new modern rooms with internet. a helpful front desk staff and excellent location. wonderful breakfast. Some taxis may not be familiar with hotel so download map from internet. will be my preferred destination in Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: JFE
Reviews.Content: Booked our stay at Amira through their website. The 3 night cultural package proved to be a good deal. Airport pick-up, half-day city orientation and cultural night/dinner at Galata Tower included were a great way to maximize our short visit to Istanbul and we still had time to do things on our own. The hotel is situated very nicely, walking distance up a small hill to many important attractions. You're sure to enjoy passing along shops, restaurants, hotels, bazaar on the way. The staff can't be more friendly and professional, starting from earlier communications while booking to the moment you step foot at the hotel with their warm and gracious welcome. Every request was effortless and done with ease. Our room was spotless, with very comfortable bed and pillows. A big door looked out to the street outside which was very interesting to watch from. There was tea and coffee making facility and there was free wi-fi in the room. The bathroom however was a little small and without a tub as I would have liked. The breakfast buffet spread was very adequate to start your day. Unfortunately, it was raining and we couldn't enjoy the views from the roof top terrace. Thanks to Arthur, Fermat and other staff for making our Istanbul visit exciting and memorable. We hope to return to Istanbul someday.

Reviews.Title: “Appropriately Ranked No. 1”
Reviews.Author: asw_1984
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend Hotel Amira to my friends visiting Istanbul. I had booked a hotel based on a recommendation from a friend who traveled to Istanbul a couple of years ago, but became a bit concerned about the hotel after reading a couple of recent reviews and decided to change to Hotel Amira at the last minute based on the glowing reviews here. Iâ€™m glad we made the switch! From the moment we checked in, the service was very professional, accommodating, and helpful. Immediately after we checked in they provided us with a very detailed map of the city and a brief overview of the city to be our bearings. Hotel Amira is well located and within walking distance to most attractions (but must walk up a good sized hill). The rooms are very modernâ€¦we had been on the Aegean coast before arriving and were really happy to find a comfortable bed with good pillows. Breakfast was awesome! I was particularly fond of the fresh fruit, yogurt, and honey while my husband tended to like the cheese and bread selection. The breakfast was beyond what we heard was the typical turkish breakfast of white bread, tomatoes, olives, and etc. My only negative comment about the hotel was one (and the only) restaurant recommendation they provided usâ€¦it was for Tamara which is a block or so away. The food at Tamara wasnâ€™t recommendation-worthyâ€¦and we thought there might be some connection between the hotel and restaurant. Skip Tamara because so many other options to pick from! All and all a great hotel that is pretty new (7 months or soâ€¦I think).

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a gem - staying there on your visit to Istanbul is a MUST!”
Reviews.Author: BuffyKent
Reviews.Content: If you find a negative review about the Hotel Amira in Sultanahmet .... don't believe it!! This is one of the friendliest hotels I have stayed in for a long time. The staff were wonderful and simply nothing was too much trouble. We were greeted on arrival with free drinks on the terrace and introduced to our "personal guide" for the Trip - one of the Reception staff, who gave us a 24 hr mobile contact number if we had any problems. We were given information about the hotel, surrounding area, sites to visit and good restaurants and cafes in the locality. We were advised on getting around the City by foot, public transport, ferry, taxi and private transfer. The Hotel offers a booking service for practically anything you could desire and even keeps tokens for the Tram system to save you queueing!! Everywhere you go, somebody is cleaning something - the whole place was spotless. Breakfast is continental buffet style - a good spread and a wide choice. Please keep in mind this is a Muslim country, so you are not going to find bacon on the menu!! Room service was efficient and the food good - all in all an excellent experience and if I found myself in Istanbul again, I would definitely stay here! The location is excellent and you only have a short walk to all the main attractions in the Old City. A short tram ride away, and you are in the modern New Quarter and only a short boat trip to the Asian side - what more could you ask?

Reviews.Title: “Convenient hotel with fabulous staff”
Reviews.Author: 261624Margaret
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel because of the staff. It did not matter who was on duty as they were all so helpful and friendly. They made really helpful suggestions about where to eat and what to see. They would also organise a taxi for us from the rank right outside and virtually guarantee what the journey would cost. Breakfast was good and included in the price and the staff there were very pleasant and helpful as well. Free wifi is always appreciated. Although the room was a little noisy, it didn't matter because of the excellent service. It was an uphill walk to the Blue Mosque but, even though I am not very fit, it was not too difficult. En route you can walk through a very good small bazaar with quality products. I would most definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Unparalelled service, great roof terrace views, beautifully outfitted rooms/baths, and a great location!"”
Reviews.Author: simply_Janine
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about Hotel Amira. The location is great, easily walkable (through nicer streets than from other area hotels) to major sites. The welcome and city orientation from Kam were thorough and very helpful (and we'd been in Istanbul two days already!). Excellent, excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Just a prefect place in a busy city!”
Reviews.Author: Melo1
Reviews.Content: Perfect is the key word. We requested a special type of room...it was waiting. We needed a rental car in Bandirma (very hard to come by)...arranged . Suggested a desk reading lamp...one was waiting at the end of the day.for us to try. All of the staff were helpful and friendly. Did I mention that the location was perfect? All of our walks seemed to be uphill, but we needed the exercise anyway. Thanks for a great stay in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “awesome hotel,excellent service!!”
Reviews.Author: rumki123
Reviews.Content: this hotel is all about service.Its a beautiful small boutique hotel.Very cozy and intimate.Everything about this hotel was way above our expectation but way ahead of everything was the service and the exceptional behavior of the staffs, we were just estatic.The day we reached was my hubby's bday, and as requested they had arranged for a wonderful cake.Although I had told them I would pay for it,yet they didn't charge us for it.Also the next day we were surprised with a very expensive gift.This is something I definitely did not expect.Istanbul is an exceptionally beautiful place and our stay here would not have been as special had we not stayed in Hotel Amira.So all those who are reading this review.....do try out this place.You'll love it!!! Also for additional information,if you happen to go to the big bazzar....don't buy anything there,its a ripoff.Do go there see the prices,come back to Hotel Amira and purchase the same things from the shop across.....believe me,you can bargain and get half the price.Since not many people buy from this shop,the guy is desperate to sell things and he actually comes down to half the price he asks for.So you get away paying a lot less than what you'd do in the grand bazzar.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel far exceeded any expectations.”
Reviews.Author: Chad1946
Reviews.Content: Amira Hotel was a home away from home. We were picked up at the airport and treated like royalty. The staff were warm, friendly, and fun. The breakfast was well-balanced. The rooms were bright and spacious. We were within walking distance of most everything you would want to see. The rooftop drink to watch the sunset was a daily must. Most of all, the warm hospitality made our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, service and comfort”
Reviews.Author: Ericandrewpandy
Reviews.Content: I had a one night/morning stopover in Istanbul so wanted to rest and sight see. This hotel is ideally situated for all the main central Istanbul sights and many of them are visible from the roof terrace, which also has great sunset views. the rooms are modern, stylishly designed and very comfortable. Add to this great service and I would highly reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: mercymercyme
Reviews.Content: What a really great hotel. The location is fantastic, the staff really go that extra mile and the place had all of the amenities that we needed. We accidentally left our coats behind and when we came to collect them over a week later, not only did they recognize us immediately but the coats had been dry cleaned. We hadn't booked to stay there again. They didn't try and charge us at all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice small hotel on a beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: rverw
Reviews.Content: The Amira hotel is a nice small hotel. The rooms are spotlessly clean and the staff is very helpfull. The breakfast is marvellous. From the roof terras you can enjoy the sight of the Bosporus. The hotel is in walking distance from all the main sightseeing places in Istanbul such as the bleu mosque and the Topkapi palace.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely great service”
Reviews.Author: happylarry1
Reviews.Content: Nothing was too much trouble for management at this well located hotel. We arrived at 08:30 not expecting to be able to get to our room; the first thing we were offered was a complimentary breakfast before we ventured out. Later that evening (a Sunday) I wanted to get a shave at a local barber - 7pm on a Sunday might have been a problem but the porter walked me around 3 barbers till we found one that was open. Great service. Only thing to remember is that you're very close to the Blue Mosque and about 4 other mosques; a 6:30 early morning call might not suit everyone, but I guess this will aply to most of Istanbul. Rooms are large and very well fitted out. Breakfast superb. The place is not to be faulted

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, friendly and helpful staff, very well located”
Reviews.Author: quicksilva
Reviews.Content: It was our first wedding anniversary so we wanted a good hotel. We travelled with our 6 months old baby and the hotel staff were very friendly, professional and welcoming. The quality and variety of food was of great standard and the hotel was centrally located. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Traveller4218
Reviews.Content: Super friendly, welcoming, helpful staff. Ferhat was terrific- he sent us to the best restaurants in town. I travelled with my wife and a friend and we all loved staying here. Our rooms were great and the location was perfect for seeing Istanbul, espescially for the first time. Highly reccommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excelent helpful staff who know when to let you be”
Reviews.Author: specfor
Reviews.Content: Hotel Amira is a must for anyone wanting to see the sites of Istanbul. It has the perfect loaction for any newcomer to the city, a high level of accomodation and the service is outstanding and the staff are friendly. It is priced well and made our stay in Istanbul. The best boutique hotel i have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Amira first class in service-- Great location!”
Reviews.Author: EBJWTCLTD
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, my mother and her friend had two rooms for 3 nights at the Hotel Amira the third week of September. The hotel sent a van to the port to pick up the 4 of us after our cruise, and we got to the hotel around 10 a.m. Of course, our rooms were not ready that early, but Kartal the manager and Arthur and the rest of the staff were extremely hospitable and brought us cold lemonade and let us rest in the sunroom off the restaurant, as we settled in. They offered to let us have the sumptuous breakfast as well, but we had already had breakfast on the ship. There was free internet in the dining room/ cafe. A very nice perk. The room for the ladies was ready first, so they settled in. As we were waiting for our room, Arthur told us that his mother worked at an antique shop just outside the Grand Bazaar, and she could direct us to a good place for lunch. At the antique shop where Arthur's mother Perihan works, we marveled at the gorgeous antique coin gold jewelry and other antiques. Perihan recommended the Aslan restaurant nearby, where we had delicious Bonita fish with vegetables and tomato sauce with herbs. Good house wine too. Great Turkish hospitality! Our guide, Dr. Gunhan Borecki, met us at the hotel the next day. He has a Ph.D. from Ohio State in Ottoman Studies, so he speaks excellent English and has an incredible knowledge of Istanbul and Turkish history. He took us to the Hippodrome, Blue Mosque, and Haggia Sophia, as well as lunch at Asmali Restaurant on the terrace. The Archaeology Museum and Topkapi Palace ended the tour. The following day Gunhan took us by van to the Dolmabahce Palace, the old Byzantine Palace, Pannokaristos Church, and lunch at Asitane, where they have the historic dishes of the Ottoman Empire. The last stops were the Mosaic Museum and shops where we got Turkish Delight and pistachios. A wonderful two days! Having Gunhan really maximized our visit and allowed us to see everything we wanted to see. Well worth it. Our brand new, "deluxe" rooms were very contemporary, with red leather sofa and stylish shag rug. King bed, desk/ dressing table, and small round table and chair. They just have king beds in the deluxe rooms, however, but they brought in another bed for the ladies, since they liked the room better than the standard room that had twin beds. Our room was on the corner and had a balcony with 2 chairs and table, with a view of the city out the front and the sea to the left. The traffic went past, as it was on the front of the hotel, but it was not too bad. The room was spacious. The bath was not large, but all brand new and very clean. The closet was just outside the bathroom, so you could put everything in there that you could not fit into the bathroom. No shelves except for towels, but it did have nice hooks. The breakfast was wonderful-- eggs, sausages, and all sorts of sweet rools and breads, with huge figs and fruits and cheeses. It was included in the price as well! The staff were so lovely and helpful. The restaurant is open for dinner, and one night for dinner we had a very good mixed grill with kebobs of all kinds. The chicken kebobs were good too. The server could not have been nicer, and very efficient, serving the whole room! The hotel arranged for a van to take us to the airport the last morning. The traffic is very bad in Istanbul, so make sure to allow some extra time just in case there is a lot of traffic. He was there around 10 minutes after the appointed time because of the traffic, but we had allowed plenty of time, and our flight was an hour late leaving anyway! You will love staying at the Hotel Amira Istanbul. Tell Kartal and Arthur and the staff hello for us! E. Jones, Atlanta, GA

Reviews.Title: “The overall experience was very good...”
Reviews.Author: Blumi
Reviews.Content: The overall experience was very good, here are the pros and cons. Location very good for visiting the old city and all relevant sights but bad concerning restaurants,bars,clubs. Ten minute walking to the tramway. Avoid taxis during rush hours (traffic can be very bad at any time of the day). Terrace offers nice views of the surroundings Very nice interior , very clean, very helpful&friendly staff. Breakfast compared to regular ones at Turkish hotels is very good, although you have to pay extra for an omlette, capuccino/espresso. Free wifi in the wohle hotel and also one guest Mac in the breakfast room. We borrowed a very useful guidebook of the city which we found among the small choice of books we have found in the breakfast room. You will hear heayv street noise from cars, trains etc. SPA is closed on sundays!

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel with big personality”
Reviews.Author: conejo-bangkok
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a hotel near all the major attractions of Sultanhamet, look no further. Hotel Amira is a small hotel with lots of character. The rooms are on the small side but you trade this with the perfect location. Most places to visits are within walking distance and there are taxis available right outside the hotel 24/7 if you'd like to go to places like Taksim. What demands a sepecial note is the service and the hotel's members of staff. We are a group of 8 friends from Thailand who know very little about the city. Big thanks to Ferhat and his colleagues who made our stay a perfect one. The level of service easily surpass that of a 5-star hotel. Nothing is too much trouble and the guests get personalized introduction to the hotel and the city of Istanbul, which we found exceptional. Ferhat also helped arrange transfers and restaurant bookings before we arrive in Istanbul. Thanks again for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, GREAT Staff!”
Reviews.Author: ragazza000
Reviews.Content: We came off a cruise ship and extended our trip in Istanbul. We only had about a day to see as much as possible. The staff was very friendly, and helpful in guiding us to all the nearby sites. Everything was walkable. Great breakfast included and the hotel provided airport transfer was great, too.

Reviews.Title: “It was great”
Reviews.Author: Yas007
Reviews.Content: My family and I had a very good time there.Our room was small but comfortable,room service was good ,the location was perfect near to Aya sofia,Topkapi,cistern,..you can easily go there on foot.There are many good resturant near there.

Reviews.Title: “Best Staff & Location”
Reviews.Author: shahinasbaghi
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at this hotel and everything was perfect. we were traveling with a 2 years baby and everyday she messed under her baby chair with eggs and ... while we were having breakfast but everyone was just smiling and telling us not to be worry about. Ferhat was a great help to show the good spots and restaurants during our stay on the map and I have to thank all the reviewers for their good comments and the hotel staff for making our stay so pleasant. I am giving them 10/10

Reviews.Title: “A Very Good Choice in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: dbasha
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 5 nights at this hotel recently, and it was a really good experience. The cultural package that we booked was tremendous value for money, and included a half day city tour and a cultural evening (including dinner and drinks) at Galata Tower. The staff was friendly and gave good recommendations for food and tours (try Aloran Restaurant - it was fantastic!). Our deluxe room was spacious, tastefully decorated and always clean. The hotel's location is very good for its proximity to the main tourist sights. The roof terrace was nice, although the view (other than that of the Marmara Sea) was restricted by neighbouring buildings on higher ground. Having said that, while one can always visit other rooftop restaurants or bars (such as Seven Hills) to get a great a view, I suspect that there are few hotels which can trump the Amira in other respects. Now for a couple of minor negatives. The breakfast selection is the same every day, which can be boring by the 3rd day. Also, some of the staff tend to forget to give fundamental information when advising guests (eg it is better to walk than to take taxis in Sultanhamet and Eminonu due to intense traffic, and one should go earlier than usual to the airport due to baggage screening procedures). That said, it is easy enough to remedy these things so that Amira moves even closer to perfection!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Istanbul !”
Reviews.Author: Chris_and_Hazel_2010
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Amira for the first part of our honeymoon. From the moment we arrived to when we left everything was perfect. The service was 10/10, the staff were friendly and nothing was too much trouble. Our room was beautiful, clean and really comfortable. We both can't highly recommend Hotel Amira enough, the best hotel we have ever stayed. We were really sad to leave, but cannot wait to come back soon. Thank you to everyone at hotel Amira for giving us such a memorable time. Chris & Hazel

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: stacey_andrawes
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Amira. The location is right in the center of the Sultanahmet district and within walking distance to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Archeological Museum, Gran Bazar, Spice Market, Topkai Palace, etc. From the roof top deck you get a view of Old Istanbul and the Bosphorus. It is the perfect place to unwind with a glass of wine and watch the sunset. The rooms and all of the amenities were very nice. The staff is wonderful and very helpful. I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT”
Reviews.Author: queralt_pinto
Reviews.Content: My husband and I with our four months baby loved this hotel. Everybody were very kind and helpful with us and specially with the baby. They made our stay there unforgettable. They make you feel like home. We were very sad to leave. We can not wait to go back there. Thanks to all the staff for everything, you are just GREAT!!!!!! Namazov family and Nazim

Reviews.Title: “HIGHLY RECOMMENDABLE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Javier_Madrid2010
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights in this hotel. The location is fantastic, since it is right in the centre of Sultanahmet district, walking distance from the Blue Mosque, St. Sophia, Basilica Cistern, Cemberlitas Hamman, Topkapi Palace, etc. In fact, you can see the Blue Mosque from the great roof terrace. The view is amazing from there, perfect to sit down, have a drink and relax. We booked a standard room and it was perfect, clean, very good taste in every detail. The staff is perhaps the best thing in this hotel. They are young and highly professional. As soon as we arrived they showed us the hotel and invited us to a drink in the roof terrace while they gave us a map and provided us will all kind of useful information. The last day they also allowed us to stay in our room until we left to the airport at no additional cost. In conclusion, it made our stay in Istanbul great. Highly recommendable.

Reviews.Title: “A very good choice for Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: MHSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: For the Sultanahmed part of Istanbul, ie for the part of the city with the most historical interest (Topkapi, Aya Sophia, Blue Mosque, Archaeology Museum, etc), it is well located - a short 10 minute walk to all of these. The hotel personnel are very cordial and very helpful - hotel service was invariably top notch. The rooms are comfortable, with good A/C, good internet, and very good bathrooms. The roof has a nice view onto part of the Marmara Sea, and you can get drinks, snacks, and even simple meals there. There is, however, no full restaurant in the hotel, altho they do serve a quality breakfast, much beyond the ordinary continental. A small, but serviceable, exercise room has 2 treadmills and a stationary bike, all high quality. There is very little that can go wrong with choosing this hotel. We enjoyed it, and would go again. 2 relatively minor concerns: The muezzin - the callers/singers for daily prayers - can be heard in the hotel rooms (at least, on the side we were on, which is the preferred side, as it the one furthest from a busy road), even with all windows closed. This can get old at 5am. Food in Sultanahmed is not the best to put it mildly (Beyoglu and the asian side are much better). The hotel, in my opinion, was not well enough informed to guide you properly. You need to do your own homework.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and elegance in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: RoRe
Reviews.Content: We have been there for 6 nights, the hotel is well located in the old part of istanbul were you can explore the whole city by foot or nearby tram station. The room was great felt like 5 stars hotel, the breakfast was similar every day but overall was ok. The great thing really was the service and welcoming and the smiles every where. Really great experince and would recommend it to every one. Thanks every one there... from Dr.Riyadh from Saudi Arabia.

Reviews.Title: “Can recommend”
Reviews.Author: Fish_Ness
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff and quite a good location very close to the park area by the Golden Horn waterfront and also just a stone's-throw from KÃ¼Ã§Ã¼k Ayasofya Camii. Interiors are very good and also newly decorated; but the room decoration is slightly at odds stylistically with the rest of the hotel. It is almost as if the interior design crew had resigned en-masse halfway through the assignment. Roof terrace view of the sea and Sultanhamet great.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect”
Reviews.Author: GarethRhysMorgan
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded all our expectations and if you want to be based in the old city (Sultanahmet) you won't find a better overall choice. Location - 5 mins walk from the Blue Mosque and main attractions (including tram stop). 10 min walk from loads of restaturants. Service - warm greeting, welcome drinks and detailed introduction to Istanbul on the roof terrace. Nothing was ever too much for the staff who were friendly and helpful throughout. Free internet and printing was a nice touch for online flight check in Rooms - large and recently refurbished. Very modern and comfortable with tea/coffee making facilities and safe. Great showers as well. Food - complimentary breakfast was great - choice of cereal, breads, fruit, meats and cheese as well as some hot options - egg, sausages, hash browns, beans etc. Tips - if arriving into Ataturk airport, easy to get metro and tram to the hotel for 3TL each - 1hr or so. if arriving into S Goeken airport, a little more difficult but tram and funnicular to Taksim where a shuttle bus will take you to the airport - 16TL each, closer to 2 hours overall though. If you want a quick and cheap lunch, Doy Doy, mid way between hotel and Blue Mosque provides good portions and variety for around 10TL and has a great roof terrace. Enjoy your trip to Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel. Great staff.”
Reviews.Author: Maluzita
Reviews.Content: Amira Hotel was a great surprise. Brand new facilities, good location, yummy breakfast, generous and friendly staff. My experience of Istanbul just wouldn't be the same had I stayed elsewhere. My family and I stayed there for 6 days and loved it. I strongly recommend Amira Hotel for anyone planning a trip to Istanbul, and specially for first-timers. With the great Hotel manager they have, you can be sure to have a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, would stay in Taksim next time”
Reviews.Author: GoldenWings2
Reviews.Content: Amira Hotel is one of the best in the area. Within walking distance from the tram tat takes you to Taksim via the Furnicular. But if you going out every night, you might as well stay in Taksim, and visit the old city once or twice. Service was good - breakfast very good. Rooms were neat but a bit ornate and dark. What was frustrating was there was no wireless reception in the room, only in common area, whch is not what they advertise. The rooftop are is great for relaxing in the evenings with a view over gthe bosphorous and the minarets of the blue mosque. A nice hotel, but I will stay in Taksim next time I am in Istanbul. The manager did give a good description of the hotel and services available and recommended things to do. There are a few average looking eating places around the area and there is a convenience store which opens late right opposite. carry a map of the hotel with you because taxi drivers dont know the name or address.The hotel supplies a wallet size map

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice !”
Reviews.Author: Max1971Max
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Amira for 4 nights in August. In my reservation i included the transfer from the Airport to the hotel which worked perfectly well. -The room was new, very clean and very comfortable, flat screen tv, free wifi, great shower and bathroom, complimentary bottle of water every day, A/C working perfectly fine (important because weather was extremely hot that week). The minibar items could be a bit expensive, and the decoration is not what i would choose for my house, but this is certainly very subjective anyway.. - ALL the hotel staff were EXTREMELY helpful. All of them help with a smile... Upon arrival, one of the guys in the reception gave me a map and spend almost 30 minutes in the hotel bar explaining me the city, main attractions, local transportation, sightseeing tours, recommendation ,etc, etc. Also, the guys at reception would recommend me great restaurants around the neighborhood (ie. Seven Hills Restaurant, which is one of the highest restaurant roof with and amazing view of Ayasofia and the Blue mosque - if you want to go there, try to stop by during the day to reserve a table so you get the ones with better view) , sightseeing tours, got me honest taxis from a taxi stand around the corner, allowed me to use the gym facility for a shower after i checked out on my last day, etc, etc.... and always going the extra mile to provide guidance, advice or help - Location is also excellent, in Sultanahmet, just 5 minutes walk from the Blue Mosque , AyasofÃ½a., the hippodrome, the cistern and the tram stop . - Breakfast is ok, not the most amazing i had but with good variety and good service. . Overall, i can comfortably recommend this hotel and the rating i saw here in Tripadvisor that prompt me to book it, did not disappoint me at all. As somebody else wrote down, my advice is that if your choice is Sultanahmet, don't think twice about booking this hotel in your next stay.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in Istanbul - Excellent in all aspects”
Reviews.Author: pammydev
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Istanbul and we stayed at Hotel Amira for 4 nights. The hotel was in an excellent location with the historical sights of the city and the city tram a short walk away. The staff in the hotel were all very friendly, polite and helpful recommending sights to see, things to do and places to eat. The hotel rooms were spacious, comfortable and very clean. The hotel terrace was the perfect way to relax in the evening after a busy day of sight-seeing! If we were to visit Istanbul again, without a doubt we would stay at Hotel Amira.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel, spotless, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Sophie_Spain
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Amira for 5 nights in August. We had booked a Deluxe Room and were upgraded to a suite, which was a lovery detail from the hotel management. We hired the one-way transfer from the hotel as we did not want to argue with any taxiu driver upon starting our vacation. Had to wait a little for the car to come, maybe because our flight was delayed over an hour. The hotel has an ideal location, just 5 mns away from the Blue Mosque and AyasofÃ½a. The hotel is new, spotless clean and furbished with good taste. Our room was large and comfortable. Free wi-fi connection. However, be prepared, the walls are paper-thin: we could ear everything our neighbour would do while taking a shower... The staff is extremely friendly and tries to help you with anything you might need (from dinner recommendations to providing ice to have a drink in our room). We had a little issue at check-out, immediately solved by the reception staff and with a smile. The breakfast is good enough, a little bit of everything and well presented - you cannot expect a huge buffet in such a small hotel. We would have appreciated natural orange juice at breakfast, they offer it but for a charge. The roof terrace is very nice to relax at the end of the day. Overall, highly recommended, totally deserves its Tripadvisor ranking. Don't think twice if you don't want to spent a ridiculous amount of money on going to a palace on the Bosphorus, go to Amira!!!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best in the Old City”
Reviews.Author: Rossroy62
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the old city in Istanbul. Lovely decor, staff and rooms. Great breakfast and very close to all attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Awesomeness”
Reviews.Author: RedSonya
Reviews.Content: Hotel Amira. In one word: awesome. I (a 30 year old female from the United States) recently traveled to Istanbul with one other girlfriend. We travel to different locations every year and use Trip Advisor to find local boutique hotels that will provide us with a pleasant local experience. Hotel Amira is at the top of our list of overall favorites. In a nutshell: hotel is great, location is great, rooms are great, breakfast is great, price is great, and staff is better-than-great. Would highly recommend. Hotel Itself: This hotel was just renovated and opened a few months ago. The owners did a great job of redoing the building...giving it modern amenities while maintaining (@ least the pretense) of old-school Turkish charm. The decor is very nice, and the common areas are pleasant. The dining room is big with comfy, attractive seating. There is a computer (Mac) available for anyone's use (which prints to the front desk). There is an ever-presently staffed bar with a spread of drinks (which you can order and have served to you anywhere in the hotel). And there is a great selection of provided books (from Istanbul and Turkey travel guides, to history of Turkish politics, to photographic depictions of life in Istanbul) which you can peruse @ your leisure. There is also a set of very nice public restrooms available throughout the day. Downstairs there is a spa and workout facility. We never ended up using the spa, but we did tour though it and it looked very nice. Upstairs there is terrace with a lot of comfy seating. It is gorgeous during the day and at night. They offer the services of a waiter almost continuously throughout the day, so you can always order beverages and relax in a beautiful setting. And finally, they have both stairs and an elevator, so you can choose your method of getting from one place to the next. Location: For tourists, this hotel is fabulously located. Tucked in a cute neighborhood with lots of restaurants and shops, only a 5 min walk from the Blue Mosque, Sultanhamet Square, the Hagia Sophia, the Cisterns, and Topkai Palace, the location couldn't be better for conveniently taking in the sights of Old Istanbul. Additionally, cabs pick up right outside the hotel doors, and public transport isn't too far away. So, you can also get to all the other great parts of Istanbul you'd like to explore. We ate at a couple of good restaurants in the area that had nice Turkish fare (recommended by the hotel).
