Rooms: The rooms are very nice and are stocked full of the little things that really make a boutique experience (nice hard wood floors, modern furniture pieces, comfy beds with smooth sheets, reading lights above each bed/each side of bed, great air conditioning, safe that was easy to use and effective, stocked mini-bar, a fresh water each day, a great shower with awesome temp and wonderful pressure (and two shower heads!), a fabulous jetted tub, a towel warmer, hair dryer, body scrubber, full set of adorable toiletries, robes for each person in the room, extra q-tips and cotton balls (yay ladies!), etc etc. The list goes on and on. Breakfast: The breakfast is included in your room price. And is great. Big, diverse spread. Pleasant atmosphere. Eager staff. Staff: Not sure if it's the result of a great training program or the genuine niceness of the people working at the hotel, but I left Amira feeling like I had made friends with the staff rather than just cooly interacted with them. Kudos to management for fostering such a great employee presentation. There was @ least one person staffing the front desk 24 hours a day. And the Staffer was always friendly and upbeat (as opposed to some hotels where they make you feel guilty after coming in at a certain time). As single girls in a foreign country it was nice knowing that we could go out @ night and come back to someone waiting up for us at the hotel! They gave us a personal, pleasant, and on-time wake-up call each morning. They ordered all of our cabs for us, and even went so far so to tell the driver exactly where we wanted to go, equip us with a business card so the cabbie would know where to bring us upon our return, and tell us, in advance, how much the cab would be. They were never wrong. Special Mentions: Arthur was our main during-the-day front desk man and he was great...warm, friendly and informative. Emre, our main late-night-man, was sweet as pie and always (@ least seemingly!) very happy to see us. And Ferhat, our smile-all-the-time man, made our days with his ever-present adorable cheese. It's a rare occasion that I can say a hotel positively contributed to my overall travel experience, but Hotel Amira definitely did.

Reviews.Title: “An incredible hotel - amazing rooms, staff, location and price!”
Reviews.Author: raniy99
Reviews.Content: My stay at Hotel Amira could not have been better. Here are the highlights: Location - the hotel is walking distance to everything in the old city area of Istanbul. Super convenient! Hotel itself - beautiful boutique style hotel with lovely furnishings, a gorgeous roof deck with views of the river. The style of the hotel is really fantastic and it opened just a few months ago so everything is new. Staff - probably the nicest staff i've ever met, even better than 5 star hotels i've stayed in for work that are 10 times the cost. They were always happy to help us with all requests and even let us store our luggage for 3 days when we left to take a trip outside of Istanbul. Value - the hotel was super reasonably priced compare to others in the area and the breakfast that was included was really great - wonderful variety and a great way to start the day! I've never reviewed a hotel on a website before, but Hotel Amira was so outstanding, i had to post about it!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Amira,a pearl in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: Bente50LosCristianos
Reviews.Content: A fantastic place to stay with the perfect staff! We come back to Hotel Amira! Bente and Fred

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: firefly808
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a perfect base for all the sightseeing Turkey has to offer. The staff were beyond helpful. We had the warmest welcome and were given lots of great recommendations for sights, tours and restaurants. I will definitely return next time I'm in Istanbul. A wonderful boutique hotel in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Amira ! A Miracle :)”
Reviews.Author: Fasay
Reviews.Content: I came with this idea that it will be very good, because I have been advised by a professional in the hotel industry about this new hotel. So I had very high expectations. I was not disappointed! We traveled all day long by car from Bulgaria with a 3 years old child. We were very tired and confused but when we arrived in the hotel we felt the good atmosphere, the relax vibes, peace and quiet in the heart of very busy Istanbul. It's not only that the hotel is just perfect, the rooms and bathrooms are huge, clean, new, trendy, elegant, the breakfast is fresh, tasty, varied, with great atmosphere, the terrace is great to relax and have a drink in the evening. Somebody has been thinking with great attention to every detail to make a great place to stay! But what is truly amazing is the service. We've been welcome with a fresh drink. We had a reserved place for the car. The welcome was with perfect English, no communication problem at all. Even the manager came to welcome in a Sunday evening. You can see that this attention is for every guest. Here there is no cold distant and standard politesse that you get from most of the 5 stars hotel. They are really listening to you. Probably because there is so few rooms and customers they are able to offer you a personalized and unique service, give you advice where to eat, shop, how to travel. This is true hospitality and in such a huge city... you feel good and secure. We came back to the hotel 2 weeks later after a trip in Turkey in our way home and were so pleased again! Next time we visit Istanbul there is no doubt that we will come again and we recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Staying at Hotel Amira was pure joy for all the senses!”
Reviews.Author: santababs
Reviews.Content: From our airport transfer and welcome cocktail to dinner reservations at Reina and a beautiful Bosphorus cruise, our stay at Hotel Amira was simply flawless. As two women traveling to Turkey for the first time we had some concerns about the language and cultural barriers...but the warm and friendly staff at Amira erased all of that and we felt completely at home instantly....and whatever doubts they didn't manage to assuage in the first five minutes, the jacuzzi bathtub and rain shower completely washed away! (They even provide a lovely scrub mitt which I used though out my entire trip) The bathroom was so nice we didnt need to relax in the wellness center tho it was really appealing! The rooms and decor of the hotel in general were an elegant blend of traditional Turkish luxury with 'state of the art' quality functionality....the beds were sooo comfortable! And the breakfast buffet was also a delicious blend of typical Turkish fare with some hearty ham and eggs, roasted potatoes and even pancakes one day but with the traditional sesame and molasses syrup...yum! Oh yeah...and the best AC ever!! We love Amira and want to go back again soon!

Reviews.Title: “A true boutique hotel in the heart of old Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: SMeleskie
Reviews.Content: This new boutique hotel in the heart of Sultanahmet is poised to become THE hot spot for trendy travelers. The rooms were spectacular; modern, clean and immaculate. The staff is professional, young, hip, and extremely helpful. The location is amazing: a 5 min walk to the Blue Mosque (which you can see from the rooftop lounge), Aya Sofya, Toplaki Palace, and Sultanahmet tramway station. The only knock I would give the Amira would be that they aren't the Hot Spot yet - so charging hotspot prices for food and drink was a little annoying (10 bucks for a beer in a can is a bit much). The rooftop lounge has beautiful views, but it's missing a bar, music, and staff... Still, room prices are extremely affordable for the quality of stay. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Family friendly, great location, beautiful decor - couldn't ask for more!”
Reviews.Author: Seima
Reviews.Content: We have been to many top rated hotels in our time, but none are as memorable as this one! We would love to go again at some point and would most certainly recommend anyone travelling to Istanbul to stay at Amira Hotel. The staff were friendly and responsive to all our needs. I can honestly say that we felt the staff went above and beyond their call of duty in ensuring we had a comfortable stay and we were very sad to leave. In addition, The hotel decor is beautiful, the breakfast is delicious and it is situated in a perfect location - just walking distance from the majority of tourist places in Istanbul and the tram line. A massive thank you to all at Amira Hotel for the fond memories we will take away with us of Istanbul courtesy of you and we hope to keep in touch and see you again soon.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: 00Mark
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel - location, amenities and service are all excellent. However, note if you book the suite as seen on the website, make sure it is the room that they give you. I had to work quite hard to convince the manager that I was not in the right room. They compensated me generously as a result, but it should not have been so difficult to get them to see their error. Will definitely come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Amira is a welcoming "boutique hotel"!!”
Reviews.Author: plan2explore
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Amira is a wonderful place to stay. From the moment we walked through the front door, we were made to feel like we were their favorite guests!! The staff is competent and go the extra mile to make your stay as pleasant and hassle free as can be. The rooms were lovey, new and extremely clean. The welcome cocktail, robe and slippers, water bottles, mini bar and Jacuzzi tub were nice amenities. We stayed for five nights and the breakfast buffet never became monotonous. We loved the variety as there was something for everyone. The coffee is very very good. There are hot and cold items to choose from. Thank you Arthur and fellow staff for your warm, heartfelt hospitality!

Reviews.Title: “Everything is Extraordinary!”
Reviews.Author: AmazingRacerWannabe
Reviews.Content: We arrived late one evening at the Istanbul airport and were greeted by the shuttle service the hotel had arranged. When we got to the hotel we were in awe the moment we walked in. The hotel is new and beautiful. We were greeted with free refreshments. Our rooms were lovely and there were so many special details like the robes, slippers, pictures and lighting. The hotel breakfast had so much to offer. It maybe was the best breakfast offering we have ever seen. We especially liked all of the fresh fruit and dried figs. But as much as I have to say about the design and convenience of the hotel, it is all of the staff at this hotel that makes it truly an exceptional place to stay. From the guys that help with the luggage, to the bartender, to the breakfast girl, to the extraordinary front desk staff, these people go above and beyond what is necessary to make a visit to Istanbul the best it can be. It is the ultimate in reminding me why I stay in smaller hotels, because the staff and hotel experience become part of the overall experience of the city. After a months worth of traveling in Greece and Turkey, this hotel gets our highest marks. Thanks to all at the hotel and keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: lsm53
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Amira at 9:30am and we were welcomed to the hotel with refreshments on the roof top terrace and offered a complimentary breakfast. The staff at the front desk and breakfast buffet were always very helpful and pleasant. Our room was clean and comfortable and the bathroom was modern and also very clean. I would recommend this hotel to anyone coming to Istanbul and will gladly stay there again when I return to Istanbul. Free wi-fi in your room as well as a computer in the breakfast area.

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice!”
Reviews.Author: Skiruta
Reviews.Content: We liked everything in Amira Hotel - first of all friendly and very professional service and, of course, other things too - very good breakfast, beautiful terrace, location and total positive atmosphere of the Hotel. In our trip in Turkey we used three different hotels and I with pleasure want to say that Amira is the best one. Natalia Skiruta

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique Hotel with Friendly, Helpful & Knowledgeable Staff”
Reviews.Author: ambi78
Reviews.Content: My husband and I checked into the Hotel Amira Istanbul after a taxing 48 hours in multiple ferries and hospitals in Greece, dealing with a ferry strike and a friendâ€™s broken leg. The hotel was an oasis after this ordeal, which was bright and airy, modern and new. We were greeted warmly by the staff upon arrival, and given a brief orientation of the city and tour of the hotel. The rooms are chic, spacious and unique â€“ each with hand-painted ceilings, sleek furniture and modernized paintings of old Istanbul. The bathroom was well equipped with a Jacuzzi tub and an excellent shower. As other reviewers have mentioned, everything in the hotel is very clean and new, making it feel as though you are the first guest to be in your room. The hotel breakfast buffet is quite extensive, with an array of local cheeses, meats, olives, fruits, pastries and breads to choose from. Hot items, such as eggs and sausages are also offered. In addition, the hotel has a full bar and an a la carte menu. The food selection and quality, especially for a hotel of its size, was quite impressive. Location-wise, the hotel is a well situated in the Sultanahmet neighborhood, a safe, residential area with charming cobblestone streets and old wooden houses. It is within a 5-10 minute walk of key tourist sites (e.g., Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia), but far enough away you can enjoy peace and quiet when you want to relax. Whenever we needed a taxi, there were always a few ready and waiting outside the hotel. The staff was very helpful, polite and kind to us during our stay. Most of the staff are fluent in English, and were more than happy to help out whenever we needed a dinner reservation, sightseeing advice or travel assistance. In many cases, I felt as though the staff went out of their way to make us feel welcome and ensure we were enjoying our stay. The fact the hotel is family run, shows in their warmth and hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Hotel”
Reviews.Author: charlie2407
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Amira is within walking distance of many of the major attractions. The hotel service was excellent, as was the breakfast and room. I did not try the fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Family Boutique Hotel in the Old Town”
Reviews.Author: FunkyTravellerDubai
Reviews.Content: We just arrived back from our trip to Istanbul - we were visiting for the Sonisphere Festival and for the first part we stayed in the old part of Istanbul at Hotel Amira. The welcome was lovely and we were given all the information and advice for the tourist areas and sights to see. The hotel is wonderfully positioned for all of the tourist attractions, and just a stone's throw away from the Blue Mosque for example. Great staff, very helpful and lovely modern, clean rooms with excellent bathrooms. This is a family owned and run hotel, and they definitely make sure that they look after you! I had massages in the small spa which was excellent and the breakfast buffet was always enjoyable. We would definitely return to this hotel and suggest to any travellers to stay here if you want somewhere intimate and great value for money without losing out on your luxury!

Reviews.Title: “Very memorable experience - The Hotel Amira”
Reviews.Author: Crowsnest49
Reviews.Content: This was the first time my colleagues and I stayed at the Hotel Amira. We found the hotel excellent. Rooms, service, location were outstanding. We highly recommend the Hotel Amira for all travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Ammazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: RayMofty
Reviews.Content: I realy don't know what to say and where to start!! The hotel is ammazing, so clean, a state of ART. The location was ammazing near to most of the attraction like the blue mosque, ata sophia, sultan ahmet and the trem station. The value was ammazing compared to the 5 star hotel which were highly expensive in Istanbul. The staff are ammazing each one of them knew good English compared to the other people where it was hard to communicate with them. And in the end I would to thank all the staff and specialy Farahat who made our stay a gret one which will never be forgoten.
